commentary.comment: Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Niko Kovac is forced to make a change. Marc Stendera is unable to continue due to injury, Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
A yellow card for a tackle by Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt). Christian Dingert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
The foul by Sebastian Kerk (Nurnberg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.
Anis Ben-Hatira comes off the pitch to be replaced by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:1. He was ably assisted there by Mijat Gacinovic.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Timothy Chandler leaves the pitch and Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Miso Brecko (Nurnberg) for a heavy challenge.
Here is a change. Sebastian Kerk is going off and Rene Weiler gives the last tactical orders to Danny Blum (Nurnberg).
Substitution. Rurik Gislason (Nurnberg) replaces Ondrej Petrak.
Christian Dingert rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
It will be a substitution. Even Hovland (Nurnberg) is ready to enter the pitch as Laszlo Sepsi walks off.
Niclas Fullkrug (Nurnberg) misses a big chance as his shot goes wide of the left post.
Lukas Hradecky (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card.
Guido Burgstaller (Nurnberg) attempts to discuss the decision with Christian Dingert, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card.
Christian Dingert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and the ball hits Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt), who finds the back of his own net. 0:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Raphael Schafer (Nurnberg) disagrees with the decision of the referee and is given a yellow card.
Substitution. Stefan Aigner will be replaced by Anis Ben-Hatira (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the bottom left corner.
Substitution. Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) on for Alexander Meier.
Rene Weiler has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Danny Blum (Nurnberg) replacing Sebastian Kerk.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Mijat Gacinovic.
Niclas Fullkrug will be replaced by Even Hovland (Nurnberg).
Here is a change. Tim Leibold is going off and Rene Weiler gives the last tactical orders to Rurik Gislason (Nurnberg).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.

Nabil Bahoui (Hamburger) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.

Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Tom Mickel pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards the roof of the net, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper with a stunning save. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg have been awarded a corner kick.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Christoph Janker (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
GOAL! Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) stands over the free kick and from 21 metres out curls the ball into the right side of the net. Excellent free kick!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.
Florian Meyer shows the yellow card to Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Tom Mickel hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Philipp Max (Augsburg) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
Goal! Michael Gregoritsch gets up really well from the corner and heads the ball into the six-yard box where Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) glances a header into the net. 1:2.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Jan Moravek and he is replaced by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
A substitution has been made. Pierre-Michel Lasogga goes off and Batuhan Altintas (Hamburger) comes on.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
A yellow card for a tackle by Batuhan Altintas (Hamburger). Florian Meyer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Goal 1:3! Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
That will be all from Dominik Kohr who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) replaces Nabil Bahoui.
Bruno Labbadia is forced to make a change. Cleber is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
We are about to witness a substitution. Alex Manninger (Augsburg) is replacing Marwin Hitz.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
What a chance that is! Dario Lezcano swings the ball into the box, and Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the right post.
Goal! Dario Lezcano feeds Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 0:1.
Roberto Hilbert is being substituted because of an injury. Roger Schmidt sends Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen) on the pitch.
What an opportunity! Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) wins the ball from the resulting set piece and unleashes a precise shot from inside the goal area which goes just over the crossbar!
Goal! Julian Brandt provides Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a strike into the middle of the goal. 1:1.
Goal! Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Chance! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) was in a good position inside the box, but he couldn't connect with the pass as it was overhit.
Guido Winkmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Substitution. Dario Kresic walks off the pitch and David Yelldell (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
It's in the back of the net! Karim Bellarabi sprays a pass out to Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:1.
Substitution. Mathew Leckie makes way for Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Robert Bauer and he is replaced by Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt).
Substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) in, Stefan Kiessling out.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps into a tackle and Guido Winkmann blows his whistle for a foul. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Ingolstadt!
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) is going to take the penalty!
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) has a sight of goal and fires from the edge of the box, but his strike rattles the left post!
Unbelievable miss! Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar!
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) shoots from inside the box after his amazing individual effort. He beats the goalkeeper, but hits one of the defending players and it bounces away.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) was quite harsh and Guido Winkmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Orjan Nyland is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Good work from Bayer Leverkusen as they win a corner.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save.
A substitution has been made. Almog Cohen is replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) delivers a fine lofted cross into the penalty area, but it's cleared by an opposing player.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets a shot away from inside the box and the effort is deflected past the goalkeeper. 1:0.

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the roof of the net. Ron-Robert Zieler is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Close! Iver Fossum (Hannover) is a whisker away from finishing-off the move he started. His close-range effort flies just over the bar.
GOAL - 2:0! Kingsley Coman found Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Ron-Robert Zieler off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) leaps high to meet a lofted pass near the penalty spot, but his header rattles the left post!
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) wastes a huge opportunity after receiving a fine cross from the free kick, but his close-range shot goes well wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Knut Kircher has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
The substitution is prepared. Sven Ulreich (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Manuel Neuer.
Goal! Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the left post. It's 3:0.
Felix Klaus (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Knut Kircher didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Edgar Prib (Hannover) accepted an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashed a decent strike towards the top right corner of the goal. The goalkeeper, however, was alert and thwarted the effort. The referee points to the corner flag and Hannover will take a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Rafinha (Bayern Munich) replaces Kingsley Coman.
Daniel Stendel has decided to substitute Valmir Sulejmani and he is replaced by Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover).
Edgar Prib (Hannover) does well to meet a cross from Iver Fossum, but he directs his shot just wide of the left post.
Goal! Ceyhun Gulselam puts a cross into the box and finds Artur Sobiech (Hannover), who latches on to it and strikes the ball low into the middle of the net. He makes it 3:1.
Sven Ulreich was forced into action to thwart Edgar Prib (Hannover). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot towards the roof of the net but couldn't beat the keeper.
Substitution. Felix Klaus is replaced by Tim Dierssen (Hannover).
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Substitution. Jerome Boateng walks off the pitch and Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) produces a promising shot towards the top left corner after his wonderful solo effort, but Ron-Robert Zieler thwarts him and the score remains the same. Bayern Munich force a corner. They send men into the box.
Knut Kircher is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

What a chance that is! Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the crossbar!

An amazing individual effort from Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball low into the middle of the goal and makes it 0:1. Lukasz Zaluska was helpless.
What was Felix Platte (Darmstadt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Peter Sippel has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Dirk Schuster probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Mario Vrancic. He is replaced by Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt).

An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Darmstadt.
Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Peter Sippel had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Ibrahima Traore leaves the pitch and is replaced by Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach).

Goal! Patrick Herrmann clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach), who gets on the end of it and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the right side of the goal. Lukasz Zaluska had no chance of stopping that. 0:2.
We are about to witness a substitution. Marco Sailer (Darmstadt) is replacing Konstantin Rausch.
Andre Schubert decides to make a substitution. Thorgan Hazard will be replaced by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach).
Fabian Holland (Darmstadt) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and B. Monchengladbach will have a goal kick.
A substitution has been made. Granit Xhaka goes off and Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Dirk Schuster prepares a substitution. Marcel Heller is replaced by Milan Ivana (Darmstadt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Nice piece of skill by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund). He perfectly collected a pass from Marcel Schmelzer, then unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went inside the left post. The score is 1:0.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target.

Marcel Risse is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Anthony Modeste (Koln) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the middle of the goal to make the score 1:1.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar.
Goal! Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) picks up a pass and gets to the edge of the box before clipping a brilliant lob over the goalkeeper and into the empty net. He makes it 1:2.
Sokratis (Dortmund) is booked.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Thomas Tuchel makes a half-time substitution. Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) comes on in place of Sven Bender.
A substitution has been made. Shinji Kagawa is replaced by Moritz Leitner (Dortmund).
Here comes a substitution. Milos Jojic is given a rest as he is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Koln).

Marco Reus (Dortmund) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight into the top right corner. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
Simon Zoller (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Leonardo Bittencourt.
Here is a change. Julian Weigl is going off and Thomas Tuchel gives the last tactical orders to Erik Durm (Dortmund).
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) replaces Pawel Olkowski.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) meets a perfect cross from Younes Belhanda deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Jens Grahl is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 0:2.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the roof of the net, but Jens Grahl is prepared and leaps to thwart him. The linesman makes the right call and Schalke will have a corner.
Goal - 1:2! Tarik Elyounoussi laid the ball off to Mark Uth (Hoffenheim), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Leroy Sane (Schalke) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his low effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Jens Grahl.
Leroy Sane (Schalke) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Pirmin Schwegler goes off the pitch and Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Leroy Sane (Schalke) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the right side of the goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Jens Grahl.
Here's the change. Tobias Strobl leaves the pitch and Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

That was a nice football moment. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the left post. Ralf Fahrmann guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! The ball goes out of play. Hoffenheim are awarded a corner kick.
Today's match ends for Leroy Sane who will be replaced by Alessandro Schopf (Schalke).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) replaces Kevin Volland.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Ralf Fahrmann makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal. The ball is out of play and Hoffenheim manage to earn a corner.
It is time for a substitution. Marco Hoger (Schalke) is on for Max Meyer.
It's an own goal! Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) unluckily beats his own goalkeeper.
The manager makes a subsitution with Alexander Nubel (Schalke) coming on for Ralf Fahrmann.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.

Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the left side of the goal, but it wasn't dangerous and Rune Jarstein made a comfortable save.

Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and drills a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Rune Jarstein, who makes a glorious save!

Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a lofted pass from the resulting free kick and pulls the trigger from around the penalty spot. His effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by one of the defenders. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin have been awarded a corner kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz). Sascha Stegemann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) gets to the rebound outside the box and doesn't hesitate to shoot on goal. It was a promising attempt, but one of the defending players got in the way and blocked it.

What a chance that is! Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
What a huge chance for Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sascha Stegemann has ended it.
Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just wide of the right post.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Loris Karius makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Giulio Donati (Mainz) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sascha Stegemann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) for his blatant foul.
That's the end of the game for Peter Pekarik, who is replaced by Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) replaces Valentin Stocker.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Yunus Malli will be replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).
Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle and Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Clemens leaves the pitch and Jairo Samperio (Mainz) comes on.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) collects a rebound and produces a mid-range attempt. The ball goes to the bottom right corner, but Loris Karius keeps it out with an amazing save.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!
Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card from Sascha Stegemann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The game has come to an end for Jhon Cordoba. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Elkin Soto (Mainz).
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Substitution. Constant Djakpa leaves the pitch and is replaced by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Maximilian Eggestein is replaced by Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen).
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Anis Ben-Hatira.
Substitution. Levin Oztunali makes way for Ozkan Yildirim (Werder Bremen).
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Ozkan Yildirim (Werder Bremen) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Stefan Aigner.
Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
That's a clear yellow card. Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) goes into the book.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The substitution is prepared. Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Claudio Pizarro.
Yellow card. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Marcel Schafer puts a cross into the box and finds Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the roof of the net. He makes it 1:0.
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri plays it to Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Mitchell Langerak. 2:0.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Timo Werner as he is replaced by Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart).
What was Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Mitchell Langerak pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The linesman makes the right call and Wolfsburg will have a corner.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Wolfsburg.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Artem Kravets is replaced by Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart).
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) will replace Max Kruse.
Here is a change. Daniel Caligiuri is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg).
That will be all from Paul Seguin who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch for Matthias Zimmermann.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) converts the free kick from about 25 metres out with a perfectly bent shot that ends up inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. What a shot!

Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the middle of the goal, but Mitchell Langerak was alert and made an amazing save! The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Wolfsburg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The game has begun to heat up. Dante (Wolfsburg) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.

Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Koen Casteels to dive and make a save. The ball is out of play. Stuttgart will have a chance to score from a corner.
Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Fantastic team goal! Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) was set free in the area by Julian Draxler and fired past Mitchell Langerak. 3:1.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) squanders a great opportunity after striking the ball onto the post!

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Yann Sommer to get hold of the ball.
Fantastic team goal! Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) was set free in the area by Chicharito and fired past Yann Sommer. 0:1.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
What a wasted opportunity by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach)! He unleashed a powerful low shot from the centre of the box, but Bernd Leno makes a decent save to thwart him.
Goal! Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Christoph Kramer is replaced by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen).
Today's referee Bastian Dankert rightly decides to book Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) for his harsh tackle.
A yellow card for a tackle by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
That will be all from Mahmoud Dahoud who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) volleyed the ball inside the left post without any problems. Unstoppable blast from deep inside the penalty box.
Andre Schubert has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Ibrahima Traore.
Here comes a substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Hakan Calhanoglu.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change. Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Omer Toprak.
A substitution has been made. Raffael goes off and Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
The foul by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

It's a goal! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Makoto Hasebe and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Roman Burki was helpless.
The expression of the referee Daniel Siebert is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card.
Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.
The foul by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Daniel Siebert.
The end of the first half.
Daniel Siebert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Thomas Tuchel makes a switch. Sokratis (Dortmund) is coming on in place of Erik Durm at the start of the second period.

Mats Hummels (Dortmund) shows good awareness deep inside the box and jumps high to meet a perfect cross from the set piece. He steers a fine header goalwards, but finds the keeper prepared. No doubt about the wonderful save that he made.
The game has come to an end for Anis Ben-Hatira. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Here is a change. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is going off and Thomas Tuchel gives the last tactical orders to Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).
Here comes a substitution. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Mats Hummels.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads under the crossbar, but is stopped by a great save from Lukas Hradecky.
A yellow card for a tackle by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Luc Castaignos and he is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Stefan Aigner.
Today's referee Daniel Siebert rightly decides to book Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Dominic Maroh (Koln) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires a low shot from the edge of the box to the middle of the goal, but Felix Wiedwald is equal to it.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Yannick Gerhardt comes off for Kevin Vogt (Koln).
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Peter Stoger gives a chance to Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) and Simon Zoller is off.
Jonas Hector (Koln) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Felix Wiedwald. The ball is out of play. FC Koln will have a chance to score from a corner.
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt will be replaced by Marcel Hartel (1. FC Koln).
Today's match ends for Levin Oztunali who will be replaced by Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen).

It's unbelievable, Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) blows a huge opportunity! He is totally unmarked and fires a first-time shot towards goal from a few yards out, but Felix Wiedwald reacts superbly to keep the ball out. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for FC Koln.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Santiago Garcia is being substituted because of an injury. Viktor Skripnik sends Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) on the pitch.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Felix Wiedwald guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

What a great touch by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. Werder Bremen have been awarded a corner kick.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just wide of the left post.
The game has come to an end for Claudio Pizarro. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Benjamin Brand blows his whistle to start the second half.
Dieter Hecking is forced to make a change. Christian Trasch is unable to continue due to injury, Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga is replaced by Ivica Olic (Hamburger).

Ivica Olic (Hamburger) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Ivica Olic (Hamburger). This could have been a legendary goal.
What a great touch by Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) as he controls a fine pass into the box and fires the ball to the left post, but the effort is brilliantly blocked.
Goal! The resulting corner is whipped into the box and Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) buries the ball into the back of the net from a Naldo knock down. 0:1.
Substitution. Michael Gregoritsch walks off the pitch and Nabil Bahoui (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Marcel Schafer will be replaced by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
Lewis Holtby goes off the pitch and Cleber (Hamburger) comes on.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Max Kruse walks off the pitch to be replaced by Bas Dost (Wolfsburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it! The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim). Wolfgang Stark doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Salif Sane (Hannover), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Goal! Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) gets a shot away from inside the box and the effort is deflected past the goalkeeper. 1:0.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches wide of the left post.
Today's referee Wolfgang Stark rightly decides to book Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Julian Nagelsmann probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Mark Uth. He is replaced by Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) replacing Eugen Polanski.
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Wolfgang Stark didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Today's match ends for Hiroshi Kiyotake who will be replaced by Edgar Prib (Hannover).
The substitution is prepared. Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sebastian Rudy.
That will be all from Artur Sobiech who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Szalai (Hannover).
Edgar Prib (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Wolfgang Stark ignores the protests.
The manager makes a subsitution with Christian Schulz (Hannover) coming on for Felix Klaus.
Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the crossbar. Aim better, sir.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

Maximilian Mittelstadt sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.

Goal! Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. Marcel Heller assisted in the goal. 1:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Mario Vrancic goes off the pitch and Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) comes on.
A yellow card for a tackle by Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Fabian Lustenberger cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch for Genki Haraguchi.
Dirk Schuster has decided to substitute Konstantin Rausch and he is replaced by Felix Platte (Darmstadt).
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) gets booked for the first time in this match.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Felix Platte (Darmstadt), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.
What a goal! Jerome Gondorf plays it to Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Rune Jarstein. 1:2.
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Vladimir Darida is replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) gets a yellow card.
The yellow card goes to Rune Jarstein (Hertha Berlin).
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) receives a yellow card from Felix Brych and because it's his second he will have an early bath.
Substitution. Benjamin Gorka (Darmstadt) has come on for Marcel Heller.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Florian Meyer signals. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Bayern Munich.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the right side of the goal.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) makes a driving run into the box but he cannot work any space for a shot.
What a huge chance for Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Goal! Xabi Alonso produces a great pass that finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
Manuel Neuer pulls off a great save to deny Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner. Ingolstadt win a corner.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his shot towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle after Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for Ingolstadt.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) is going to take the penalty!
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!
Florian Meyer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Florian Meyer blows his whistle to start the second half.
Xabi Alonso is being substituted because of an injury. Pep Guardiola sends Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) on the pitch.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) makes a yard for himself and unleashes a stunning shot from 23 metres out. His great effort, however, goes painfully wide of the right post.
Substitution. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) replaces Franck Ribery.
What a chance for Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Ramazan Ozcan guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Here is a change. Almog Cohen is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt).
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.
Florian Meyer shows the yellow card to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Moritz Hartmann makes his way off the pitch and Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) comes on as his replacement.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Dario Lezcano walks off the pitch and Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) comes on as a substitute.
The foul by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Florian Meyer.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Florian Meyer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Here comes a substitution. Thiago Alcantara is given a rest as he is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
What a big chance! Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Joel Matip (Schalke) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!

Max Meyer (Schalke) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Marwin Hitz pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Ja-Cheol Koo is being substituted because of an injury. Markus Weinzierl sends Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) on the pitch.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) lashes in a mid-range free kick and his effort crashes against the left post. That was an excellent shot, but unfortunately for him it didn't end up in the back of the net.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
What a chance that is! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Leon Goretzka (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) is given a yellow card.
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
A substitution has been made. Philipp Max is replaced by Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Benedikt Howedes and he is replaced by Junior Caicara (Schalke).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) will replace Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the left post is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.

It's a goal! Junior Caicara plays the ball to the feet of Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), who hits a tremendous first-time shot into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was unable to keep it out. 1:0.
Here's the change. Max Meyer leaves the pitch and Johannes Geis (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Here is a change. Christoph Janker is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Brilliant finish! Daniel Baier (Augsburg) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Dominik Kohr, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Philip Heise takes aim and his effort deflects off Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) to beat the goalkeeper. 1:0.

Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the left post. Mitchell Langerak guesses his intentions and denies him with a fine save.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) gets a yellow card.
The yellow card is received by Niko Bungert (Mainz).
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and shoots at goal from near the penalty spot, but his effort only hits the bar!
It's in the back of the net! Karim Onisiwo is the provider as he slips the ball to Yunus Malli (Mainz) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:1.
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) sees his header crash off the left post after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) picks up a yellow card.

A perfect lofted pass from Fabian Frei finds Jhon Cordoba (Mainz), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Mitchell Langerak had no chance of stopping that. 1:1.
We are about to witness a substitution. Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) is replacing Christian Gentner.

Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Mitchell Langerak makes a great save to stop his effort.

Christian Clemens (Mainz) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Mitchell Langerak guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Deniz Aytekin rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart).
The manager makes a subsitution with Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Daniel Schwaab.

This was a piece of cake for Mitchell Langerak. Yunus Malli (Mainz) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Goal! Jhon Cordoba rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Karim Onisiwo (Mainz), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 1:3.

Mitchell Langerak pulls off a great save to deny Yunus Malli (Mainz), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. Good work from Mainz as they win a corner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Christian Clemens walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jairo Samperio (Mainz).
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Yunus Malli and he is replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) produced a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Mitchell Langerak thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) is punished with the yellow card.
It will be a substitution. Pierre Bengtsson (Mainz) is ready to enter the pitch as Jhon Cordoba walks off.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Claudio Pizarro passes the ball into the penalty area. Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) collects it and quickly sends it into the bottom right corner via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:0!
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) gets a shot from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar!

Stunning strike! Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a precise through ball from Alexandru Maxim before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the back of the net from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 1:1.
It's an own goal! An unlucky moment for Federico Barba (VfB Stuttgart), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but heads the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 1:1.
Sambou Yatabare is being substituted because of an injury. Viktor Skripnik sends Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) on the pitch.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the left post!
Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) creates some space for himself just outside the penalty area after getting on the end of an amazing pass and smashes the ball into the back of the net!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Daniel Didavi as he is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick low shot towards the middle of the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows Felix Wiedwald to make a comfortable save.
The match has reached half-time.
Felix Brych blows his whistle and the second half starts.
What a goal! Alexandru Maxim swings a cross into the box and Federico Barba (VfB Stuttgart) scores a magnificent back-heel goal! 3:2.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mart Ristl (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch so that Federico Barba can be given a rest.
Goal! Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 4:2. He was ably assisted there by Zlatko Junuzovic.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Przemyslaw Tyton leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Goal! Levin Oztunali puts the ball on a plate for Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 5:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Lukas Rupp.
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Claudio Pizarro is replaced by Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen).
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball low inside the left post.
The substitution has been made. Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) has replaced Zlatko Junuzovic.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
What a chance that is! Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and coolly buries the ball low inside the right post.
Goal! The ball from the resulting free kick arrives at the feet of Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box, and he fires a lovely shot into the right side of the goal.
It's in the back of the net! Peter Pekarik puts the ball on a plate for Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 2:1.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Rune Jarstein.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) fires the resulting free kick on goal from a medium range, but sees his shot saved by the goalkeeper.

Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
The foul by Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a mid-range direct free kick, but sees his strike well saved by the goalkeeper.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Tobias Stieler starts the second half.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) takes the free kick but it is cleared by the first defender. The ball goes out for a corner. Bayer Leverkusen can continue in their attacking effort.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Rune Jarstein made an astonishing save!
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) takes the corner, but the goalkeeper jumps and gathers the ball.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Salomon Kalou walks off the pitch to be replaced by Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin).

Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) starts an individual run, not looking to pass to a teammate, and easily weaves through the defence to get deep inside the box. He shoots low, but misses the goal by a whisker!

What a chance that is! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Bernd Leno is alert and denies him.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) latched on to a cross inside the six-yard box and headed at goal. If it wasn't for one of the defenders making a save on the goal line, he would have been celebrating a goal now.

Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests.
It will be a substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is ready to enter the pitch as Julian Brandt walks off.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) replaces Per Skjelbred.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) produced a promising shot towards the bottom right corner after his wonderful solo run, but Rune Jarstein thwarted him with a fabulous save.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) wasted a big chance to finish after the resulting free kick! He latched on to a well-placed cross deep inside the box and produced a fine header towards the net!
Today's referee Tobias Stieler rightly decides to book Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
Hakan Calhanoglu swings the cross over. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the right post.
Roger Schmidt has decided to substitute Chicharito and he is replaced by Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming onto the pitch as Hakan Calhanoglu cannot continue after picking up an injury.
A yellow card for a tackle by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Goal! Joshua Kimmich sent in a fine cross from the corner kick. The perfect pass found Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) and his bullet header from around the penalty spot went straight into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:0.
Yann Sommer pulls off a great save to block a header from Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) after a nice lofted cross.
Serdar Tasci (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.
Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Kingsley Coman, but he hits a shot just wide of the right post.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach). This could have been a legendary goal.
It's time for a substitution. Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) comes on in place of Thorgan Hazard.
The game has come to an end for Ibrahima Traore. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Pep Guardiola has decided to substitute Mario Gotze and he is replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals a substitution. David Alaba (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Jerome Boateng.
Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) produces a lovely chip pass into the box, but one of the opposition players cuts it out.
Goal! Lars Stindl tees up Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:1.

Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
Substitution. Serdar Tasci makes his way off the pitch and Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) comes on as his replacement.
A yellow card for a tackle by Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
A neat pass is well received by Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) latched on to an accurate cross inside the box and attempted to direct the ball with a nice header towards the net, but the goalkeeper reacted quickly to keep the ball out.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) coming on for Raffael.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Marcel Heller produces a great pass that finds Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a low shot into the back of the net. 1:0.
Dirk Schuster is forced to make a change. Slobodan Rajkovic is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Fabian Holland (Darmstadt).
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is penalised for holding. Manuel Grafe signals a set piece. The referee makes a call and blows his whistle for an infringement. Darmstadt are awarded a penalty.
The foul by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the bottom right corner, but Lukas Hradecky pulls off a superb save.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Niko Kovac gives a chance to Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) and Mijat Gacinovic is off.
Manuel Grafe has issued a yellow card to Christian Mathenia (Darmstadt).
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks it up in space and from the edge of the box lashes in a shot that is deflected past the helpless Christian Mathenia. 1:1.
Substitution. Mario Vrancic will be replaced by Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt).
Here comes a substitution. Marco Fabian is given a rest as he is replaced by Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Szabolcs Huszti and Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets in a shot, sending the ball low into the middle of the net. 1:2.
A yellow card for a tackle by Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Felix Platte (Darmstadt) has come on for Konstantin Rausch.
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Anis Ben-Hatira will be replaced by Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
What a hit! Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot inside the left post. 1:0.
Fantastic team goal! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) was set free in the area by Shinji Kagawa and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 2:0.

OFF THE BAR! Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Julian Weigl (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) sees a yellow card from Robert Hartmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Diego Benaglio pulls off a great save to deny Sven Bender (Dortmund) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) quickly picks up the rebound and drills the ball towards the right side of the goal. The opponent's goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him.
Fantastic team goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) was set free in the area by Adrian Ramos and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 3:0.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Lukasz Piszczek will be replaced by Erik Durm (Dortmund).

Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Diego Benaglio, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball goes out of play. Dortmund are awarded a corner kick.
A substitution has been made. Adrian Ramos goes off and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) comes on.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Julian Weigl and he is replaced by Nuri Sahin (Dortmund).

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender. Dortmund force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Arnold trots off the pitch and is replaced by Max Kruse (Wolfsburg).
Diego Benaglio pulls off a great save to deny Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) produces a shot from a direct free kick on the edge of the box. His effort sails narrowly wide of the left post. The goalkeeper was lucky there.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) leaps to meet a beautiful cross and steers a header beyond the goalkeeper and into the middle of the goal.

It's a goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) makes it 3:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Marcel Schmelzer and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Diego Benaglio was helpless.
Here is a change. Christian Trasch is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
Here comes a substitution. Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Bas Dost.
Brilliant finish! Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Max Kruse, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 5:1.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the roof of the net, but Diego Benaglio is alert and denies him with a nice save. The referee signals a corner kick to Dortmund.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Roman Burki stops the ball from going inside right post.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Felix Klaus (Hannover) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann was alert and the score remains the same. The ball goes out of play. Hannover are awarded a corner kick.

Stunning strike! Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) latches on to a precise through ball from Leon Goretzka before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the back of the net from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 0:1.
Salif Sane (Hannover) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Goal! Artur Sobiech (Hannover) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:1. He was ably assisted there by Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee.
Felix Klaus (Hannover) struck the ball which rebounded to the edge of the box. His attempt went narrowly over the crossbar.
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.

Max Meyer (Schalke) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Ron-Robert Zieler, who pulls off a comfortable save!
It's in the back of the net! Leroy Sane is the provider as he slips the ball to Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:2.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Gunter Perl blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Junior Caicara will not participate anymore and Sascha Riether (Schalke) is coming on.
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but sends his shot slightly wide of the right post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Felix Klaus will be replaced by Valmir Sulejmani (Hannover).
Substitution. Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee did his best and is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hannover).
It's time for a substitution. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) comes on in place of Max Meyer.
It's in the back of the net! Joel Matip sprays a pass out to Alessandro Schopf (Schalke), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:3.
That's the end of the game for Iver Fossum, who is replaced by Edgar Prib (Hannover).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leroy Sane departs the field of play to be replaced by Younes Belhanda (Schalke).
Gunter Perl is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
A nice lofted cross finds Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) unmarked. He takes an excellent touch and gets in a shot that goes towards the middle of the net. An easy save for the goalkeeper, though.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The foul by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) meets a perfect cross from Marvin Matip deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces a strike into the middle of the goal. The score is 0:1.
Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Bastian Dankert ignores the protests.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric plays a pass to the feet of Mark Uth (Hoffenheim), and he shoots inside the left post from inside the box. It's 1:1.
Problems for Ralph Hasenhuttl as Danny da Costa is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) replaces him.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Bastian Dankert starts the second half.
CHANCE! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a shot towards Orjan Nyland, who produces an excellent reflex save.
One of the Ingolstadt players tripped an opponent and conceded a foul. It's a penalty! Hoffenheim have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is going to take the penalty!
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) misses the penalty. He fired the ball towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulled off a tremendous diving save to deny him.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.

Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) receives a lofted pass and is given time inside the box to unleash a shot goalwards. The ball is directed towards the right side of the goal, but it lacks power and Oliver Baumann pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort. Ingolstadt force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

What a sweet touch by Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) as he collects a pass. From near the edge of the box he produces a shot which goes towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a decent save to thwart him! The ball goes out of play. Hoffenheim are awarded a corner kick.
Today's referee Bastian Dankert rightly decides to book Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
The manager makes a subsitution with Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) coming on for Philipp Ochs.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) replacing Sebastian Rudy.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Dario Lezcano makes way for Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt).

Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Oliver Baumann is alert and denies him with a nice save. Now Ingolstadt have a corner.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the top of the net. The ball goes out for a corner. Ingolstadt can continue in their attacking effort.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Eugen Polanski as he is replaced by Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim).
