Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) sends in a direct shot from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Ralph Hasenhuttl decides to make a substitution. Moritz Hartmann will be replaced by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt).
Kevin Volland feeds the ball through to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:1!
That's a clear yellow card. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) goes into the book.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) fires the ball on goal but sends it into orbit.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A yellow card for a tackle by Emir Spahic (Hamburger). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Loris Karius dived superbly to block a header by Johan Djourou (Hamburger) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the left post, but Loris Karius pulled off a remarkable save! Hamburger SV get a corner.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.

Loris Karius makes a brilliant save! Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the right side of the goal but is saved by the keeper! The ball is out of play. Hamburger SV win a corner kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Danny Latza (Mainz) replaces Suat Serdar.
Nabil Bahoui (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Jaroslav Drobny is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Sven Schipplock will be replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Pablo De Blasis is replaced by Yunus Malli (Mainz).
Nabil Bahoui comes off the pitch to be replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).

Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) finds himself some space just outside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Jaroslav Drobny pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going inside the right post.
Substitution. Christian Clemens (Mainz) on for Jairo Samperio.
What a huge chance for Jhon Cordoba (Mainz). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Cleber (Hamburger) replaces Ivo Ilicevic.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Dominic Maroh (Koln) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
What was Matthias Lehmann (Koln) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Peter Stoger makes a half-time substitution. Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) comes on in place of Yuya Osako.
Tobias Welz blows his whistle and Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
Here is a change. Tobias Werner is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
Milos Jojic (Koln) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Halil Altintop cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Tobias Welz shows the yellow card to Dominic Maroh (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.
Marcel Risse will be replaced by Pawel Olkowski (Koln).
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) takes a wonderful free kick and curls the ball into the top left corner with an absolutely phenomenal strike!
Stefan Aigner is being substituted because of an injury. Niko Kovac sends Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) on the pitch.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
It's 1:1! Anis Ben-Hatira feeds Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the left side of the net.
The referee can't ignore those comments and Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) sees a yellow card for bad language.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.

Loris Karius makes a brilliant save! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His low shot goes towards the middle of the goal but is saved by keeper!
Anis Ben-Hatira (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.
Giulio Donati (Mainz) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Substitution. Yunus Malli will be replaced by Christian Clemens (Mainz).
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the top right corner, but Loris Karius keeps the ball out. The ball goes out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a corner kick.
A substitution has been made. Suat Serdar goes off and Fabian Frei (Mainz) comes on.
Mijat Gacinovic goes off the pitch and Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Jhon Cordoba and he is replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Stefan Bell (Mainz) sends the ball into his own net after a crazy goalmouth scramble.
David Abraham will be replaced by Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Goal! Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) sent the ball towards his own goal in an attempt to intercept a pass.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the bottom right corner, but he can't get the power to direct it past Yann Sommer, who gets down to save.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) leaps like a salmon to produce a header from the resulting corner, but one of the defending players intercepts the ball and averts the danger. It will be a corner kick for B. Monchengladbach.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches wide of the right post.

What a chance that is! Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the left post!
Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) receives a killer pass and scores a great goal after finding the back of the net with a simple finish!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. His dangerous effort is blocked by Oliver Baumann, who makes a glorious save! The referee points to the corner flag and B. Monchengladbach will take a corner.
Goal - 2:1! Kevin Volland tees up Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Yann Sommer.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Oliver Baumann, who makes a comfortable save.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Oliver Baumann with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 3:1.
Substitution. Eugen Polanski is replaced by Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim).

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The linesman points to the corner flag, B. Monchengladbach are going to take it.
A substitution has been made. Mark Uth is replaced by Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim).
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Here comes a substitution. Nadiem Amiri is given a rest as he is replaced by Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim).

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the bottom left corner. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Yann Sommer makes a save in the nick of time to maintain the current score. Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ibrahima Traore.
Andre Schubert decides to make a substitution. Thorgan Hazard will be replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
It will be a substitution. Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) is ready to enter the pitch as Raffael walks off.

Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Oliver Baumann guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The ball goes out for a corner. B. Monchengladbach can continue in their attacking effort.
That's it for today, Robert Hartmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Wolfgang Stark has a clear sight and sees a foul from Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen). PENALTY! One of the players from Schalke is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Wolfgang Stark and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) misses the penalty! He fired the ball towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper pulled off a tremendous diving save to deny him. Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) picks it up in space and from the edge of the box lashes in a shot that is deflected past the helpless Bernd Leno. 1:0.
Junior Caicara (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.
Goal - 2:0! Max Meyer laid the ball off to Leroy Sane (Schalke), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Roger Schmidt is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Tin Jedvaj suffers an injury and Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Leroy Sane (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Roger Schmidt makes a switch. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on in place of Lars Bender at the start of the second period.

OFF THE POST! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) found himself some space to take a shot from just outside the box. His effort was headed to the bottom right corner, but Ralf Fahrmann came up with a save and tipped the ball onto the post.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi provides Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
OFF THE BAR! Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom left corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 2:2.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a sweet pass inside the penalty box and smashes the ball inside the left post. What a clinical finish!
Substitution. Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) leaves the pitch and is replaced by .
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a mid-range free kick and his stunning strike crashes against the crossbar.

Bernd Leno can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net. It will be a corner kick for Schalke.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Younes Belhanda (Schalke) replaces Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Ralf Fahrmann guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Substitution. Leon Goretzka (Schalke) in, Johannes Geis out.
That will be all from Roman Neustadter who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Benedikt Howedes (Schalke).
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Wolfgang Stark and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Anthony Modeste (Koln) increases the score of todays match. He unleashes a low drive towards the bottom left corner, bouncing in off the post. What a precise shot that was!
What a big chance! Yuya Osako (Koln) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Anthony Modeste (Koln) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 1:1.

A decent save by Christian Mathenia. Filip Mladenovic (1. FC Koln) finds some space near the penalty spot to meet a cross and head it down to the middle of the goal, but the effort is saved by the goalkeeper.
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) blows a clear opportunity! He needed only to tap the ball in, but narrowly misses the goal.
Goal! Frederik Sorensen produces a great pass that finds Anthony Modeste (Koln) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) misses a rebound from the penalty spot. The ball flies just a few inches over the bar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Christian Dingert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Peter Stoger makes a half-time substitution. Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln) comes on in place of Filip Mladenovic.
Marcel Risse (Koln) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Christian Mathenia is just a bystander as the ball flies under the crossbar. The score is 3:1.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the right post!
Junior Diaz (Darmstadt) outjumps his marker from the resulting set piece and produces a powerful header that crashes against the bar. Unlucky!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Yannick Gerhardt walks off the pitch to be replaced by Milos Jojic (Koln).
Dirk Schuster has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) replacing Junior Diaz.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) for a tough tackle.
Amazing piece of skill! Marcel Risse (Koln) picks up a cross on the edge of the 18-yard box and hammers the ball precisely into the bottom left corner. What a finish!

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Christian Mathenia. Now FC Koln have a corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Frederik Sorensen as he is replaced by Pawel Olkowski (Koln).
Dirk Schuster decides to make a substitution. Mario Vrancic will be replaced by Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt).
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
Dirk Schuster has decided to make a change. Felix Platte (Darmstadt) replaces Sandro Wagner.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt) for a heavy challenge.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Marco Fritz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Pal Dardai probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Vedad Ibisevic. He is replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
Goal! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) collected a pass and decided to try his luck from distance. The shot was deflected and it was enough to turn the ball past helpless Thomas Kraft. 0:1.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. David Alaba (Bayern Munich) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Rafinha walks off.
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) replacing Thomas Muller.
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Valentin Stocker will be replaced by Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin).
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.

What a beautiful moment! Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top left corner. Thomas Kraft just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:2.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Tolga Cigerci and he is replaced by Florian Kohls (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) on for Robert Lewandowski.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests.

It's a goal! Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Danny da Costa and planted his close-range header into the middle of the goal. Ron-Robert Zieler was helpless.
Sascha Stegemann shows a red card with no hesitation. Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.

Perfectly taken free kick! Pascal Gross sends the ball in, Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header low in the back of the net. It's 2:0.
What a big chance! Adam Szalai (Hannover) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sascha Stegemann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Daniel Stendel has made a change at the break. Iver Fossum (Hannover) has come on in place of Alexander Milosevic.
The foul by Adam Szalai (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.
A yellow card for a tackle by Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt). Sascha Stegemann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) picks up a pass just outside the penalty area and slams the ball inside the left post. What a wonderful goal!
That will be all from Moritz Hartmann who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
Here is a change. Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee is going off and Daniel Stendel gives the last tactical orders to Valmir Sulejmani (Hannover).
Substitution. Dario Lezcano will be replaced by Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Klaus trots off the pitch and is replaced by Edgar Prib (Hannover).
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) latches onto a cross in the penalty area and fires the ball into the bottom right corner!
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Mathew Leckie is replaced by Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt).
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) blows a clear opportunity! He sends a rebound from close range narrowly wide of the left post.
It's a goal! Henrikh Mkhitaryan plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.

Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Przemyslaw Tyton guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Clinical finish! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) finds himself some space inside the box to control a rebound and blasts a low drive into the middle of the net, leaving the goalkeeper rooted to the spot.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
A yellow card for a tackle by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
What a save from Przemyslaw Tyton! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Clinical finish! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) finds himself some space inside the box to control a rebound and fires the ball into the left side of the goal, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Lukas Rupp goes off the pitch and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Jurgen Kramny has decided to make a change. Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Emiliano Insua.

Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the left post, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop the effort.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Marco Reus walks off the pitch to be replaced by Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund).
Here is a change. Christian Pulisic is going off and Thomas Tuchel gives the last tactical orders to Moritz Leitner (Dortmund).
Federico Barba will be replaced by Philip Heise (VfB Stuttgart).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) replacing Julian Weigl.

Moritz Leitner (Dortmund) collects a pin-point pass inside the box and tries a snap shot in the vicinity of the right post, but the goalkeeper dives perfectly to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and brushes the post. That was a fantastic reflex save.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Goal - 0:1! Halil Altintop laid the ball off to Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!
Markus Weinzierl is forced to make a change. Paul Verhaegh is unable to continue due to injury, Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) comes on.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Knut Kircher starts the second half.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

That was a nice football moment. Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the roof of the net. Marwin Hitz guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
The attempt by Alfred Finnbogason is blocked but, from the middle of the box Halil Altintop (Augsburg) hits the rebound into the centre of the goal. He alters the score to 0:2.
Substitution. Daniel Baier will be replaced by Markus Feulner (Augsburg).
Here is a change. Luiz Gustavo is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Here comes a substitution. Ricardo Rodriguez is given a rest as he is replaced by Leandro Putaro (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Daniel Caligiuri makes his way off the pitch and Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Halil Altintop will be replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) scores after an assist by Nicolai Muller that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.

Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Jaroslav Drobny is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. The referee points to the corner flag and Werder Bremen will take a corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Felix Wiedwald pulls off a fantastic save! Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out.

Matthias Ostrzolek showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 2:0.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Jaroslav Drobny hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Werder Bremen get a corner.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The game is over for Nicolai Muller. Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) comes on for the second half.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) earns the yellow card.
A player from Hamburger SV takes his opponent down, the referee blows his whistle for a foul. No point in arguing there. Werder Bremen will take a penalty kick.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the bottom left corner. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Jaroslav Drobny to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
It will be a substitution. Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) is ready to enter the pitch as Sambou Yatabare walks off.
Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) aims for the middle of the goal, but that's an easy job for the goalkeeper. It will take more than that to test him!

Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Jaroslav Drobny, who pulls off a stunning save!
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the right post!
A substitution has been made. Santiago Garcia goes off and Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.
Bruno Labbadia decides to make a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch will be replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Jaroslav Drobny (Hamburger).
The referee signals a substitution. Cleber (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Ivo Ilicevic.
Here is a change. Florian Grillitsch is going off and Viktor Skripnik gives the last tactical orders to Lukas Frode (Werder Bremen).
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) is booked for saying more than Manuel Grafe was willing to tolerate.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) wasted a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Mergim Mavraj (Koln) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Perfectly taken free kick! Daniel Brosinski sends a cross in and Leon Balogun (Mainz) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the bottom left corner and the score changes to 2:0.
Danny Latza will be replaced by Fabian Frei (Mainz).
Substitution. Simon Zoller did his best and is replaced by Milos Jojic (Koln).
Here is a change. Dominique Heintz is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln).

Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 2:1.
Yellow card. Giulio Donati (Mainz) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Christian Clemens (Mainz) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top left corner is blocked by Timo Horn, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Goal! Milos Jojic (Koln) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper inside the left post. 2:0.
Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Here comes a substitution. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Christian Clemens.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) has reason to celebrate! His first-time shot from the edge of the area goes low into the middle of the net and past the goalkeeper. Some might blame the keeper for that, but it's hard to say whether he should have saved it. 2:3.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Giulio Donati will be replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yannick Gerhardt leaves the pitch and Kevin Vogt (Koln) comes on.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!
Bruno Labbadia is forced to make a change. Pierre-Michel Lasogga is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hamburger).
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom left corner.

Goal! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the right post. Jaroslav Drobny had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Rene Adler (Hamburger) receives a red card due to his mindless behaviour. His team will now have to play with a man down.
Gojko Kacar comes off the pitch to be replaced by Jaroslav Drobny (Hamburger).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Moritz Leitner (Dortmund) is coming onto the pitch as Ilkay Gundogan cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch because Nicolai Muller simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
A substitution has been made. Gonzalo Castro goes off and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) comes on.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Matthias Ginter and he is replaced by Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund).
Great ball in from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
Goal! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:0.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.

What a save from Ralf Fahrmann! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out. Bayern Munich get a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Tobias Welz blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Good team movement sets up Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
GOAL! Arturo Vidal meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 1:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) is coming onto the pitch as Mehdi Benatia cannot continue after picking up an injury.

A perfect lofted pass from Rafinha finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Ralf Fahrmann had no chance of stopping that. 0:0.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Douglas Costa walks off the pitch to be replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar is replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
Younes Belhanda (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Johannes Geis.
Goal! Franck Ribery puts the ball on a plate for Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 3:0.
It's time for a substitution. Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) comes on in place of Arturo Vidal.
Younes Belhanda (Schalke) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Manuel Neuer pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) replaces Maxim Choupo-Moting.
Tobias Welz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the left side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss!
What a chance that is! Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Jurgen Kramny probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Florian Klein. He is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).

A big opportunity is wasted by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the right side of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort. Augsburg have a corner.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Przemyslaw Tyton to get hold of the ball.
Daniel Opare (Augsburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Przemyslaw Tyton.

Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots towards the left post, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Przemyslaw Tyton. What a save! Augsburg have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart) will replace Artem Kravets.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) meets an accurate cross in the box and steers a fine header towards the net. The goalkeeper has to react quickly to keep the ball out. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Stuttgart will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) for Alfred Finnbogason.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Jurgen Kramny has decided to substitute Timo Werner and he is replaced by Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart).
We are about to witness a substitution. Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) is replacing Halil Altintop.
Here comes a substitution. Daniel Baier is given a rest as he is replaced by Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Niko Kovac makes a half-time substitution. Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Marc Stendera.
Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target.
Here is a change. Hakan Calhanoglu is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Bernd Leno is alert and denies him with a nice save.
A yellow card for a tackle by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Luc Castaignos.
The foul by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Deniz Aytekin.
Chicharito is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen).

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Lukas Hradecky. 0:0.

What a save from Bernd Leno! Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. The ball goes out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a corner kick.
It's a yellow card for Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen).
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) is penalised.
It's a goal! Karim Bellarabi plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
We are about to witness a substitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt) is replacing Stefan Aigner.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Vladlen Yurchenko.
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up the ball on the edge of the penalty box and produces a moment of magic with a brilliant shot that goes into the left side of the goal!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Dirk Schuster is forced to make a change. Peter Niemeyer is unable to continue due to injury, Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) comes on.
The end of the first half.
Referee Michael Weiner blows his whistle to start the second half.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Ingolstadt.
Goal! Sandro Wagner displays great vision and sends a pass to Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the left post. The score is 1:0.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Lukas Hinterseer as he is replaced by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt).

Christian Mathenia receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed for the bottom left corner.

Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Christian Mathenia makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the middle of the target.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The substitution is prepared. Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Moritz Hartmann.
Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Marcel Heller comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
Yellow card! It's like Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Michael Weiner agrees and books him.
Substitution. Roger did his best and is replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
It's in the back of the net! Sandro Sirigu sprays a pass out to Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sandro Wagner departs the field of play to be replaced by Felix Platte (Darmstadt).
Michael Weiner shows a yellow card to Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop. Hertha Berlin have a corner.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the left post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the top left corner. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) has a reason to celebrate!

It's in the back of the net! Nadiem Amiri flights the free kick into the box, where Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) peels off his marker and heads straight into the top right corner from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 1:1.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) replacing Fabian Schar.
It will be a substitution. Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) is ready to enter the pitch as Philipp Ochs walks off.
Rune Jarstein pulls off a great save to deny Mark Uth (Hoffenheim), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
Today's match ends for Vedad Ibisevic who will be replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) replaces Kevin Volland.
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Vladimir Darida will be replaced by Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin).
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:1.
Here's the change. Genki Haraguchi leaves the pitch and Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
A goal, which was scored by Bas Dost (Wolfsburg), was disallowed due to offside.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.

Nice individual effort by Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Diego Benaglio does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) gets a yellow card.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) gathers a cross inside the box and strikes the ball. He wastes a great scoring opportunity as his shot only hits the right-hand post.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) makes a slide tackle, but referee Wolfgang Stark blows for a foul. Werder Bremen have been awarded a penalty kick!
The foul by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Wolfgang Stark.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is going to take the penalty!
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) gave the goalkeeper no chance from the penalty. Diego Benaglio failed to reach the ball, which bounced off the post into the bottom left corner.
GOAL! The corner comes over and Bas Dost wins a simple header before Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) nods the ball into the back of the net. 1:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Santiago Garcia comes off the pitch to be replaced by Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch for Bruno Henrique.
Goal! Zlatko Junuzovic plays a pass to the feet of Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen), and he shoots inside the left post from inside the box. It's 2:1.
Substitution. Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) on for Josuha Guilavogui.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) replacing Vieirinha.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) tries his luck with a long-range effort after receiving a precise pass. It goes to the roof of the net, but Felix Wiedwald has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Zlatko Junuzovic. The score is 3:1.
Diego Benaglio (Wolfsburg) was probably a bit loose with his words to Wolfgang Stark, who decides to show him a yellow.
A substitution has been made. Claudio Pizarro goes off and Oliver Husing (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Ricardo Rodriguez produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 3:2.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sambou Yatabare leaves the pitch and Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) comes on.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Salif Sane (Hannover) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Markus Schmidt has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Fantastic team goal! Waldemar Anton (Hannover) was set free in the area by Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Andre Schubert has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Thorgan Hazard.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) can count himself lucky for not being sent off after only receiving a caution from the referee.
Kenan Karaman (Hannover) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Goal! Artur Sobiech (Hannover) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 2:0.
We are about to witness a substitution. Valmir Sulejmani (Hannover) is replacing Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee.
The manager makes a subsitution with Adam Szalai (Hannover) coming on for Artur Sobiech.
Substitution. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) in, Nico Elvedi out.

Kenan Karaman (Hannover) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Yann Sommer leaps like a salmon to deny him.
It is time for a substitution. Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) is on for Waldemar Anton.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just wide of the right post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
A yellow card for a tackle by Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Anthony Modeste (Koln), whose header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) latches on to a through ball inside the box, but one of the defenders steps in with a timely interception. It could have been a great chance otherwise.

It's a goal! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the right side of the target. The assist goes to Karim Bellarabi and the score changes to 0:1.
Goal Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen)! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) was put through by Karim Bellarabi and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the left side of the net. 0:2.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Peter Stoger probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Kevin Vogt. He is replaced by Filip Mladenovic (1. FC Koln).
We are about to witness a substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Karim Bellarabi.
Bernd Leno pulls off a fantastic save! Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out.
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Philipp Hosiner (1. FC Koln) replaces Matthias Lehmann.

Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same.
Simon Zoller (Koln) receives a lofted pass from the flank and shoots from close range, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the right-hand post.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to  for a tough tackle. A free kick is awarded to FC Koln.
Substitution. Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Chicharito walks off.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Simon Zoller as he is replaced by Marcel Hartel (Koln).
Roger Schmidt prepares a substitution. Vladlen Yurchenko is replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Timo Horn is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Bayer Leverkusen get a corner.

Marcel Hartel (1. FC Koln) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Bernd Leno pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The referee signals a corner kick to FC Koln.

What a great touch by Filip Mladenovic (1. FC Koln) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The ball is out of play. FC Koln win a corner kick.
The foul by Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe. Bayer Leverkusen get a free kick.
The game is interrupted by the referee. He pulls out a red card and sends Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) off.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a second yellow by Manuel Grafe and subsequently dismisses him with a red one.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Wow, what an escape. Moritz Leitner (Dortmund) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. Dortmund will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Christian Pulisic (Dortmund). This could have been a legendary goal.
Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Good team movement sets up Leroy Sane (Schalke) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
Close! Junior Caicara (Schalke) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Mats Hummels is replaced by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund).

Moritz Leitner passes to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:1.
A pass from Junior Caicara (Schalke) is intercepted by Roman Burki and the move breaks down.
Goal! Leroy Sane (Schalke) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:1.

Sascha Riether (Schalke) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. That's a free kick to Dortmund.
Ralf Fahrmann reacts well to deny a long-range free kick from Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) towards the right side of the goal. The ball is out of play and Dortmund manage to earn a corner.
Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) jumps for a cross and plants a perfect header inside the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Junior Caicara departs the field of play to be replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).

The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Schalke. Sokratis (Dortmund) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Felix Zwayer blows his whistle for a foul.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Sokratis (Dortmund) for a heavy challenge.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) takes the penalty and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom the right corner!
The foul by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.

Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ralf Fahrmann to get hold of the ball.
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Erik Durm (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Moritz Leitner trots off the pitch and is replaced by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a change. Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) replaces Christian Pulisic.
The manager makes a subsitution with Dennis Aogo (Schalke) coming on for Sead Kolasinac.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Younes Belhanda (Schalke). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) replaces Younes Belhanda.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Ralf Fahrmann. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Dortmund.
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests. Dortmund are awarded the free kick.
Max Meyer (Schalke) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.
That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Danny Latza (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Gunter Perl blows his whistle to start the second half.
Fantastic team goal! Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) was set free in the area by Bruno Henrique and fired past Loris Karius. 1:0.
Substitution. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) on for Pablo De Blasis.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) latches on to a fine cross and slams the ball inside the right post. Beautiful goal.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Maximilian Arnold will be replaced by Max Kruse (Wolfsburg).
We are about to witness a substitution. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) is replacing Bas Dost.
Christian Clemens (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Gunter Perl after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) replaces Marcel Schafer.
Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Jairo Samperio (Mainz) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Dante (Wolfsburg) is penalised.
Here is a change. Christian Clemens is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) takes the free kick and unleashes a strong shot from the edge of the box. Unfortunately for him, the ball curls inches over the crossbar. What a squandered chance!
Gunter Perl blows his whistle and Dante (Wolfsburg) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
That will be all from Yunus Malli who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Fabian Frei (Mainz).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

What a chance that is! Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the left post.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom left corner. Lukas Hradecky is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.

Lukas Hradecky pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the bottom left corner, but was stopped by the goalkeeper. Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Oliver Baumann is alert and denies him.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the left post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann has made a change at the break. Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) has come on in place of Eduardo Vargas.

A nice cross arrived in the box from the corner kick and found the head of Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt). He steered the ball towards the left post, but one of the defenders is there to cover the goalkeeper and keep it out.
Niko Kovac is forced to make a change. Carlos Zambrano is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Kaan Ayhan (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Philipp Ochs departs the field of play to be replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner in trademark fashion.
It's time for a substitution. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Luc Castaignos.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Felix Brych's book.
Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) is booked.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Yellow card. David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Sonny Kittel makes his way off the pitch and Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as his replacement.
Felix Brych shows the yellow card to Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) replaces Kevin Volland.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Kaan Ayhan (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.

Nice individual effort by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Lukas Hradecky does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:2.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post.

Christian Mathenia was forced into action to thwart Sven Schipplock (Hamburger). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.
Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
A yellow card for a tackle by Nicolai Muller (Hamburger). Peter Sippel doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Perfectly executed free kick. Konstantin Rausch floats the ball in and Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) leaps high to connect with it near the penalty spot. His bullet header flicks off the post into the right side of the goal. The score is now 0:1.
Peter Sippel shows a yellow card to Luca Caldirola (Darmstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The end of the first half.
Referee Peter Sippel blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) scores after an assist by Sandro Wagner that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:2.
A substitution has been made. Albin Ekdal goes off and Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) comes on.
A goal, which was scored by Emir Spahic (Hamburger), was disallowed due to offside.
Today's match ends for Ivo Ilicevic who will be replaced by Nabil Bahoui (Hamburger).
It will be a substitution. Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) is ready to enter the pitch as Michael Gregoritsch walks off.
Here is a change. Marcel Heller is going off and Dirk Schuster gives the last tactical orders to Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt).
That's the end of the game for Konstantin Rausch, who is replaced by Felix Platte (Darmstadt).
Dirk Schuster decides to make a substitution. Mario Vrancic will be replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Emir Spahic (Hamburger).
Cleber (Hamburger) receives a yellow card.
It's in the back of the net! Nicolai Muller slips the ball through to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:2.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Ramazan Ozcan, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Tobias Welz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Andre Schubert has made a change at the break. Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) has come on in place of Granit Xhaka.
Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) misses a rebound from the penalty spot. The ball flies just a few inches over the bar.
That's the end of the game for Dario Lezcano, who is replaced by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt).
The referee signals a substitution. Martin Hinteregger (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Mahmoud Dahoud.
Ramazan Ozcan (Ingolstadt) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Yann Sommer pulls off a great save to deny Danny da Costa (Ingolstadt), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
That will be all from Fabian Johnson who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
It's time for a substitution. Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) comes on in place of Lukas Hinterseer.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
Goal! Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:0. He was ably assisted there by Almog Cohen.
Here is a change. Moritz Hartmann is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt).
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) clutches his head in despair after blowing a huge opportunity! He receives the ball after the free kick and takes good first touch to unleash a low shot from close range, but Manuel Neuer makes a nice save. It will be a corner kick for Stuttgart.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Arturo Vidal walks off the pitch and Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
This is definitely not what Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 0:1.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but sends his shot slightly wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) has tested the patience of referee Bastian Dankert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
A lofted cross from Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is unsuccessful as the opponent's defence quickly clears the ball out of the penalty area.
Goal! David Alaba (Bayern Munich) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Juan Bernat, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:2.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Bastian Dankert ignores the protests. Stuttgart are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
Goal! Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top right corner. It's 1:2.
The substitution has been made. Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) has replaced Mario Gotze.
Substitution. Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart) in, Lukas Rupp out.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Joshua Kimmich will be replaced by Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich).
Great touch by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) as he received a precise pass on the edge of the box. His powerful shot bounced off the goalkeepers gloves and hit the post.

What a beautiful moment! Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the bottom left corner. Przemyslaw Tyton just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:3.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Markus Weinzierl is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Alexander Esswein suffers an injury and Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) comes on.

Zlatko Junuzovic sends in the corner kick, Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) controls it just outside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a nice strike low into the middle of the target. The score sheet now reads 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Opare (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Francisco Caiuby sends a superb cross into the box. Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the bottom left corner, leaving Felix Wiedwald beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
Levin Oztunali comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen).
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen) leaps like a salmon to produce a header from the resulting corner, but one of the defending players intercepts the ball and averts the danger.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Daniel Siebert lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Yellow card. Philipp Max (Augsburg) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Alfred Finnbogason goes off the pitch and Tobias Werner (Augsburg) comes on.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to substitute Florian Grillitsch and he is replaced by Laszlo Kleinheisler (Werder Bremen).
Christoph Janker (Augsburg) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
That will be all from Christoph Janker who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg).
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Daniel Baier and Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) gets in a shot, sending the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fin Bartels leaves the pitch and Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) was probably a bit loose with his words to Daniel Siebert, who decides to show him a yellow.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Marvin Plattenhardt plays a terrific cross over to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
What an opportunity! Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) smashed a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but the ball only crashed against the right post!
