Hiroshi Kiyotake produces a sweet pass and picks out Artur Sobiech (Hannover) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:1!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Uffe Bech (Hannover) was quite harsh and Benjamin Brand didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Tempers flare after Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Benjamin Brand blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Benjamin Brand and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Uffe Bech is substituted due to injury. Daniel Stendel gives a chance to Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) for his blatant foul.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mitchell Weiser walks off the pitch to be replaced by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin).

Kenan Karaman is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot which bounces in off the bottom of the right post to make the score 1:2.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Substitution. Tolga Cigerci makes way for Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
It's in the back of the net! Julian Schieber is the provider as he slips the ball to Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:2.
Daniel Stendel prepares a substitution. Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee is replaced by Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover).
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make.
The referee signals a substitution. Oliver Sorg (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Edgar Prib.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) is very lucky to stay on the pitch after using excessive force to bring down his opponent with a two-footed challenge.

Ron-Robert Zieler earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the six-yard box. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Hertha Berlin.
Benjamin Brand is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A yellow card for a tackle by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Nice individual effort by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Timo Horn does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Golden chance! Anthony Modeste (Koln) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Deniz Aytekin after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
That will be all from Nadiem Amiri who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Mark Uth and he is replaced by Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim).
What a big chance! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.

The defence had a hard time blocking out the strike from Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim). He didn't hesitate and finished from outside the box right after he had received a pass from his teammate. The ball is out of play and Hoffenheim manage to earn a corner.
It's in the back of the net! Jonas Hector sprays a pass out to Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Here comes a substitution. Simon Zoller is given a rest as he is replaced by Lukas Klunter (Koln).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) replaces Pavel Kaderabek.
Kevin Vogt goes off the pitch and Marcel Hartel (Koln) comes on.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post!
A substitution has been made. Leonardo Bittencourt is replaced by Pawel Olkowski (Koln).
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the right post is smartly dealt with by Timo Horn.
Goal 1:1! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Goal! Mahmoud Dahoud slips it to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he lashes the ball low into the middle of the net. The score is 1:0.
Vedad Ibisevic is not given a chance to finish after receiving a sweet pass by Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin). Hertha Berlin have been awarded a corner kick.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the right post.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card from Sascha Stegemann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Rune Jarstein pulls off a great save to deny Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The referee points to the corner flag and B. Monchengladbach will take a corner.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Pal Dardai gives a chance to Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) and Tolga Cigerci is off.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) controls a nice low pass and shoots from just outside the box, but it's a poor effort that flies into the stands. Wasted opportunity!

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) weaves his way through opponents and strikes the ball from the edge of the area, but it's blocked by a defender. Corner kick. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity.
Sascha Stegemann shows the yellow card to Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass inside the box from Fabian Johnson and he beats the goalkeeper with a brilliant shot into the top left corner. 2:0.

Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Rune Jarstein is alert and denies him with a nice save. The referee blows his whistle, B. Monchengladbach are awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Vladimir Darida did his best and is replaced by Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Andre Hahn makes way for Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sascha Stegemann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Rune Jarstein makes a great save to stop his effort.
Goal! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 3:0.
Goal! Mahmoud Dahoud plays it to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Rune Jarstein. 4:0.
Substitution. Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) in, Genki Haraguchi out.
Andre Schubert decides to make a substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud will be replaced by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch so that Thorgan Hazard can be given a rest.
Goal! Lars Stindl provides Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 5:0.
What a chance that is! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the crossbar!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Welz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Felix Wiedwald pulls off a great save to deny Erik Durm (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Felix Wiedwald makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal. The referee points to the corner flag and Dortmund will take a corner.
CLOSE! Erik Durm (Dortmund) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar.
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) gets on the end of a cross from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Felix Wiedwald, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
GOAL! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Felix Wiedwald, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:0.
Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) commits a nasty foul by bringing down his opponent.

Erik Durm (Dortmund) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save! The ball is out of play. Dortmund will have a chance to score from a corner.
The game has come to an end for Santiago Garcia. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen).
Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen) quickly picks up the rebound and drills the ball towards the left side of the goal. The opponent's goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him.
Goal! Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 1:1.
Substitution. Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) replaces Erik Durm.
Fantastic team goal! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) was set free in the area by Levin Oztunali and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 1:2.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) scores after an assist by Marcel Schmelzer that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:2.
It's time for a substitution. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) comes on in place of Marcel Schmelzer.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a change. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) replaces Marco Reus.
The score has changed  1:0. Henrikh Mkhitaryan sends a fantastic cross into the box from the corner. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) jumps highest and plants a header inside the left post.
Here is a change. Sambou Yatabare is going off and Viktor Skripnik gives the last tactical orders to Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Lukas Frode (Werder Bremen) in, Anthony Ujah out.
Golden chance! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Tobias Welz shows the yellow card to Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) for a heavy challenge.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous low effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Lukas Hradecky, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
GOAL! Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) gets to the rebound inside the box and fires in a stunning overhead kick. Phenomenal finish! 1:0.
Florian Meyer has issued a yellow card to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich).
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card.
Florian Meyer shows the yellow card to Anis Ben-Hatira (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Florian Meyer has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Niko Kovac is forced to make a change. Szabolcs Huszti is unable to continue due to injury, Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Florian Meyer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) produces a decent strike goalwards from the resulting set piece. His effort crashes against the crossbar and the ball stays out of the net. The goalkeeper was quite lucky!

Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Lukas Hradecky leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Today's referee Florian Meyer rightly decides to book Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
Niko Kovac prepares a substitution. Haris Seferovic is replaced by Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Anis Ben-Hatira.

Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Lukas Hradecky pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner.
The game has come to an end for Robert Lewandowski. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Mario Gotze can be given a rest.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Lukas Hradecky guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) has too much to say to the referee and receives a caution.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Slobodan Rajkovic (Darmstadt) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar.
Jurgen Kramny is forced to make a change. Toni Sunjic is unable to continue due to injury, Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
GOAL! Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 1:0.
CHANCE! Christian Gentner finds Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the right post!
It's in the back of the net! Filip Kostic plays it into the box, and Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the top left corner. 1:1.
Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) scores! Artem Kravets heads the ball into his path before he drives in an effort that is too powerful for the goalkeeper to keep out. 1:2.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
GOAL! Mario Vrancic curls the free kick into the box. Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Przemyslaw Tyton and into the left side of the net. 1:2.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
We are about to witness a substitution. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) is replacing Daniel Didavi.
What a chance! Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) hits the left post with a header.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lukas Rupp.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) gets a yellow card.
The booking goes to Marcel Heller (Darmstadt).
A yellow card for a tackle by Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Mario Vrancic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Felix Platte (Darmstadt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Sven Schipplock slides a brilliant pass into Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Goal disallowed! Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) scores but Robert Hartmann blows his whistle for a foul.

Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Rene Adler pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Bruno Labbadia makes a half-time substitution. Gideon Jung (Hamburger) comes on in place of Lewis Holtby.
Adam Szalai (Hannover) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot towards the roof of the net, but the keeper makes a superb save!
Aaron Hunt takes the corner and Cleber (Hamburger) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the right side of the goal. The score is 0:1.
Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Here comes a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Aaron Hunt.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to make a change. Uffe Bech (Hannover) replaces Ceyhun Gulselam.
It's 0:2! Sven Schipplock feeds Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the top of the net.
What an outstanding solo effort by Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
Great touch by Edgar Prib (Hannover) as he received a precise pass on the edge of the box. His powerful shot bounced off the goalkeepers gloves and hit the post.
Bruno Labbadia decides to make a substitution. Nicolai Muller will be replaced by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Chance! Franco Di Santo (Schalke) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Leroy Sane, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
Junior Caicara (Schalke) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows his whistle for a foul. Ingolstadt are awarded a penalty kick!
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot inside the right post.
Max Meyer (Schalke) is booked.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Junior Caicara (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) gets booked.
A yellow card for a tackle by Leroy Sane (Schalke). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Danny da Costa provides Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Joel Matip (Schalke) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Substitution. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Leon Goretzka walks off.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting is replaced by Younes Belhanda (Schalke).
Today's match ends for Moritz Hartmann who will be replaced by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt).
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 3:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Franco Di Santo departs the field of play to be replaced by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke).
Here comes a substitution. Dario Lezcano is given a rest as he is replaced by Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Roman Neustadter (Schalke) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lukas Hinterseer trots off the pitch and is replaced by Maurice Multhaup (Ingolstadt).
Joel Matip (Schalke) receives a harsh yellow card from the referee after committing a minor foul on his opponent.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the bottom right corner of the net.
Christian Clemens (Mainz) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.
GOAL! Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 2:1.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Marwin Hitz is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Goal! Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top left corner. It's 2:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Patrick Ittrich has ended it.
The second half gets underway.

Goal  3:2! Daniel Brosinski sends a superb cross into the box. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header into the top right corner, leaving Marwin Hitz beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish.
Gaetan Bussmann (Mainz) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Markus Feulner (Augsburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) replacing Dominik Kohr.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Philipp Max will be replaced by Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg).

What an opportunity! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes low towards the middle of the goal, but Loris Karius reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
The foul by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Patrick Ittrich.
Here comes a substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Fabian Frei.
Goal! Jhon Cordoba produces a great pass that finds Christian Clemens (Mainz) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 3:2.
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) replaces Yunus Malli.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Raul Bobadilla trots off the pitch and is replaced by Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Christian Clemens will be replaced by Christoph Moritz (Mainz).

What a chance that is! Danny Latza (Mainz) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the right post!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Goal! Hakan Calhanoglu produces a great pass that finds Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Dieter Hecking makes a half-time substitution. Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Christian Trasch.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Dante (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card!
Substitution. Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Lars Bender.
Substitution. Max Kruse walks off the pitch and Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen) comes onto the pitch because Hakan Calhanoglu simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Diego Benaglio thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) makes himself some space on the edge of the penalty area and pulls the trigger. His accurate effort goes in off the post and the score changes to 1:0.
Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card.
Caution goes to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Robin Knoche makes his way off the pitch and Carlos Ascues (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a superb pass and breaks through the defence before firing a shot from mid-range that goes past the goalkeeper inside the right post.
That's the end of the game for Stefan Kiessling, who is replaced by Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Francisco Caiuby puts the ball on a plate for Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:0.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.

Excellent touch by Marco Reus (Dortmund)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a terrific save. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) is heading toward the corner flag to take the set piece.
Goal! Nuri Sahin plays it to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Alex Manninger. 1:1.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Thomas Tuchel makes a switch. Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) is coming on in place of Marco Reus at the start of the second period.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Daniel Baier is replaced by Markus Feulner (Augsburg).
Here's the change. Shinji Kagawa leaves the pitch and Moritz Leitner (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
The manager makes a subsitution with Felix Passlack (Dortmund) coming on for Nuri Sahin.
Fantastic team goal! Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) was set free in the area by Adrian Ramos and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the right side of the net. 1:2.
Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Alex Manninger, who pulls off a stunning save!
Goal! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) fires the rebound into the top left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:3.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Ja-Cheol Koo walks off the pitch to be replaced by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Francisco Caiuby makes his way off the pitch and Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Daniel Siebert checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

It's in the back of the net! Karim Bellarabi slips the ball through to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Przemyslaw Tyton was alert and the score remained the same. The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
A header by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) from very close range goes towards the middle of the target, but doesn't get past Przemyslaw Tyton, who makes a nice save.
A yellow card for a tackle by . Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.

What a wasted opportunity by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom right corner, but Bernd Leno makes an astonishing save to thwart him. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Stuttgart.
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Daniel Siebert starts the second half.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Julian Brandt, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:2.
Here's the change. Daniel Didavi leaves the pitch and Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Geoffroy Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity!

Przemyslaw Tyton hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The referee signals a corner kick to Bayer Leverkusen.
Substitution. Karim Bellarabi did his best and is replaced by Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen).
Jurgen Kramny prepares a substitution. Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) is replaced by Alexandru Maxim.
The manager makes a subsitution with Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Timo Werner.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Przemyslaw Tyton, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
The foul by Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Daniel Siebert.
A substitution has been made. Vladlen Yurchenko goes off and Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) on for Julian Brandt.
That's it for today, Daniel Siebert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Kenan Karaman (Hannover) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Eintracht Frankfurt) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Waldemar Anton (Hannover) comes on the pitch for Christian Schulz.
Stefan Reinartz goes off the pitch and Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.

Anis Ben-Hatira (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
Thomas Schaaf prepares a substitution. Hotaru Yamaguchi is replaced by Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover).

Anis Ben-Hatira (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Ron-Robert Zieler, who pulls off a stunning save!
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has a goal ruled out for offside!
We are about to witness a substitution. Adam Szalai (Hannover) is replacing Kenan Karaman.
Ron-Robert Zieler (Hannover) is booked for saying more than Wolfgang Stark was willing to tolerate.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
That's the end of the game for Szabolcs Huszti, who is replaced by David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Hugo Almeida (Hannover) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Here comes a substitution. Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Anis Ben-Hatira.
That's a clear yellow card. Hugo Almeida (Hannover) goes into the book.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets to a rebound just outside the penalty area and unleashes a fabulous effort that goes in off the left post!
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Tobias Welz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the left-hand post, but Manuel Neuer was alert and the score remains the same.
Substitution. Xabi Alonso will be replaced by Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich).
Yannick Gerhardt will be replaced by Yuya Osako (Koln).
Here comes a substitution. Douglas Costa is given a rest as he is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Anthony Modeste (Koln) finds his way to a cross and strikes towards the goal, but one of the defending players deflects the ball away.
The game has come to an end for Sebastian Rode. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Matthias Lehmann makes his way off the pitch and Filip Mladenovic (Koln) comes on as his replacement.
Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Welz ignores the protests.
Frederik Sorensen (Koln) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Welz had an easy-decision to make.
Robert Lewandowski slides a brilliant pass into Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Gotoku Sakai plays a lovely pass into Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) latches on to a pin-point pass on the edge of the box and fires the ball into the roof of the net, but an amazing dive from the goalkeeper denies him. The strike bounces off his gloves and crashes against the bar!

Rene Adler makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the right side of the target. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
What a chance that is! Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
Rene Adler (Hamburger) trips an opposition player and Knut Kircher signals a foul. PENALTY AWARDED to Hoffenheim!
Rene Adler (Hamburger) picks up a yellow card.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom right corner.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) takes a great first touch inside the box after the free kick, wins himself some space and beats the goalkeeper with an accurate strike into the bottom right corner.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) probably handled the ball. Hamburger SV are given a penalty!
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) is going to take the penalty!
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Oliver Baumann to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) is booked for saying more than Knut Kircher was willing to tolerate.
Rene Adler pulls off a great save to deny Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Knut Kircher had an easy-decision to make.

Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom right corner, but Oliver Baumann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Hamburger SV.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) latches on to an accurate pass into the box and immediately unleashes a low shot goalwards. His effort is well saved by the keeper.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Good work from Hamburger SV as they win a corner.
A substitution has been made. Michael Gregoritsch goes off and Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) comes on.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) replaces Andrej Kramaric.
Fantastic team goal! Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) was set free in the area by Kevin Volland and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 1:3.
The manager makes a subsitution with Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) coming on for Artjoms Rudnevs.
Here is a change. Nadiem Amiri is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Knut Kircher didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Cleber (Hamburger) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up inside the right post, but Oliver Baumann pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him. The linesman makes the right call and Hamburger SV will have a corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Nabil Bahoui (Hamburger) is replacing Lewis Holtby.

Oliver Baumann hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Hamburger SV are going to take it.
CHANCE! Eduardo Vargas finds Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the right post!
That will be all from Tobias Strobl who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim).
Knut Kircher is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A goal, which was scored by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), was disallowed due to offside.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went inches over the bar.
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) smashes the ball against the crossbar! What a chance.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

It's a goal! Marvin Plattenhardt plays the ball to the feet of Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin), who hits a tremendous first-time shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper was unable to keep it out. 1:0.
Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Patrick Ittrich's book.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dario Lezcano departs the field of play to be replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) for his blatant foul.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
It's a goal! Genki Haraguchi plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
Substitution. Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) has come on for Moritz Hartmann.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked.
Almog Cohen produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:1.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) replaces Max Christiansen.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Vedad Ibisevic cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) replaces Vladimir Darida.
Patrick Ittrich shows the yellow card to Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
Here comes a substitution. Salomon Kalou is given a rest as he is replaced by Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin).
Rune Jarstein (Hertha Berlin) gets a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) receives the ball from the set piece and unleashes a strike from the edge of the box, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post!
Goal! Yunus Malli displays great vision and sends a pass to Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) was probably a bit loose with his words to Manuel Grafe, who decides to show him a yellow.

Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Manuel Grafe blows his whistle for an infringement. A penalty is awarded to Werder Bremen!
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is going to take the penalty!
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Felix Wiedwald is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) attempts to discuss the decision with Manuel Grafe, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Levin Oztunali.
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Claudio Pizarro is replaced by Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen).
Anthony Ujah picks out Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen), who drives a shot just wide of the right post from the edge of the box. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
It is time for a substitution. Suat Serdar (Mainz) is on for Yunus Malli.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Jhon Cordoba will be replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Substitution. Pablo De Blasis leaves the pitch and is replaced by Christian Clemens (Mainz).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.

Slobodan Rajkovic (Darmstadt) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence. The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.
Daniel Caligiuri is substituted due to injury. Dieter Hecking gives a chance to Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg).
Great ball in from Maximilian Arnold. Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
What was Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle to start the second half.
What a sweet touch by Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Koen Casteels to hold.
Substitution. Josuha Guilavogui will be replaced by Leandro Putaro (Wolfsburg).
Leandro Putaro (Wolfsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Christian Mathenia is alert and denies him.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Vieirinha as he is replaced by Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg).
Dirk Schuster prepares a substitution. Mario Vrancic is replaced by Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt).
It's in the back of the net! Marcel Heller is the provider as he slips the ball to Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:1.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Darmstadt will have a goal kick.
A substitution has been made. Konstantin Rausch goes off and Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) comes on.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the bottom right corner.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Benjamin Gorka (Darmstadt) for Marcel Heller.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
What a big chance! Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Ralf Fahrmann makes a great save to stop the effort going into the right side of the goal.
Max Meyer (Schalke) produces a nice daisy-cutter from about 20 metres. It would have probably ended up inside the right post, but Yann Sommer was there in time with a superb save.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) takes a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball heads towards the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a fantastic save. The ball goes out of play and B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Ralf Fahrmann is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for B. Monchengladbach.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Marco Fritz blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Close! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Leroy Sane (Schalke) creates himself some space and attempts to put the ball into the box. However, the defender gets an important foot in to clear.
What bad luck! Martin Hinteregger (B. Monchengladbach) sends the ball into his own net.
Substitution. Dennis Aogo (Schalke) on for Alessandro Schopf.
Max Meyer (Schalke) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) collects an accurate pass and tries his luck from about 23 metres. He was very close to scoring, but the ball ends up hitting the bar.
Marco Fritz shows the yellow card to Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Fabian Johnson will be replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Today's match ends for Mahmoud Dahoud who will be replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Here is a change. Max Meyer is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Younes Belhanda (Schalke).

Brilliant finish! Andreas Christensen (B. Monchengladbach) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Lars Stindl, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:1.
Here comes a substitution. Thorgan Hazard is given a rest as he is replaced by Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).
Goal! Leroy Sane passes the ball to Leon Goretzka (Schalke) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Yann Sommer couldn't do anything about it. 2:1.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marvin Friedrich (Schalke) replacing Leroy Sane.

Andreas Christensen (B. Monchengladbach) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) sends a rebound from close range to the right post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal Marco Reus (Dortmund)! Marco Reus (Dortmund) was put through by Gonzalo Castro and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) comes on the pitch for Erik Durm.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.

Loris Karius earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the box. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills, indeed.
The game has come to an end for Fabian Frei. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Danny Latza (Mainz).
Christian Clemens comes off the pitch to be replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Nuri Sahin and he is replaced by Julian Weigl (Dortmund).
Marco Reus (Dortmund) wasted a golden chance to score after he found some space inside the box and unluckily volleyed the ball narrowly over the bar.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) scores after an assist by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
Substitution. Suat Serdar (Mainz) in, Jairo Samperio out.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) strikes a promising volley towards goal, but one of the defenders is quick enough to step in and make a crucial block.
Here comes a substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan is given a rest as he is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.
What a sweet touch by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Bernd Leno to hold.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) unluckily turns a cross into his own net.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.
Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) is shown a yellow card by the referee for dissent.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Crossbar! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from around the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball crashed against the bar!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Bruno Labbadia decided to make a change. Gotoku Sakai is replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).

Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Hamburger SV will look to benefit from a promising free kick near the touchline.
Substitution. Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Karim Bellarabi walks off.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Ivo Ilicevic is replaced by Josip Drmic (Hamburger).
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Chicharito.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the top left corner. His effort is blocked by Bernd Leno with a brilliant diving save!

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the right-hand post. However, he couldn't beat Rene Adler, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Roger Schmidt is forced to make a change. Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen) is unable to continue due to injury,  comes on.
Substitution. Lewis Holtby walks off the pitch and Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.

Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) controls the ball from the free kick on the edge of the box and releases a strike that could have ended up in the roof of the net but for a magnificent save by Bernd Leno. Hamburger SV will take a corner kick.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) gets booked.

Yet another yellow card and Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) is sent off for talking out of turn to the referee. Definitely a harebrained moment from the player. Christian Dingert doesn't allow any discussions.
The foul by Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Felix Wiedwald guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

It's a goal! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) scores with a brilliant low shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Kingsley Coman. The score is now 1:0.

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Felix Wiedwald makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Bayern Munich.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass inside the box from Kingsley Coman, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 2:0.
The foul by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Guido Winkmann.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Guido Winkmann starts the second half.
Viktor Skripnik makes a switch. Laszlo Kleinheisler (Werder Bremen) is coming on in place of Levin Oztunali at the start of the second period.
The game is over for Milos Veljkovic. Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen) comes on for the second half.

What a great touch by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Felix Wiedwald is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball is out of play and Bayern Munich manage to earn a corner.
Today's match ends for Mario Gotze who will be replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range low towards the middle of the net, but Felix Wiedwald was alert and made an amazing save!

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) won himself some space after the corner kick and tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box. His effort is directed towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper is alert and makes the save.
Goal! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 3:0.
Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Guido Winkmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The manager makes a subsitution with Rafinha (Bayern Munich) coming on for Joshua Kimmich.
The referee signals a substitution. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Thomas Muller.
Viktor Skripnik decides to make a substitution. Santiago Garcia will be replaced by Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 4:0.
What a great touch by David Alaba (Bayern Munich)! He picks up a precise pass and produces a long-range shot, but his fabulous effort smashes off the right post!
Goal! Kingsley Coman puts the ball on a plate for Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 5:0.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Lukas Hradecky pulls off a great save to deny Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Lukas Hradecky is alert and denies him.

A yellow card for a tackle by Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt). Michael Weiner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. B. Monchengladbach are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
A shot is blocked but the rebound lands at the feet of Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) who fires the ball into the back of the net.
Michael Weiner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Makoto Hasebe.

Sensational goal, a once in a lifetime shot. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) spots the goalkeeper off his line and decides to shoot from 35 metres out. The keeper tries desperately to stop the ball but it hits the back of the net.
Marco Fabian comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch so that Havard Nordtveit can be given a rest.
What a big chance! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Andre Schubert is forced to make a change. Granit Xhaka is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach).
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Michael Weiner after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. B. Monchengladbach are awarded a free kick.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Lukas Hradecky with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:0.
Andre Schubert prepares a substitution. Fabian Johnson is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Here's the change. Stefan Aigner leaves the pitch and Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets booked.
A yellow card is awarded to Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach).
That's it for today, Michael Weiner has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
Goal! Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 1:0.
Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Marwin Hitz makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner.
The score has changed  1:0. Tobias Kempe sends a fantastic cross into the box from the corner. Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) jumps highest and plants a header into the top right corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
It will be a substitution. Philipp Max (Augsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Konstantinos Stafylidis walks off.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Albian Ajeti (Augsburg) replaces Dominik Kohr.

Markus Feulner (Augsburg) is in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound and unleashes a fabulous shot from just outside the box. He couldn't be more precise. His effort flies towards the bottom left corner, going in off the post. Absolutely fantastic!
Substitution. Peter Niemeyer is replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header from near the penalty spot crashes against the right post! The goalkeeper would have been helpless.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards the roof of the net, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper with a stunning save.
Goal disallowed! Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) scores but Bastian Dankert blows his whistle for a foul.
Substitution. Benjamin Gorka (Darmstadt) has come on for Mario Vrancic.
Ragnar Klavan comes off the pitch to be replaced by Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
Here comes a substitution. Fabian Holland (Darmstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Tobias Kempe.
Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) was too fierce in his attempt to get the ball from his opponent and Bastian Dankert blows for a foul. Augsburg are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) is going to take the penalty!
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the right post.
Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) is penalised.
Philipp Max (Augsburg) gets a yellow card.
Fabian Holland (Darmstadt) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!
Fabian Holland (Darmstadt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Salif Sane (Hannover) collects a pass and has an effort from 24 metres out, but it flies just over the crossbar.
Hiroshi Kiyotake picks out Adam Szalai (Hannover), who drives a shot just wide of the right post from the edge of the box.
What a big chance! Adam Szalai (Hannover) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
It's in the back of the net! Marcel Risse sprays a pass out to Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Frederik Sorensen (Koln) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Anthony Modeste (Koln) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender.
Thomas Schaaf is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Alexander Milosevic suffers an injury and Hugo Almeida (Hannover) comes on.
Goal - 0:2! Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Yannick Gerhardt provided an assist for the goal.
The referee signals a substitution. Felix Klaus (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Iver Fossum.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Leonardo Bittencourt comes off the pitch to be replaced by Marcel Hartel (Koln).
Substitution. Anthony Modeste makes way for Yuya Osako (Koln).
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Kevin Vogt is replaced by Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Kevin Volland displays great vision and sends a pass to Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the right post. The score is 1:0.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Robert Hartmann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim) replaces Eduardo Vargas.
Poor challenge! Koen Casteels (Wolfsburg) is penalised for tripping and Robert Hartmann blows his whistle. It's a penalty for Hoffenheim!
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Koen Casteels (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) is going to take the penalty!
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) blows a huge chance to score! He sends the penalty to the centre of the goal, but it's not enough to beat Koen Casteels who easily stops the effort.
Today's match ends for Max Kruse who will be replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Fabian Schar and he is replaced by Russell Canouse (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Christian Trasch makes his way off the pitch and Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Maximilian Arnold is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
Here's the change. Andrej Kramaric leaves the pitch and Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Oliver Baumann (Hoffenheim) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Robert Hartmann pulls out a yellow card.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the middle of the goal, but Oliver Baumann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:0.
Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) connects with a cross from the side, but produces a header which goes miles wide of the right post.

It's in the back of the net! Emiliano Insua slips the ball through to Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent low shot into the back of the net. He makes it 1:1.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post.
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Manuel Grafe pulls out a yellow card.

Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the bottom left corner. His effort is blocked by Przemyslaw Tyton with a brilliant diving save! Ingolstadt get a corner.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Danny da Costa (Ingolstadt) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The game has come to an end for Georg Niedermeier. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart).

Perfectly taken free kick! Max Christiansen sends a cross in and Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the middle of the net and the score changes to 2:1.
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
That's the end of the game for Geoffroy Serey Die, who is replaced by Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart).
The foul by Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
Substitution. Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart) has come on for Timo Werner.
Goal disallowed! Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) scores but Manuel Grafe blows his whistle for a foul.
Goal! Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the bottom left corner.
Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.

Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) trips an opponent with a slide tackle. Manuel Grafe stops the game and he could give him a card, but eventually decides on just a warning. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Stuttgart.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
The substitution is prepared. Konstantin Engel (Ingolstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Almog Cohen.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) was probably a bit loose with his words to Manuel Grafe, who decides to show him a yellow.
That will be all from Dario Lezcano who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
What a save from Rune Jarstein! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.
What was Junior Caicara (Schalke) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Genki Haraguchi is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom right corner to make the score 1:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Vladimir Darida takes over corner duties and expertly finds Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the back of the net. The score is now 1:0.
Franco Di Santo (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Johannes Geis.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Alessandro Schopf is replaced by Leroy Sane (Schalke).
Golden chance! Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Max Meyer and he is replaced by Sidney Sam (Schalke).
Today's match ends for Vedad Ibisevic who will be replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Vladimir Darida cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Close! Sidney Sam (Schalke) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot narrowly over the bar.
Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Salomon Kalou will be replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Felix Brych shows the yellow card to Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) for a heavy challenge.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The match has reached half-time.
Felix Brych blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Emir Spahic (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
A yellow card for a tackle by Albin Ekdal (Hamburger). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) replaces Fabian Lustenberger.
Here is a change. Vladimir Darida is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin).
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) receives a precise pass inside the box from Lewis Holtby and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the right side of the net. 2:0.
It is time for a substitution. Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) is on for Albin Ekdal.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Gideon Jung (Hamburger) replaces Aaron Hunt.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) for Mitchell Weiser.
