Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Nicolai Muller is replaced by Nabil Bahoui (Hamburger).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Benjamin Brand didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) for a tough tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Christian Mathenia pulls off a great save to deny Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
A strict call by Benjamin Brand! He pulls out the red card and sends Giulio Donati (Mainz) off the pitch.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) gets on the end of a cross from Sandro Wagner, but his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Benjamin Brand has issued a yellow card to Slobodan Rajkovic (Darmstadt).
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Fabian Frei is replaced by Stefan Bell (Mainz).
Here's the change. Yunus Malli leaves the pitch and Danny Latza (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Dirk Schuster decides to make a substitution. Konstantin Rausch will be replaced by Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt).
Here comes a substitution. Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Pablo De Blasis.
A yellow card for a tackle by Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt). Benjamin Brand doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tobias Kempe trots off the pitch and is replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) holds his head in his hands after wasting a promising chance. He latches onto a rebound, creates some space for himself and fires the ball from the edge of the box into the stands.

Manuel Neuer can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.
A brilliant individual effort! Erik Durm (Dortmund) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Roman Burki anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going low into the middle of the target.
Sven Bender (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.
CLOSE! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Stieler has ended it.
The whistle blows and Tobias Stieler starts the second half.
Great chance! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) latches on to a lofted pass and from the edge of the box sends a powerful shot towards the underside of the crossbar. The goalkeeper, with a little bit of luck, manages to deflect the shot onto the crossbar!
The game has come to an end for Douglas Costa. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Marco Reus.

What a chance that is! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) squanders a huge opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He and produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes well wide of the left post!
Substitution. Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) on for Xabi Alonso.
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Ilkay Gundogan is replaced by Nuri Sahin (Dortmund).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the bar. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Goal! Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.

OFF THE POST! Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) sees a yellow card from Markus Schmidt after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) misses a golden opportunity after his strike hits the post!
Goal 2:0! Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Markus Weinzierl probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Jeong-Ho Hong. He is replaced by Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort into the top right corner.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 3:1. He was ably assisted there by Admir Mehmedi.
Here comes a substitution. Tobias Werner (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Alexander Esswein.
Markus Krosche has decided to substitute Tin Jedvaj and he is replaced by Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen).
The foul by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) attempts to head the ball away from inside the six-yard box, but unluckily he turns a cross from the resulting corner inside the left post of his own net.
The manager makes a subsitution with Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) coming on for Daniel Baier.
Markus Krosche decides to make a substitution. Robbie Kruse will be replaced by Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Christoph Kramer (Bayer Leverkusen). Markus Schmidt doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee shows a red card! Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) has to leave the pitch.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt). Ingolstadt are about to take a penalty!
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!

Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the left side of the goal. Ramazan Ozcan shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) has a big opportunity! He finds some space for a shot inside the penalty box after collecting a lofted pass and sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Lukas Hradecky is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) is booked by the referee.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Caution goes to Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Armin Veh decided to make a change. Marc Stendera is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Ramazan Ozcan has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Yellow card. Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
The referee signals a substitution. Roger (Ingolstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Max Christiansen.

Elias Kachunga (Ingolstadt) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the right-hand post. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Lukas Hradecky with a fabulous save. It will be a corner kick for Ingolstadt.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Substitution. Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) on for Elias Kachunga.
Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) gets a yellow card.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card for infringement.

A perfect lofted pass from Marco Fabian finds Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Ramazan Ozcan had no chance of stopping that. 0:1.
That's the end of the game for Carlos Zambrano, who is replaced by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
What a big chance! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Ralph Hasenhuttl decides to make a substitution. Romain Bregerie will be replaced by Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt).
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) sees a second yellow card from the referee and already knows what will come next. It's a red and the match is over for Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt).
Roger (Ingolstadt) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt).

David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Dominic Maroh (1. FC Koln) gets a yellow card. The referee Wolfgang Stark made the right call. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for Schalke.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) steps up and confidently powers his spot-kick into the bottom right corner.
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) comes close to scoring. He meets a lovely lofted pass from Marcel Risse, but sends his close-range header way wide of the right post.

That was a nice football moment. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Timo Horn guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Schalke force their opponents to concede a corner.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) latched on to an accurate pass deep into the box and attempted to fire the ball past the keeper, but the shot is way off target. What a miskick!
Goal - 0:1! Max Meyer (Schalke) receives a precise pass inside the box from Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
Filip Mladenovic produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) rises high to head the ball into the top right corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:2.

OFF THE BAR! Younes Belhanda (Schalke) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Marcel Risse (Koln) releases a promising shot from the free kick from around 32 metres out. The ball goes towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a decent save and denies him. The ball is out of play. FC Koln will have a chance to score from a corner.
The substitution is prepared. Leroy Sane (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Alessandro Schopf.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Filip Mladenovic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Philipp Hosiner (Koln).

Philipp Hosiner (1. FC Koln) meets a delivery on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the top of the net. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Ralf Fahrmann produces an easy save. FC Koln earn a corner.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar will be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
Goal! A great cross from Dennis Aogo finds Franco Di Santo (Schalke), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 1:3.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) replacing Johannes Geis.
Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) collects a pass and has an effort from distance to the bottom left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann answers with a superb save to deny him. It will be a corner kick for FC Koln.
It will be a substitution. Yuya Osako (Koln) is ready to enter the pitch as Yannick Gerhardt walks off.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

That didn't go as planned! Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort towards the middle of the goal was too weak to get past Oliver Baumann, who easily kept it out.
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) arrives from deep on the pitch and finds his way onto a rebound and scores with a very nice shot.
Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Substitution. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) replaces Ermin Bicakcic.

Artem Kravets sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Christian Gentner goes off the pitch and Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Julian Nagelsmann decides to make a substitution. Jiloan Hamad will be replaced by Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) on for Mark Uth.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Przemyslaw Tyton is alert and denies him.
Gooal! Filip Kostic takes over corner duties. Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the left side of the net. 3:0.
What was Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Golden chance! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The referee signals a substitution. Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Artem Kravets.

Goal! Nadiem Amiri plays in Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box he shoots into the top right corner of the net! Great finish - 3:1.

Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim)'s poor effort is easily saved by Przemyslaw Tyton. He connects well with a cross, but mistimes it a little, and it heads towards the middle of the target and straight into the grateful hands of the goalkeeper.

Goal! Serey Die plays in Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders. He shoots from inside the box into the right side of the net! Great finish - 4:1.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Substitution. Daniel Didavi did his best and is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
Goal Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart)! Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) was put through by Daniel Schwaab and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the right side of the net. 5:1.
Christian Dingert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
CHANCE! Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) fires just wide of the left post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Claudio Pizarro.
Goal 1:0! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) meets a perfect cross from Levin Oztunali deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the roof of the net. It's 2:0.
Substitution. Hotaru Yamaguchi makes way for Adam Szalai (Hannover).
Kenan Karaman (Hannover) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Goal! Kenan Karaman (Hannover) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:1.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
CHANCE! Kenan Karaman (Hannover) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.

Goal! Claudio Pizarro plays in Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box he shoots into the top left corner of the net! Great finish - 3:1.

Theodor Gebre Selassie produces a killer pass to release Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen), who then unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and scores! The ball goes in off the left post, leaving the goalkeeper stranded. 4:1!
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Substitution. Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) in, Clemens Fritz out.
The substitution has been made. Felix Klaus (Hannover) has replaced Iver Fossum.
Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar.
Here is a change. Levin Oztunali is going off and Viktor Skripnik gives the last tactical orders to Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen).
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The referee signals a substitution. Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Santiago Garcia.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
After a scramble inside the penalty area the ball falls to Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) who unleashes a weak but precise shot which goes in off the right post.
Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass inside the box from Maximilian Arnold and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the right side of the net. 2:0.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball under the crossbar.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Koen Casteels.
Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Andreas Christensen (B. Monchengladbach) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
What was Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Dieter Hecking makes a switch. Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) is coming on in place of Vieirinha at the start of the second period.
The ball rebounds outside of the penalty area and falls to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) who directs his shot to the right side of the goal, but the keeper is there in time to stop his effort.

Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) was all set to celebrate a sensational goal after he collected a rebound and blasted a shot in from long range. Unfortunately for him, his effort crashed against the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) on for Mahmoud Dahoud.
Yellow card. Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.
Here comes a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Julian Draxler.
Andre Schubert decides to make a substitution. Thorgan Hazard will be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Fabian Johnson comes off the pitch to be replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Andre Schurrle and he is replaced by Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
Daniel Siebert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) meets a cross just outside the area and gets in a strike from a promising position, but the shot is blocked by the defender.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.
It's in the back of the net! Fabian Johnson is the provider as he slips the ball to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:0.
Oscar Wendt is substituted due to injury. Andre Schubert gives a chance to Martin Hinteregger (B. Monchengladbach).
CHANCE! Raffael finds Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the left post!
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself some space just outside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going low into the middle of the target.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Tobias Welz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
The game is over for Serey Die. Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) comes on for the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Timo Werner is replaced by Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart).
Yann Sommer makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the right-hand post by Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart) after a cross from the side.
What a huge chance for Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Thorgan Hazard picks out Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who drives a shot just wide of the right post from the edge of the box.

Lars Stindl sprays a wonderful pass out to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Przemyslaw Tyton problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just over the crossbar.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:0.
Christian Gentner comes off the pitch to be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
Andre Schubert has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Thorgan Hazard.

GOAL! Superb work from Mahmoud Dahoud, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach), who beats Przemyslaw Tyton with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 3:0.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mahmoud Dahoud walks off the pitch to be replaced by Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach).
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for a sharp discussion with the referee. He should relax or he could be sent off.
Own goal! Kevin Grosskreutz (VfB Stuttgart) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 3:0.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) collects a delightful pass inside the box and nets with a perfect low drive into the middle of the goal. What a clinical finish!

Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the right post.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) gets booked.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Markus Krosche makes a half-time substitution. Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Julian Brandt.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Felix Wiedwald guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Goal! Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) skips past challenges and from close range brilliantly chips the ball over Bernd Leno. 0:2. Wonderful individual effort.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) for Fin Bartels.
Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) is given a yellow card.
Marco Fritz blows his whistle after Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Werder Bremen!
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.

Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) attempts to head the ball away after a cross into the penalty area, but instead he accidentally sends it inside the left post of his own goal. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Markus Krosche is forced to make a change. Roberto Hilbert is unable to continue due to injury, Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Zlatko Junuzovic takes over corner duties and expertly finds Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the back of the net. The score is now 0:3.
Today's match ends for Claudio Pizarro who will be replaced by Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen).
Here is a change. Chicharito is going off and Markus Krosche gives the last tactical orders to Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Laszlo Kleinheisler (Werder Bremen) on for Clemens Fritz.
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the left side of the goal, but Loris Karius was alert and made an astonishing save! The linesman points to the corner flag, Bayern Munich are going to take it.

Loris Karius was forced into action to thwart Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) fails to score from the rebound as the goalkeeper stops his effort from hitting the net.

Goal! Giulio Donati produces a great pass that finds Jairo Samperio (Mainz) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot past the goalkeeper and into the back of the net. 0:0.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the left of the target.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Sascha Stegemann starts the second half.
Martin Schmidt has made a change at the break. Danny Latza (Mainz) has come on in place of Niko Bungert.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
What a big chance! Christian Clemens (Mainz) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball well wide of the left post.
The substitution has been made. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) has replaced Kingsley Coman.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 27 metres out. Loris Karius pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the bottom left corner.
It's time for a substitution. Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) comes on in place of Thiago Alcantara.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Yunus Malli will be replaced by Jhon Cordoba (Mainz).
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Leon Balogun (Mainz) for his blatant foul. A free kick has been awarded to Bayern Munich.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 22 metres out which goes into the bottom right corner.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Martin Schmidt is forced to make a change. Giulio Donati is unable to continue due to injury, Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) comes on.

Gaetan Bussmann (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests. Bayern Munich are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Goal - 1:2! Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Julian Baumgartlinger provided an assist for the goal.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the top left corner is smartly dealt with by Loris Karius.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends his bullet header just wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play. Dortmund will have a chance to score from a corner.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the left post.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Christian Mathenia, who pulls off a stunning save!
Goal! The rebound fell to Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:1.
Christian Mathenia pulls off a great save to deny Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.

A superb goal from great team play! Erik Durm (Dortmund) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Sandro Wagner plays a lovely pass into Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly over the crossbar.
It will be a substitution. Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) is ready to enter the pitch as Mario Vrancic walks off.
Here is a change. Felix Passlack is going off and Thomas Tuchel gives the last tactical orders to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund).

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) doesn't hesitate and begins a run towards the opponent's goal. Defenders try to tackle him, but he manages to keep the ball at his feet and pulls the trigger in front of the goal. The strike, though, was not as successful as the solo run and the ball is easily stopped by the keeper.
Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Christian Mathenia makes a great save to stop his effort.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
The substitution has been made. Felix Platte (Darmstadt) has replaced Peter Niemeyer.
Substitution. Moritz Leitner (Dortmund) has come on for Ilkay Gundogan.
Dirk Schuster has decided to substitute Marcel Heller and he is replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Knut Kircher didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Eintracht Frankfurt will take a free kick.
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Knut Kircher and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Eintracht Frankfurt have a free kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) misses a big chance after the ball is crossed into the penalty box, with his shot going well wide of the right post.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee. A free kick has been awarded to Hertha Berlin.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Knut Kircher ignores the protests.

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal-bound header towards the left post, but Lukas Hradecky pulls off a fine save to deny him. Now Hertha Berlin have a corner.

Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) finds himself in a great shooting position after receiving a low pass from Salomon Kalou just outside the box. He unleashes a spectacular first-timer which goes in off the inside of the left post. Phenomenal stuff! 1:0.
Substitution. Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) has come on for Genki Haraguchi.
Szabolcs Huszti comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
What a chance that is! Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the left post.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Lukas Hradecky with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:0.
Marc Stendera goes off the pitch and Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Here is a change. Vladimir Darida is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Salomon Kalou trots off the pitch and is replaced by Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin).
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Marwin Hitz makes a great save to stop his effort.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just wide of the right post.
Oliver Baumann makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the top right corner by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) after a cross from the side.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Goal! Philipp Ochs puts the ball on a plate for Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:0.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) can count himself lucky for not being sent off after only receiving a caution from the referee.
Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) handles the ball inside the box. The referee points to the penalty spot. Augsburg are awarded a penalty kick!
The expression of the referee Guido Winkmann is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a low shot inside the left post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann makes a switch. Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) is coming on in place of Pirmin Schwegler at the start of the second period.

Pavel Kaderabek sprays a wonderful pass out to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Marwin Hitz problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just wide of the left post.
The referee signals a substitution. Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Alfred Finnbogason.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) is angry with himself. The ball breaks to him but he hits the right post!
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) gets a yellow card.
Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) is yellow-carded.
The substitution has been made. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) has replaced Eduardo Vargas.
Philipp Ochs is being substituted because of an injury. Julian Nagelsmann sends Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) on the pitch.

Marwin Hitz makes a wonderful save! Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) got to the rebound and sent in a fine header under the crossbar, but he couldn't beat the keeper. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Hoffenheim.
Here is a change. Ja-Cheol Koo is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
Goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the roof of the net. Andrej Kramaric assisted in the goal. 1:1.
Halil Altintop will be replaced by Tobias Werner (Augsburg).
Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) receives a harsh yellow card from the referee after committing a minor foul on his opponent.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 0:1.

Rene Adler stretches to his right and makes a brilliant save! Younes Belhanda (Schalke) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the bottom left corner. Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.
Dennis Aogo (Schalke) wins the ball from the resulting free kick and blazes his shot high over the crossbar!

Ralf Fahrmann can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Lewis Holtby (Hamburger). The ball would have probably ended up inside the right post. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hamburger SV will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Rene Adler is alert and denies him with a nice save.

Max Meyer (Schalke) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the right side of the net, but the effort is smothered by the keeper. The ball goes out of play and Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.

What a beautiful moment! Max Meyer (Schalke) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way inside the right post. Rene Adler just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:1.

Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Gunter Perl ignores the protests. Schalke win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Johannes Geis (Schalke) sends in a direct shot from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Roman Neustadter (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
RED CARD! Johan Djourou (Hamburger) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Gunter Perl. He can have an early bath.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Josip Drmic is replaced by Cleber (Hamburger).
Max Meyer sprays a pass out to Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar.

Younes Belhanda (Schalke) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the right post. His effort, however, is blocked by Rene Adler, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
The foul by Junior Caicara (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Gunter Perl.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga comes off the pitch to be replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).

Alessandro Schopf produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:1.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.
It's in the back of the net! Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Rene Adler. He makes it 3:1.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Substitution. Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) on for Lewis Holtby.
Here is a change. Max Meyer is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Sead Kolasinac (Schalke).
Alessandro Schopf comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sascha Riether (Schalke).
The substitution has been made. Sidney Sam (Schalke) has replaced Younes Belhanda.
GOAL! Nicolai Muller produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) rises high to head the ball into the bottom right corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 3:2.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Kenan Karaman (Hannover) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Koen Casteels gets down to his right to keep it out.
The foul by Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
A header by Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) from very close range goes towards the middle of the target, but doesn't get past Ron-Robert Zieler, who makes a nice save.
Julian Draxler plays a neat ball into the path of Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg), who makes room for a shot and fires in off the right post! 0:1.
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Marius Wolf (Hannover) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Thomas Schaaf probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Andre Hoffmann. He is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hannover).
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Christian Schulz (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save!
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) quickly picks up the rebound and drills the ball towards the right side of the goal. The opponent's goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him. Wolfsburg have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Goal! Luiz Gustavo displays great vision and sends a pass to Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:2.

Goal! Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the middle of the net. Ron-Robert Zieler is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 0:3.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Felix Klaus (Hannover) is coming onto the pitch as Marius Wolf cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.

Stunning strike! Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise through ball from Max Kruse before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the back of the net from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 0:4.
Substitution. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Josuha Guilavogui walks off.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 20 metres out. Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Wolfsburg.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Draxler trots off the pitch and is replaced by Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Andre Schurrle will be replaced by Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg).
Koen Casteels pulls off a great save to deny Kenan Karaman (Hannover), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. Hannover win a corner.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Marcel Risse is the provider with a good cross and Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) shows great determination to get to the ball on the edge of the box, but he fires a shot well wide of the left post.
The defence had a hard time blocking out the strike from Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt). He didn't hesitate and finished from outside the box right after he had received a pass from his teammate.
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully wide of the left post!
It's a goal! Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) scores with a brilliant shot into the roof of the net after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Danny da Costa. The score is now 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Florian Meyer blows his whistle to start the second half.
The expression of the referee Florian Meyer is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Dominic Maroh (1. FC Koln) is shown a yellow card.
Roger (Ingolstadt) lashes the ball towards goal from outside the penalty area, but it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leonardo Bittencourt departs the field of play to be replaced by Philipp Hosiner (Koln).
Dominique Heintz comes off the pitch to be replaced by Filip Mladenovic (Koln).

Marcel Risse (Koln) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Goal! Anthony Modeste (Koln) meets a headed pass from Marcel Risse and puts the ball into the net with a powerful header. He makes it 1:1.
Danny da Costa will be replaced by Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt).
Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.

Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln) reacts well to get to the rebound and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but he fails to get the ball through the players standing between him and the goal. FC Koln have a corner.
Substitution. Dario Lezcano walks off the pitch and Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) comes on as a substitute.
What a chance that is! Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee signals a substitution. Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Almog Cohen.
Peter Stoger is forced to make a change. Anthony Modeste is unable to continue due to injury, Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln) comes on.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
CHANCE! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Junior Caicara.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and glances off the crossbar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Ralf Fahrmann, who pulls off a stunning save!
The substitution has been made. Max Meyer (Schalke) has replaced Junior Caicara.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Younes Belhanda departs the field of play to be replaced by Leroy Sane (Schalke).
Carlos Zambrano is substituted due to injury. Armin Veh gives a chance to Yanni Regasel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
It's time for a substitution. Franco Di Santo (Schalke) comes on in place of Klaas-Jan Huntelaar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Szabolcs Huszti.
Here is a change. Marc Stendera is going off and Armin Veh gives the last tactical orders to Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A yellow card for a tackle by Dennis Aogo (Schalke). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The expression of the referee Felix Brych is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Max Meyer (Schalke) is shown a yellow card.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Felix Brych pulls out a yellow card.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the target, but Roman Burki easily deals with the threat.
Goal! Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 0:1.

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Roman Burki guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Shinji Kagawa will not participate anymore and Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) is coming on.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) receives a red card due to his mindless behaviour. His team will now have to play with a man down.
Substitution. Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) has come on for Nadiem Amiri.
Substitution. Kevin Volland did his best and is replaced by Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Moritz Leitner (Dortmund) replacing Nuri Sahin.
Julian Weigl comes off the pitch to be replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) changes the scoreline after getting on the end of a brilliant pass and firing a precise shot that goes inside the right post!
Lukasz Piszczek produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:1.
It will be a substitution. Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) is ready to enter the pitch as Mark Uth walks off.
What a big chance! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
It's in the back of the net! Henrikh Mkhitaryan sprays a pass out to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:1.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.

What a goal that is! Yunus Malli (Mainz) received the ball on the edge of the 18-yard box and spotted the goalkeeper off his line. He set himself up perfectly and lobbed the ball over Bernd Leno and into the net. Pablo De Blasis provided the assistance. 1:0.
Gaetan Bussmann (Mainz) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the left post.

Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Bernd Leno has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Yunus Malli (Mainz) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Markus Krosche has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on the pitch for Jonathan Tah.

Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Bernd Leno is alert and denies him with a nice save. Mainz force a corner. They send men into the box.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. PENALTY! One of the players from Mainz is about to take a penalty kick.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) fires the penalty inside the left post.
Substitution. Julian Brandt is replaced by Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen).

Admir Mehmedi produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 3:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Clemens (Mainz) comes onto the pitch for Pablo De Blasis.

Loris Karius pulls off a great save to deny Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the top right corner. Now Bayer Leverkusen have a corner.
A substitution has been made. Admir Mehmedi is replaced by Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen).
Yunus Malli comes off the pitch to be replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).
Here is a change. Jairo Samperio is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Daniel Brosinski (Mainz).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Good touch by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.
Goal - 0:1! Ibrahima Traore laid the ball off to Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who shot from close range into the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Markus Weinzierl makes a half-time substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) comes on in place of Jan Moravek.
Paul Verhaegh produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box where Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) rises high to head the ball off the woodwork into the top left corner. The score is now - 1:1.
Goal! Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:2.

Goal! Nico Elvedi displays great vision and sends a pass to Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:2.
Mahmoud Dahoud goes off the pitch and Martin Hinteregger (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Andre Schubert has decided to substitute Ibrahima Traore and he is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) misses a big opportunity to score after striking the ball wide of the right post.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Christoph Janker (Augsburg) replacing Ja-Cheol Koo.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Raul Bobadilla leaves the pitch and Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) comes on.
That's the end of the game for Thorgan Hazard, who is replaced by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach).
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) misses a golden opportunity after his strike hits the post!
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Goal! Josip Drmic (Hamburger) scores after an assist by Aaron Hunt that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Emir Spahic (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Marco Fritz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and leaps to connect with a cross from the corner kick. He produces a fine header, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Lewis Holtby (Hamburger), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.
Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Bruno Labbadia makes a switch. Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) is coming on in place of Nicolai Muller at the start of the second period.
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.

Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) jumped highest to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Pascal Gross. His header was precise and ended up in the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:0.
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Rene Adler pulls off a great save to deny Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the top right corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aaron Hunt leaves the pitch and Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) comes on.
That was close by Gideon Jung (Hamburger)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) replaces Artjoms Rudnevs.
Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The expression of the referee Marco Fritz is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) is shown a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) comes onto the pitch so that Dario Lezcano can be given a rest.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Lukas Hinterseer and he is replaced by Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Kenan Karaman (Hannover) gathers a nice lofted pass deep inside the box and attempts to put the ball low inside the left post, but his shot is deflected away by one of the defending players.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) celebrates a stunning goal. He manages to win himself just enough space to meet the resulting set piece inside the box and produces a perfect header into the top of the net.

Kenan Karaman (Hannover) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Przemyslaw Tyton to get hold of the ball.

Christian Schulz (Hannover) rises above the defence inside the box and scores with a well-placed header from the free kick. The ball flies in off the crossbar. He introduces himself with a fabulous goal.

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a lofted pass and is given time inside the box to unleash a shot goalwards. The ball is directed towards the bottom right corner, but it lacks power and Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort. The ball is out of play. Stuttgart win a corner kick.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Tempers flare after Hotaru Yamaguchi (Hannover) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety.
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
Filip Kostic slides a brilliant pass into Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Geoffroy Serey Die walks off.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to substitute Marius Wolf and he is replaced by Felix Klaus (Hannover).
Timo Werner comes off the pitch to be replaced by Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart).
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper. Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick.

Christian Schulz (Hannover) shows good awareness deep inside the box and jumps high to meet a perfect cross from the set piece. He steers a fine header goalwards, but finds the keeper prepared. No doubt about the wonderful save that he made.
Goal! Christian Schulz (Hannover) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:2.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Iver Fossum walks off the pitch to be replaced by Artur Sobiech (Hannover).

What a wasted opportunity by Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart)! He creates himself some space inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the left side of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler makes an astonishing save to thwart him. Stuttgart get a corner.
Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the right of the target.
The game has come to an end for Hiroshi Kiyotake. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Waldemar Anton (Hannover).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes just over the bar.

Felix Wiedwald hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The ball goes out of play. Darmstadt are awarded a corner kick.
Close! Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) unleashes a rocket of a shot from the edge of the box and his shot flies just a few inches over the crossbar.
Goal! Sambou Yatabare gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 1:0.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Slobodan Rajkovic (Darmstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle for a foul after Felix Wiedwald (Werder Bremen) hacks down one of his opponents. The referee gives a penalty to Darmstadt!
A yellow card for a tackle by Felix Wiedwald (Werder Bremen). Robert Hartmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Felix Wiedwald to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Dirk Schuster makes a switch. Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) is coming on in place of Konstantin Rausch at the start of the second period.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
Substitution. Laszlo Kleinheisler (Werder Bremen) replaces Sambou Yatabare.
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the middle of the goal, but Christian Mathenia pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Robert Hartmann shows the yellow card to Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) for a heavy challenge.
Wow, what an escape. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
It's in the back of the net! Tobias Kempe puts the ball on a plate for Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 1:2.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. It will be a corner kick for Werder Bremen.
Gooal! Zlatko Junuzovic takes over corner duties. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the left side of the net. 2:2.
Dirk Schuster has decided to substitute Jan Rosenthal and he is replaced by Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt).
A substitution has been made. Marcel Heller is replaced by Felix Platte (Darmstadt).
Robert Hartmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the bottom right corner, but Manuel Neuer keeps the ball out.
Golden chance! Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Manuel Grafe starts the second half.
Douglas Costa goes off the pitch and Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Today's match ends for Arjen Robben who will be replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).

Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The referee signals a corner kick to Wolfsburg.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) unleashes a powerful shot towards goal, but it is bravely blocked by a self-sacrificing defender.
Goal! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
Substitution. Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) in, Christian Trasch out.

Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot inside the right post. Franck Ribery assisted in the goal. 0:0.
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Naldo is replaced by Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg).
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge. Wolfsburg win a free kick and will be able to apply some pressure on the opposition goal.

Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner.
Manuel Neuer was forced into action to thwart Max Kruse (Wolfsburg). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marcel Schafer as he is replaced by Ismail Azzaoui (Wolfsburg).
Pep Guardiola has decided to substitute Kingsley Coman and he is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Mergim Mavraj (Koln) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed narrowly wide of the left post!
What a chance that is! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.

Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) unleashes a decent strike from 25 metres out towards the roof of the net, but Timo Horn is equal to it. Fantastic goalkeeping! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hertha Berlin.
Filip Mladenovic (1. FC Koln) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Rune Jarstein is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom right corner. Magnificent finish!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Filip Mladenovic is replaced by Philipp Hosiner (1. FC Koln).
It must be a yellow card. It is. John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) receives the caution after an awful tackle. FC Koln win a free kick.
Fabian Lustenberger will be replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
That will be all from Jonas Hector who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Milos Jojic (Koln).
That's a clear yellow card. Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) goes into the book.
CLOSE! Marcel Risse (Koln) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the left post!
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Milos Jojic (Koln) for his blatant foul.
Here is a change. Leonardo Bittencourt is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Marcel Hartel (1. FC Koln).
Substitution. Salomon Kalou leaves the pitch and is replaced by Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).

OFF THE POST! Anthony Modeste (Koln) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
We are about to witness a substitution. Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Genki Haraguchi.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Ron-Robert Zieler with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.
A brilliant cross into the box finds Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg), who directs his header to the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes an astonishing save.

What an amazing save by Ron-Robert Zieler! Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the left side of the target, but fails.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Edgar Prib is replaced by Hugo Almeida (Hannover).
Here is a change after the half-time break. Andre Hoffmann is replaced by Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover).
Markus Weinzierl makes a switch. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) is coming on in place of Markus Feulner at the start of the second period.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Salif Sane (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
It's time for a substitution. Tobias Werner (Augsburg) comes on in place of Alexander Esswein.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Hugo Almeida (Hannover) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The manager makes a subsitution with Christoph Janker (Augsburg) coming on for Alfred Finnbogason.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to substitute Uffe Bech and he is replaced by Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover).
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) has an effort on goal, but he misses to the right of the goal.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Tobias Werner (Augsburg) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the bottom right corner. However, he couldn't beat Ron-Robert Zieler, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Tobias Werner (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Alexander Milosevic (Hannover) rises above the defence and powers a header at the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper denies him with a superb save.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
