Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Ralf Fahrmann is alert and denies him with a nice save. Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Przemyslaw Tyton.

Younes Belhanda (Schalke) attempts to convert a rebound into a goal with a header from outside the box. He manages to surprise the defence and changes the score to 0:0 after striking the ball into the left side of the target.
Joel Matip (Schalke) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
Andre Breitenreiter is forced to make a change. Maxim Choupo-Moting is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Leroy Sane (Schalke).
Today's referee Bastian Dankert rightly decides to book Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) for his harsh tackle.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Przemyslaw Tyton, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball is out of play. Schalke win a corner kick.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Daniel Didavi as he is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
Jurgen Kramny decides to make a substitution. Timo Werner will be replaced by Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart).
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Younes Belhanda (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch for Geoffroy Serey Die.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar comes off the pitch to be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
What a chance! The ball is inside the box and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) takes a first-time shot on goal, but his volley goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the middle of the goal is comfortably saved by the goalkeeper.
Goal! The rebound fell to Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by Alessandro Schopf (Schalke). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Leroy Sane (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Today's match ends for Younes Belhanda who will be replaced by Dennis Aogo (Schalke).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
Golden chance! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Felix Zwayer blows his whistle to start the second half.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) comes onto the pitch after Omer Toprak signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Half-time substitution. Christian Pulisic is replaced by Marco Reus (Dortmund).
The game is over for Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen).  comes on for the second half.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Roman Burki, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Felix Zwayer lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
The foul by Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.
The substitution is prepared. Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Tin Jedvaj.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Goal! Erik Durm puts the ball across the area and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 0:1.
The game is interrupted.
Everything seems to be alright after the game was interrupted, the referee blows his whistle and the match can continue.
Here comes a substitution. Sven Bender is given a rest as he is replaced by Julian Weigl (Dortmund).
Problems for Thomas Tuchel as Sokratis is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Neven Subotic (Dortmund) replaces him.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Erik Durm (Dortmund), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Bernd Leno to get hold of the ball.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Chance! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Karim Bellarabi, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Fantastic team goal! Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) was set free in the area by Raffael and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
That was close. Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) fires a shot from the edge of the box which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Golden chance! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.

Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up inside the left post, but Timo Horn pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to B. Monchengladbach.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The game is over for Yuya Osako. Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) comes on for the second half.
Dominic Maroh (Koln) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) receives a yellow card.
Goal disallowed! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) scores but Knut Kircher blows his whistle for a foul.
Milos Jojic (Koln) quickly picks up the rebound and drills the ball towards the left side of the goal. The opponent's goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marcel Hartel (Koln) comes onto the pitch so that Filip Mladenovic can be given a rest.
Andre Schubert prepares a substitution. Nico Elvedi is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) earns the yellow card.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Philipp Hosiner (Koln) for Leonardo Bittencourt.

What a great chance for Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
Pawel Olkowski (Koln) is cautioned by the referee.
Philipp Hosiner (Koln) is punished with the yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Raffael walks off the pitch to be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Andre Schubert has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Mahmoud Dahoud.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) gets a shot away from about 28 metres after his amazing solo run. It goes to the roof of the net, but Christian Mathenia refuses to be beaten easily and he pulls off an exquisite save to keep the ball out. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick.
What a chance for Rafinha (Bayern Munich) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Christian Mathenia is alert and denies him with a nice save.
What a sweet touch by Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Christian Mathenia to hold.

Sandro Sirigu sends a superb cross into the box. Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Manuel Neuer beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) fires in a shot from the edge of the box which deflects off one of the defending players and hits the crossbar! The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Bayern Munich.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.

Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the bottom left corner, but is stopped by a great save from Christian Mathenia and the score remains the same.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
It's in the back of the net! Rafinha plays it into the box, and Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the right post. 1:1.
Michael Weiner shows a yellow card to Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.
Serdar Tasci (Bayern Munich) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Kingsley Coman.
Pep Guardiola has decided to substitute Serdar Tasci and he is replaced by Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich).
It is time for a substitution. Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) is on for Mario Vrancic.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
What a goal that is! Arturo Vidal sends a brilliant cross into the box and Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) scores a stunning bicycle kick goal! Wow, take a bow gentlemen. 2:1.
Marco Sailer (Darmstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sandro Sirigu.

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the top right corner. The effort, however, is blocked by Christian Mathenia, who pulls off a stunning save! It will be a corner kick for Bayern Munich.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Substitution. Arjen Robben makes way for Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich).
It's a goal! Franck Ribery plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 3:1.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Christian Mathenia makes a decent save to deny his effort directed low to the middle of the target. Bayern Munich will take a corner kick.
Substitution. Fabian Holland will be replaced by Benjamin Gorka (Darmstadt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card from Sascha Stegemann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Chance! Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Salomon Kalou, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.
Sebastian Langkamp is substituted due to injury. Pal Dardai gives a chance to Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin).
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Sascha Stegemann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
It's a goal! Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) scores with a brilliant shot into the right side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Vieirinha. The score is 0:0.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
The game has come to an end for Vladimir Darida. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).

OFF THE POST! Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Rune Jarstein shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the right side of the goal, but Rune Jarstein keeps it out with an amazing save. The linesman makes the right call and Wolfsburg will have a corner.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make. Wolfsburg win a free kick and will be able to apply some pressure on the opposition goal.
Substitution. Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) on for Maximilian Arnold.
The main referee, Sascha Stegemann, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Yellow card. Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent. Hertha Berlin have a free kick.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.

Goal! Jairo Samperio displays great vision and sends a pass to Jhon Cordoba (Mainz), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:1.
Goal! Eduardo Vargas provides Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 1:1.
What was Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Leon Balogun (Mainz) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Gunter Perl starts the second half.
Substitution. Danny Latza will be replaced by Fabian Frei (Mainz).
Substitution. Eduardo Vargas leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim).
It's a goal! Kevin Volland plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Mark Uth (Hoffenheim). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:1.
Substitution. Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) in, Nadiem Amiri out.
Goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Pavel Kaderabek. The score is 3:1.
Christian Clemens comes off the pitch to be replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Goal - 3:2! Jairo Samperio (Mainz) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the left post. Fabian Frei provided an assist for the goal.
Substitution. Christoph Moritz (Mainz) on for Daniel Brosinski.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) replaces Sebastian Rudy.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) argues strongly with the referee and is awarded a yellow card. A needless yellow card!
Gunter Perl is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Felix Wiedwald pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) shakes his head in disbelief after spurning a great chance. He pounced on the rebound and smashed the ball against the crossbar!
Goal 1:0! Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Tobias Welz shows the yellow card to Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) for a heavy challenge.
Yellow card. Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Welz has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Viktor Skripnik decided to make a change. Levin Oztunali is replaced by Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Danny da Costa (Ingolstadt). Tobias Welz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Alejandro Galvez is replaced by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen).
Dario Lezcano is being substituted because of an injury. Ralph Hasenhuttl sends Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) on the pitch.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Florian Grillitsch.
Here is a change. Moritz Hartmann is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Tobias Welz signals. The referee gives a penalty kick to Ingolstadt!!
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the right side of the goal.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Elias Kachunga (Ingolstadt) replaces Mathew Leckie.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

This is a yellow card! Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear. A clumsy foul by Johan Djourou (Hamburger) and Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle.

Lukas Hradecky pulls off a great save to deny Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Good work from Hamburger SV as they win a corner.
Close! Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) unleashes a rocket of a shot from the edge of the box and his shot flies just a few inches over the crossbar.

Josip Drmic (Hamburger) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected. Josip Drmic (Hamburger) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Wolfgang Stark no option but to blow his whistle.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Nicolai Muller (Hamburger), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
Wolfgang Stark has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Wolfgang Stark starts the second half.
Armin Veh makes a switch. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming on in place of Szabolcs Huszti at the start of the second period.
What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) attempts to discuss the decision with Wolfgang Stark, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Substitution. Nicolai Muller makes way for Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger).
Artjoms Rudnevs comes off the pitch to be replaced by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).

Rene Adler was forced into action to thwart Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the top right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The linesman points to the corner flag, Eintracht Frankfurt are going to take it.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker.
The manager makes a subsitution with Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) coming on for Josip Drmic.
Marc Stendera is being substituted because of an injury. Armin Veh sends Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) on the pitch.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) was too forceful with his tackle and Wolfgang Stark interrupted the game to signal a free kick. Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) makes a rough challenge and Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle for a foul. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) is yellow-carded.
Armin Veh prepares a substitution. Stefan Aigner is replaced by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the bottom left corner.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) misses a promising chance to score from the free kick, but Marwin Hitz makes a decent save.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Florian Meyer starts the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Piotr Trochowski is given a rest as he is replaced by Jan Moravek (Augsburg).
Here is a change. Ja-Cheol Koo is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Alexander Esswein (Augsburg).
Arturo Vidal comes off the pitch to be replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to a killer pass deep inside the box and coolly puts the ball inside the right post!
The goalkeeper pulls off a great save to deny Rafinha (Bayern Munich), whose good effort would probably have ended inside the right post. Corner kick. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity.
Jeong-Ho Hong is being substituted because of an injury. Markus Weinzierl sends Christoph Janker (Augsburg) on the pitch.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Goal! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Douglas Costa. The score is 0:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Douglas Costa departs the field of play to be replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Philipp Lahm will be replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) collects a sweet pass and fires a low shot into the bottom right corner, leaving the keeper helpless.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
Florian Meyer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Josip Drmic (Hamburger) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Yann Sommer.
What a brilliant finish! Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and fires the ball past the helpless goalkeeper.

Josip Drmic (Hamburger) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Yann Sommer to get hold of the ball. Hamburger SV will take a corner kick.
Yellow card. Cleber (Hamburger) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Yann Sommer pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick.
A cross from the corner kick arrives close to the penalty spot. Cleber (Hamburger) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the bar!
Martin Hinteregger (B. Monchengladbach) scores an unlucky own goal! He deflects a shot into his own net.
Emir Spahic (Hamburger) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Goal! Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.

CHANCE! Josip Drmic (Hamburger) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top. The ball goes out of play and B. Monchengladbach will have a goal kick.
It will be a substitution. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) is ready to enter the pitch as Mahmoud Dahoud walks off.
Substitution. Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Nicolai Muller walks off.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Artjoms Rudnevs departs the field of play to be replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
Goal! Emir Spahic finds Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) with a headed pass and the latter glances a header past the goalkeeper to make it 3:1.
Today's match ends for Thorgan Hazard who will be replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Josip Drmic (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.

Oscar Wendt is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom right corner to make the score 3:2.
Andre Schubert has decided to substitute Martin Hinteregger and he is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).

What a chance that is! Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.
It is time for a substitution. Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) is on for Aaron Hunt.
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Simon Zoller is substituted due to injury. Peter Stoger gives a chance to Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln).
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge. A free kick has been awarded to FC Koln.

What a great chance for Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. Eintracht Frankfurt earn a corner.
It's in the back of the net! Szabolcs Huszti plays it into the box, and Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the left post. 0:1.

GOAL! Superb work from Anthony Modeste, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln), who beats Lukas Hradecky with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Felix Zwayer starts the second half.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Yanni Regasel (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card.
The foul by Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer. FC Koln will take a free kick.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Perfectly taken free kick! Filip Mladenovic sends the ball in, Dominique Heintz (Koln) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header inside the right post. It's 2:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Makoto Hasebe departs the field of play to be replaced by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!
A yellow card for a tackle by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card.
Lukas Hradecky pulls off a great save to deny Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
It's a goal! Yannick Gerhardt plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Anthony Modeste (Koln). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 3:1.
Armin Veh prepares a substitution. Marco Fabian is replaced by Anis Ben-Hatira (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The manager makes a subsitution with Kevin Vogt (Koln) coming on for Filip Mladenovic.
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leonardo Bittencourt leaves the pitch and Frederik Sorensen (Koln) comes on.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Lukas Hradecky guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The referee shows the yellow card to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen).

Bernd Leno can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Here comes a substitution. Marlon Frey is given a rest as he is replaced by Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen).
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) is unlucky enough to head the ball into his own net. 1:1.
This is a yellow card! Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
A substitution has been made. Jan Rosenthal goes off and Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) comes on.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Christian Mathenia to get hold of the ball.
A rebound finds its way to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) and he scores with a powerful strike, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The manager makes a subsitution with  coming on for Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Karim Bellarabi will be replaced by Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen).
Jerome Gondorf comes off the pitch to be replaced by Felix Platte (Darmstadt).
A yellow card is awarded to Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt).
Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
The substitution is prepared. Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Tobias Kempe.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) receives a yellow card.
is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) is cautioned by the referee.
The game is interrupted. Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Ron-Robert Zieler gets a well deserved ovation! Marco Reus (Dortmund) produces a decent first-time strike goalwards, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) tries to beat the goalkeeper from a set piece from some 19 metres out. He's very close, but his effort only bounces off the crossbar!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Edgar Prib (Hannover) was quite harsh and Gunter Perl didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Roman Burki, who pulls off a comfortable save! The ball goes behind for a corner. Hannover will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) hammers the ball goalwards from about 20 metres. The shot is directed to the bottom left corner but is thwarted by a save from Ron-Robert Zieler. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Dortmund will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) scores a splendid goal as he finishes his great individual effort with a venomous shot from around 19 metres out into the bottom right corner. Take a bow son. The score is now 1:0.
The substitution has been made. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) has replaced Gonzalo Castro.
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) for a tough tackle.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) for Edgar Prib.
It's time for a substitution. Julian Weigl (Dortmund) comes on in place of Matthias Ginter.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Henrikh Mkhitaryan and he is replaced by Erik Durm (Dortmund).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a chance that is! Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.
Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) gets booked for the first time in this match.

Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) takes the free kick from the edge of the box and fires the ball goalwards. The goalkeeper can stay calm as the shot sails high over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.

That was a nice football moment. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom left corner. Przemyslaw Tyton guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Great ball in from Vladimir Darida. Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Przemyslaw Tyton made an astonishing save!
Geoffroy Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball inside the right post, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.

John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) wasted a clear opportunity. He fired a first-time shot from point-blank range, but it rattled the left post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
The substitution has been made. Julian Schieber has replaced Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin).
The game has begun to heat up. Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
What was John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Timo Werner walks off the pitch to be replaced by Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) replaces Tolga Cigerci.
Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) is booked for saying more than Christian Dingert was willing to tolerate.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kevin Grosskreutz (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That will be all from Alexandru Maxim who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart).
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch so that Geoffroy Serey Die can be given a rest.
Rune Jarstein pulls off a great save to deny Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

The ball hits the back of the net! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) meets a brilliant cross from Tobias Strobl and scores with a bullet header from close range in off the left post. Felix Wiedwald had no chance of stopping that. The score is 0:1.
Goal! Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Oliver Baumann. He makes it 1:1.

Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the right side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. The ball is out of play. Werder Bremen will have a chance to score from a corner.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) comes on the pitch for Alejandro Galvez.
What was Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make.
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
We are about to witness a substitution. Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) is replacing Sebastian Rudy.
Substitution. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Fin Bartels walks off.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Philipp Ochs and he is replaced by Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim).
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) for a tough tackle.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card in the hand of Benjamin Brand. And as it's a second one this game, a red follows and Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is sent from the pitch.
Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He plants his header against the crossbar!
It will be a substitution. Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is ready to enter the pitch as Nadiem Amiri walks off.
The game is interrupted. Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Ralph Hasenhuttl is forced to make a change. Mathew Leckie is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Maurice Multhaup (Ingolstadt).
It's in the back of the net! Daniel Caligiuri plays it into the box, and Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 0:0.

Ramazan Ozcan can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Max Kruse (Wolfsburg). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Goal! Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:0.

Ramazan Ozcan was forced into action to thwart Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.

The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Koen Casteels makes a beautiful save from Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt), who latched on to an accurate lofted pass and produced a timely header. Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Vieirinha.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.
Holger Badstuber swings the cross over. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the left post.
Golden chance! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) missed a big chance! He produces a stunning volley from inside the box, but his effort goes not far wide of the right post.
Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass inside the box and drills a promising first-time blast towards the middle of the goal. His effort is blocked by Oliver Baumann who dives to keep the ball out. What a save!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Kingsley Coman can be given a rest.
GOAL! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Oliver Baumann, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 2:0.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Thomas Muller is replaced by Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich).
Here comes a substitution. Andrej Kramaric is given a rest as he is replaced by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Jiloan Hamad is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) fires a brilliant shot in from 20 metres out, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) will replace Jonathan Schmid.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Douglas Costa will be replaced by Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich).
Jochen Drees is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the middle of the goal, but Timo Horn was alert and made an amazing save! It will be a corner kick for Wolfsburg.

Vieirinha received a clever long ball from Dante (Wolfsburg) which could have put him in a promising position, but the defence was alert and managed to avert the threat. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Wolfsburg.
What a big chance! Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Matthias Lehmann (Koln).
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but his fine header towards the underside of the crossbar is perfectly saved by the goalkeeper. Now FC Koln have a corner.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Filip Mladenovic (1. FC Koln) collects a pass and has an effort from distance to the right side of the goal, but Diego Benaglio answers with a superb save to deny him. FC Koln have been awarded a corner kick.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Diego Benaglio, who pulls off a comfortable save!
The substitution has been made. Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) has replaced Max Kruse.

It's a goal! Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the middle of the target. The assist goes to Vieirinha and the score changes to 1:0.
Goal! Leonardo Bittencourt tees up Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the right side of the goal. 1:1.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
A substitution has been made. Andre Schurrle is replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Here is a change. Filip Mladenovic is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Kevin Vogt (1. FC Koln).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Dusan Svento (Koln) replaces Leonardo Bittencourt.
Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.
Anthony Modeste is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Yuya Osako (Koln).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play. Stuttgart are awarded a corner kick.
CHANCE! Daniel Didavi finds Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the right post!
Kevin Grosskreutz (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow card from Gunter Perl after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Hamburger SV have a free kick.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Rene Adler is alert and denies him. The ball is out of play. Stuttgart win a corner kick.
Kevin Grosskreutz (VfB Stuttgart) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

Well-positioned Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Rene Adler reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch so that Nicolai Muller can be given a rest.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) gets himself onto the end of the corner, but his header is blocked.
Bad communication between Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) and the goalkeeper led to an own goal. Thumbs down. Well, let's see if he can correct his mistake with a strike into the opponent's goal.

Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than low towards the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) replaces Gojko Kacar.

Matthias Ostrzolek sends a superb cross into the box. Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Przemyslaw Tyton beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
That will be all from Timo Werner who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart).
Rene Adler (Hamburger) is given a yellow card. This is an obvious ploy to delay the restart of play from Rene Adler (Hamburger).

Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Przemyslaw Tyton guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The referee signals a corner kick to Hamburger SV.

Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart) unleashes a decent strike from 18 metres out towards the bottom right corner, but Rene Adler is equal to it. Fantastic goalkeeping! Stuttgart force their opponents to concede a corner.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) latches on to a precise cross on the edge of the box and strikes the ball goalwards. However, it whistles wide of the left post so the goalkeeper can relax.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Gunter Perl didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga walks off the pitch and Gideon Jung (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
Jurgen Kramny decides to make a substitution. Daniel Didavi will be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
Alexandru Maxim showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 2:1.
Substitution. Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Filip Kostic.
Superb touch by Cleber (Hamburger) as he receives a precise pass inside the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot to the left side of the goal. Wonderful save!
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Daniel Baier (Augsburg) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Lukas Hradecky to get hold of the ball.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Daniel Baier (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Sascha Stegemann starts the second half.
Markus Weinzierl has made a change at the break. Markus Feulner (Augsburg) has come on in place of Daniel Baier.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the left side of the goal. Marwin Hitz shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net. Good work from Eintracht Frankfurt as they win a corner.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) was probably a bit loose with his words to Sascha Stegemann, who decides to show him a yellow.
Great touch by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
The manager makes a subsitution with Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) coming on for Philipp Max.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jan Moravek as he is replaced by Piotr Trochowski (Augsburg).
Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) fails to score from the rebound as the goalkeeper stops his effort from hitting the net.
We are about to witness a substitution. Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) is replacing Marco Fabian.
Armin Veh has decided to make a change. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Stefan Aigner.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A cross from the corner kick arrives close to the penalty spot. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the right post!
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) for his blatant foul. A free kick to Bayer Leverkusen.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Ron-Robert Zieler to dive and make a save. Bayer Leverkusen get a corner.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps highest to meet the ball from the corner kick and finishes behind the helpless keeper with a fine header into the bottom right corner. The defence stare motionlessly at each other. What a peach of a goal that is. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) has every right to celebrate!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler made an astonishing save! The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
OFF THE BAR! Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. The referee makes the call - penalty to Bayer Leverkusen!
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Welz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) was quite harsh and Tobias Welz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That will be all from Manuel Schmiedebach who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Uffe Bech (Hannover).
We are about to witness a substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Hakan Calhanoglu.

Great solo effort by Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to make a change. Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) replaces Edgar Prib.
The substitution is prepared. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Karim Bellarabi.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Roberto Hilbert as he is replaced by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen).

It's in the back of the net! Kevin Kampl slips the ball through to Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 3:0.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Johannes Geis (Schalke) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.
Goal! Max Meyer (Schalke) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Klaas-Jan Huntelaar, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.

Superb finishing from Leroy Sane (Schalke). Max Meyer plays a fantastic through ball and finds Leroy Sane (Schalke), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:1.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) argues with the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Max Meyer (Schalke) violates the laws of the game and is shown a yellow card by the referee, but it could have been a straight red as well.
Jan Rosenthal goes off the pitch and Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) comes on.
Dirk Schuster decides to make a substitution. Konstantin Rausch will be replaced by Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt).
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Daniel Siebert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Dirk Schuster has decided to substitute Jerome Gondorf and he is replaced by Marco Sailer (Darmstadt).
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Slobodan Rajkovic (Darmstadt) for a heavy challenge.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Substitution. Max Meyer makes his way off the pitch and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.
Leroy Sane will be replaced by Alessandro Schopf (Schalke).
Here is a change. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Marvin Friedrich (Schalke).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) hammers the ball goalwards from about 25 metres. The shot is directed to the bottom left corner but is thwarted by a save from Roman Burki.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) for a heavy challenge. Dortmund are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
The foul by Julian Weigl (Dortmund) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Guido Winkmann.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) picks up a cross inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the right side of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Ramazan Ozcan, who pulls off a stunning save!
Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) can bury his head in the sand! He misses the rebound from inside the penalty box as he plants a header high over the bar! A typical school boys error!

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) latched on to a cross inside the six-yard box and headed at goal. If it wasn't for one of the defenders making a save on the goal line, he would have been celebrating a goal now.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
It is time for a substitution. Moritz Leitner (Dortmund) is on for Julian Weigl.
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Shinji Kagawa is replaced by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Sokratis (Dortmund) for a tough tackle. It's a free kick to Ingolstadt in a dangerous position.
Moritz Leitner (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Ramazan Ozcan is alert and denies him.
Substitution. Adrian Ramos is replaced by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund).
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Moritz Hartmann and he is replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
A yellow card for a tackle by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) is booked by the referee.

Lukasz Piszczek shows his great technique and produces a beautiful cross into the box. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the scoresheet by heading the ball precisely inside the right post. It's now 0:0.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
Erik Durm (Dortmund) wastes a good opportunity as his pass into the box is blocked by the defence. Dortmund force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
It will be a substitution. Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) is ready to enter the pitch as Mathew Leckie walks off.

GOAL! Superb work from Gonzalo Castro, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who beats Ramazan Ozcan with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) replacing Dario Lezcano.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Rune Jarstein is alert and denies him. The referee signals a corner kick to Werder Bremen.

What a chance that is! Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) squanders a huge opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes well wide of the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save. Hertha Berlin force their opponents to concede a corner.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) receives a brilliant pass and sends a long-range shot past the helpless goalkeeper. What a cracking goal!

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Felix Wiedwald guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and rose high to reach a fine corner kick. He fails to direct the ball past the goalkeeper as it flies narrowly over the bar.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) displays his brilliant free kick ability. The ball flies towards the goal and ends under the crossbar. What a finish!

Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Rune Jarstein to dive and make a save. Good work from Werder Bremen as they win a corner.
Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen) finds enough space to climb high and plants a header way over the bar. What a poor effort.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Viktor Skripnik makes a switch. Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) is coming on in place of Levin Oztunali at the start of the second period.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
This is a yellow card! Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) starts an individual run, not looking to pass to a teammate, and easily weaves through the defence to get deep inside the box. He shoots low, but misses the goal by a whisker!
Papy Djilobodji (Werder Bremen) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Florian Grillitsch is replaced by Laszlo Kleinheisler (Werder Bremen).

An amazing individual effort from Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the left side of the goal and makes it 1:2. Rune Jarstein was helpless.
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Genki Haraguchi will be replaced by Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin).
Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:3. He was ably assisted there by Johannes van den Bergh.

Poor challenge! Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) is penalised for tripping and Bastian Dankert blows his whistle. PENALTY! One of the players from Werder Bremen is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is going to take the penalty!
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot inside the right post.
Goal! Santiago Garcia gets up really well from the corner and heads the ball into the six-yard box where Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) glances a header into the net. 3:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vedad Ibisevic trots off the pitch and is replaced by Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin).
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender.

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the right side of the goal. Rune Jarstein shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Zlatko Junuzovic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Lukas Frode (Werder Bremen).
Here is a change. Per Skjelbred is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Jairo Samperio passes to Christian Clemens (Mainz), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes inside the right post. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.

Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Loris Karius makes a great save to stop his effort.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed narrowly wide of the right post!
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Loris Karius makes a brilliant save! Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the bottom right corner but is saved by the keeper!
Today's match ends for Ibrahima Traore who will be replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make.
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) replaces Yoshinori Muto.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch so that Jonas Hofmann can be given a rest.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) plants a goal-bound header towards the middle of the target after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Yunus Malli is replaced by Fabian Frei (Mainz).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Benjamin Brand didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
What a big chance! Christian Clemens (Mainz) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Andre Schubert has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Julian Korb.
Here's the change. Jairo Samperio leaves the pitch and Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Johannes Geis sends in a great cross from the corner, finding Joel Matip (Schalke) who outjumps the defence to finish into the top right corner with a header. The score is 1:0.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the crossbar.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box after picking up a pass, but produces a poor effort that sails high over the bar.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Viktor Skripnik is forced to make a change. Philipp Bargfrede is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen).

Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) scores a goal! He makes his way to the edge of the box without any help from his teammates and unleashes a shot that ends in the right side of the goal, bouncing in off the post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) meets a perfect cross from Clemens Fritz deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the top left corner. It's 1:2.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Christian Dingert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Max Meyer walks off the pitch to be replaced by Younes Belhanda (Schalke).
Johannes Geis will be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
The foul by Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.

Junior Caicara (Schalke) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Junior Caicara (Schalke) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
The game has come to an end for Claudio Pizarro. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Lukas Frode (Werder Bremen).

It's a goal! Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) scores with a brilliant shot into the right side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Clemens Fritz. The score is 1:2.
Substitution. Levin Oztunali walks off the pitch and Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) comes on as a substitute.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Ricardo Rodriguez takes the free kick and finds Dante (Wolfsburg) just outside the six-yard box. He keeps his cool and puts the ball into the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Knut Kircher has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Armin Veh makes a half-time substitution. Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Haris Seferovic.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
The substitution is prepared. Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Daniel Caligiuri.
Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Goal! Stefan Aigner plays a pass to the feet of Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 1:1.
Goal! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top right corner. It's 2:1.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) replaces Max Kruse.
Goal! Sebastian Jung provides Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 2:2.
A yellow card for a tackle by Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt). Knut Kircher doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Julian Draxler will be replaced by Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Stefan Aigner leaves the pitch and Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Goal! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:2.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
That was close by Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
Great ball in from Raffael. Andreas Christensen (B. Monchengladbach) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
What a huge chance for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Joo-Ho Park (Dortmund) dribbles into the box, but Yann Sommer is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Golden chance! Marco Reus (Dortmund) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Brilliant finish! Marco Reus (Dortmund) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Ilkay Gundogan, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.
Great touch by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.
Goal! Marco Reus displays great vision and sends a pass to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:2.
Goal! Lars Stindl provides Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Wow, what an escape. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
That's the end of the game for Gonzalo Castro, who is replaced by Matthias Ginter (Dortmund).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Erik Durm (Dortmund) replacing Marco Reus.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Julian Weigl (Dortmund), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It's in the back of the net! Henrikh Mkhitaryan plays it into the box, and Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the left post. 1:3.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
Today's match ends for Mahmoud Dahoud who will be replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
