Andre Schubert has decided to make a change. Martin Hinteregger (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Nico Elvedi.
What a big chance! Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
A neat pass is well received by Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
It is time for a substitution. Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) is on for Julian Korb.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Manuel Grafe has a clear sight and sees a foul from Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart). FC Koln are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) gets booked.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) sends Przemyslaw Tyton the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Timo Horn is alert and denies him.
Goal! Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Filip Kostic takes over corner duties and expertly finds Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 1:1.
Substitution. Pawel Olkowski leaves the pitch and is replaced by Simon Zoller (Koln).
Filip Mladenovic (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Leonardo Bittencourt.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Milos Jojic (Koln) for Kevin Vogt.
Timo Werner will be replaced by Artem Kravets (VfB Stuttgart).

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Timo Horn stops the ball from going into the top of the net. The referee blows his whistle, Stuttgart are awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Lukas Rupp feeds Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 1:3.
Jurgen Kramny has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Lukas Rupp.

Dominique Heintz (Koln) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the left post is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper. FC Koln have been awarded a corner kick.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Filip Kostic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart).
Yuya Osako (Koln) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
What a hit! Hugo Almeida (Hannover) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the top of the net. 1:0.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Adam Szalai (Hannover) attempts to score as he rises near the penalty spot and heads the ball to the bottom left corner of the goal. Christian Mathenia displays brilliant reflexes and pulls off a comfortable save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Gooal! Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Jan Rosenthal. He makes it 1:1.
What a chance for Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.
The referee Deniz Aytekin awards Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) a yellow card.
Salif Sane (Hannover) is punished with the yellow card.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) picked up a rebound and unleashed a fine effort which crashed against the right post.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Deniz Aytekin starts the second half.
Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a great save to deny Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!
Goal 1:2! Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.

Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Ron-Robert Zieler is alert and denies him with a nice save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Darmstadt.
The referee signals a substitution. Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Manuel Schmiedebach.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Dirk Schuster prepares a substitution. Konstantin Rausch is replaced by Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt).
Christian Schulz (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt) for a tough tackle.
Golden chance! Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sandro Wagner trots off the pitch and is replaced by Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt).
Here is a change. Christian Schulz is going off and Thomas Schaaf gives the last tactical orders to Artur Sobiech (Hannover).
Here's the change. Jan Rosenthal leaves the pitch and Junior Diaz (Darmstadt) comes on as a substitute.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Rune Jarstein pulls off a fine save! Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header low towards the middle, but the effort is kept out.
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) rises above the defenders and places a towering header low towards the middle of the goal, but Rune Jarstein is prepared and thwarts him.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Marwin Hitz makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
The foul by Philipp Max (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.
John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card.
The yellow card is received by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the left post.
Dong-Won Ji sends a good ball to the edge of the box and Daniel Baier (Augsburg) gets in a shot which goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Substitution. Fabian Lustenberger walks off the pitch and Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
Here is a change. Dong-Won Ji is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Jan Moravek (Augsburg).
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) on for Vladimir Darida.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Markus Feulner (Augsburg) replacing Alexander Esswein.
Substitution. Tim Matavz (Augsburg) has come on for Raul Bobadilla.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Marco Fritz shows the yellow card to Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the top left corner, but Oliver Baumann is prepared and leaps to thwart him. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Bayer Leverkusen.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the right post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Bernd Leno, so the score changes to 1:0.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
What a big chance! Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his low effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Oliver Baumann.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
What a chance that is! Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the left post!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Karim Bellarabi departs the field of play to be replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Roger Schmidt prepares a substitution. Tin Jedvaj is replaced by Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen).
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) for a tough tackle.
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to a rebound in the six-yard box and his effort crashes in off the left post!
An unlucky rebound falls to Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) and he scores with a bullet header.
A substitution has been made. Kevin Volland goes off and Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Huub Stevens decides to make a substitution. Jiloan Hamad will be replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Eduardo Vargas will be replaced by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).
Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Marco Fritz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Roger Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with  replacing Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) connects with a cross from the resulting set piece and produces a nice effort from inside the box towards the underside of the crossbar. The goalkeeper shows great reaction to deflect the ball onto the bar. What a save!
Danny Latza (Mainz) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Ingolstadt!
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.

Christian Clemens (Mainz) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Ramazan Ozcan, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.
Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make. Mainz are awarded the free kick.
Elias Kachunga comes off the pitch to be replaced by Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt).
Ralph Hasenhuttl decides to make a substitution. Alfredo Morales will be replaced by Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt).
The game has come to an end for Jairo Samperio. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Yoshinori Muto (Mainz).
It's a yellow card for Danny Latza (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Suat Serdar (Mainz) replaces Christian Clemens.
Here comes a substitution. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Yunus Malli.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Jhon Cordoba (Mainz).
Substitution. Moritz Hartmann makes his way off the pitch and Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) comes on as his replacement.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.
Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Felix Zwayer blows the whistle, Rene Adler (Hamburger) is penalised for a foul. PENALTY to Bayern Munich! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Rene Adler (Hamburger) receives a yellow card.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) slams home the penalty with a precise shot which goes inside the right post.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.

Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the bottom right corner, but it wasn't dangerous and Rene Adler made a comfortable save. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
It's an own goal! A pitiful moment for Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but instead sends the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 0:1.
Jerome Boateng is being substituted because of an injury. Pep Guardiola sends Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) on the pitch.
Goal! Thomas Muller takes aim and his effort deflects off Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) to beat the goalkeeper. 1:2.
OFF THE BAR! David Alaba (Bayern Munich) produces a thunderbolt of a strike from distance, but his effort rattles the crossbar!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Thomas Muller.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) replaces Ivo Ilicevic.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga will be replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).

A neat pass is well received by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot. Corner kick. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) will replace Douglas Costa.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to substitute Gojko Kacar and he is replaced by Gideon Jung (Hamburger).
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) shoots at goal from the free kick from some 25 metres out. His attempt was quite precise and another few inches and it would have ended up inside the right post.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What a chance for Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.
Goal! Sandro Wagner gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Marcel Heller (Darmstadt), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 0:1.

Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) must think that he is playing a different sport because his behaviour has nothing to do with football and the referee has no choice but to show him a straight red card!
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Goal! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the left post. It's 1:1.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card from Benjamin Brand after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Luca Caldirola (Darmstadt) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the right post.
Here is a change. Peter Niemeyer is going off and Dirk Schuster gives the last tactical orders to Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt).
A yellow card for a tackle by Fabian Holland (Darmstadt). Benjamin Brand doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

A perfect lofted pass from Marcel Heller finds Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the roof of the net. His effort was both strong and precise, and Yann Sommer had no chance of stopping that. 1:1.
A substitution has been made. Thorgan Hazard goes off and Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) will replace Tobias Kempe.
Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) meets a cross from Fabian Holland, but he cannot keep his header on target. It goes well wide of the left post.
Goal! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the middle of the goal. 2:1.
Substitution. Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt) has come on for Jan Rosenthal.
Andre Schubert has decided to make a change. Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Lars Stindl.
That will be all from Raffael who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Benjamin Brand is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
A big opportunity missed by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin). He got on the ball inside the box and thumped a splendid first-time shot on goal, but it went narrowly wide of the left post.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) perfectly wriggles his way through two or three opponents, and he produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes inside the left post. Wonderful goal!
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Martin Schmidt has made a change at the break. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) has come on in place of Christian Clemens.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Danny Latza makes his way off the pitch and Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) comes on as his replacement.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Yoshinori Muto will be replaced by Jhon Cordoba (Mainz).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Fabian Lustenberger will be replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The substitution is prepared. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Vladimir Darida.
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Salomon Kalou is replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).

This was a piece of cake for Loris Karius. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the crossbar. Aim better, sir.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) dribbles into the box, but Loris Karius is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
Peter Sippel is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes into the bottom left corner. It's 0:1.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) scores an absolute screamer from outside the penalty area, with the ball flying into the top left corner!
Goal! Timo Werner puts the ball on a plate for Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 2:1.
Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom left corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Diego Benaglio.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Dieter Hecking probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Julian Draxler. He is replaced by Bas Dost (Wolfsburg).

Stunning strike! Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a precise through ball from Florian Klein before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the top left corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 3:1.
What an opportunity! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) disappointed the fans as he smashed a first-time shot from inside the box against the right post!
Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Brych ignores the protests.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Josuha Guilavogui as he is replaced by Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg).
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) for Daniel Didavi.
The main referee, Felix Brych, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance!
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Andre Schurrle and he is replaced by Francisco Rodriguez (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Florian Klein will be replaced by Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Filip Kostic cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The first half has started.
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The referee points to the corner flag and Werder Bremen will take a corner.
Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Wolfgang Stark ignores the protests.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Wolfgang Stark didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the left post. Lukas Hradecky has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the left post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Lukas Hradecky, so the score changes to 0:1.

Aleksandar Ignjovski shows his great technique and produces a beautiful cross into the box. Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the scoresheet by heading the ball precisely inside the right post. It's now 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vaclav Kadlec trots off the pitch and is replaced by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 2:1. He was ably assisted there by Haris Seferovic.

Great touch by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounces on the rebound on the edge of the box but his wild shot goes high over the crossbar.
That's the end of the game for Philipp Bargfrede, who is replaced by Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen).
The game has come to an end for Florian Grillitsch. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen).

Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Lukas Hradecky guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The referee blows his whistle, Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.
Haris Seferovic picks out Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt), who drives a shot just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Wolfgang Stark after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Although Michael Zetterer (Werder Bremen) is just on the bench, Wolfgang Stark has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
Today's referee Wolfgang Stark rightly decides to book Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
A substitution has been made. Clemens Fritz is replaced by Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen).
Here is a change. Mijat Gacinovic is going off and Armin Veh gives the last tactical orders to Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan takes over corner duties and expertly finds Sokratis (Dortmund), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the right side of the goal. The score is now 0:0.

Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt into the bottom right corner fails to beat Roman Burki, who makes a sensational save. Good work from FC Koln as they win a corner.
That was close by Julian Weigl (Dortmund)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Mats Hummels is replaced by Sven Bender (Dortmund).
Here is a change after the half-time break. Joo-Ho Park is replaced by Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund).
Dusan Svento (Koln) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) for a tough tackle.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Dusan Svento and he is replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln).
Pawel Olkowski goes off the pitch and Anthony Modeste (Koln) comes on.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) on for Jonas Hofmann.

Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom right corner, but Roman Burki made a crucial save! Corner kick. FC Koln will have an opportunity.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Simon Zoller (Koln) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the right side of the net.
Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) gets a yellow card. The referee Knut Kircher made the right call.
Gooal! Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Frederik Sorensen. He makes it 2:1.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Substitution. Simon Zoller makes way for Mergim Mavraj (Koln).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

That was a nice football moment. Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Rene Adler guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! The referee points to the corner flag and Augsburg will take a corner.
CHANCE! Matthias Ostrzolek finds Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the right post!
Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the bar.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the left post!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Bastian Dankert blows his whistle to start the second half.
The main referee, Bastian Dankert, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) is given a yellow card for dissent.
The foul by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.

Rene Adler pulls off a great save to deny Markus Feulner (Augsburg) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jan Moravek (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Francisco Caiuby can be given a rest.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hamburger).
Here's the change. Aaron Hunt leaves the pitch and Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
Golden chance! Markus Feulner (Augsburg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Rene Adler guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Jan Moravek (Augsburg) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ivica Olic (Hamburger) will replace Gideon Jung.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christoph Janker (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch for Alexander Esswein.
That was close by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Substitution. Raul Bobadilla walks off the pitch and Tim Matavz (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Ron-Robert Zieler, who pulls off a stunning save! Bayern Munich force a corner. They send men into the box.

What a chance! Leon Andreasen (Hannover) jumps and powers a precise header towards the roof of the net. The goalkeeper makes a spectacular reflex save and the ball deflects off his gloves onto the crossbar.
Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) is first to a rebound inside the 6-yard box, but he misdirects his shot well wide of the left post.

OFF THE POST! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) fired on target from the rebound. His effort from inside the box was directed low to the middle of the goal.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and sends a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Ron-Robert Zieler.
Christian Schulz (Hannover) handles the ball inside the box. The referee gives a penalty to Bayern Munich!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) slots home the penalty after firing the ball in the opposite direction to which the goalkeeper dives!
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Manuel Grafe starts the second half.

What a sweet touch by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) as he collects a pass. From near the edge of the box he produces a shot which goes towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a decent save to thwart him!
Substitution. Mevlut Erdinc will be replaced by Charlison Benschop (Hannover).
The substitution is prepared. Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Leon Andreasen.
The referee signals a substitution. Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Holger Badstuber.
Kenan Karaman goes off the pitch and Felix Klaus (Hannover) comes on.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Arturo Vidal limps off the pitch to be replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) finds himself unmarked on the edge of the box, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
What was Christoph Kramer (Bayer Leverkusen) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Stefan Lex and he is replaced by Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Hakan Calhanoglu will be replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Almog Cohen is replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
Karim Bellarabi feeds the ball through to Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:0!
Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card.
Danny da Costa (Ingolstadt) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Chicharito walks off the pitch to be replaced by Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Karim Bellarabi did his best and is replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) picked up a yellow card from referee.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
A big opportunity missed by Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim). He got on the ball inside the box and thumped a splendid first-time shot on goal, but it went narrowly wide of the right post.
CLOSE! Leon Goretzka (Schalke) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the left post!
Goal! Johannes Geis puts a cross into the box and finds Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.

Franco Di Santo (Schalke) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Joel Matip sprays a pass out to Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes well wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.

Pavel Kaderabek plays a lovely pass into Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
A yellow card for a tackle by Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim). Sascha Stegemann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The foul by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.
Huub Stevens has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) replacing Nadiem Amiri.
The substitution has been made. Leroy Sane (Schalke) has replaced Max Meyer.
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.

Fabian Schar sprays a wonderful pass out to Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Ralf Fahrmann problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar trots off the pitch and is replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke).
Substitution. Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) in, Tarik Elyounoussi out.
Here is a change. Jonathan Schmid is going off and Huub Stevens gives the last tactical orders to Joelinton (Hoffenheim).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Franco Di Santo will be replaced by Roman Neustadter (Schalke).
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests.
That's all for today as the game is over.
s match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the right side of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance. Corner kick. Dortmund will have an opportunity.

Lukas Hradecky makes a brilliant save! Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the right side of the goal but is saved by the keeper! Dortmund force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Goal - 0:1! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the left post. Haris Seferovic provided an assist for the goal.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
It's in the back of the net! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang sprays a pass out to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:1.
Today's referee Christian Dingert rightly decides to book Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle. Dortmund have a free kick.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out for offside!

Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Lukas Hradecky is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Dortmund.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Marco Reus.
Referee Christian Dingert sees the trip by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. A penalty is given to Dortmund!
RED CARD! Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Christian Dingert. He can have an early bath.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) misses the penalty. His shot goes just wide of the right post.

Ambitious effort from Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Armin Veh has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on the pitch for Stefan Aigner.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa puts the ball across the area and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 2:1.
Goal! Mats Hummels (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 3:1.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance!
Here comes a substitution. Sokratis (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Mats Hummels.
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and David Abraham walks off the pitch to be replaced by Nico Rinderknecht (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Lukasz Piszczek plays a terrific cross over to Adrian Ramos (Dortmund), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Today's referee Florian Meyer rightly decides to book Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) for his harsh tackle. A free kick is awarded to Schalke.
A yellow card for a tackle by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg). Florian Meyer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! Dominik Kohr takes aim and his effort deflects off Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) to beat the goalkeeper. 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Philipp Max (Augsburg) takes the free kick and curls the ball just over the crossbar. That was close!
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) skips past the defenders and unloads a rocket of a shot from 20 metres. Unfortunately for him, his fabulous effort ricochets away off the crossbar.

GOAL! Superb work from Maxim Choupo-Moting, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Sead Kolasinac (Schalke), who beats Marwin Hitz with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar leaves the pitch and Franco Di Santo (Schalke) comes on.
We are about to witness a substitution. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) is replacing Alexander Esswein.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) replaces Max Meyer.
A substitution has been made. Daniel Baier goes off and Christoph Janker (Augsburg) comes on.

An absolutely sensational volley by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg). He took a shot from inside the penalty area and the ball went straight into the top left corner. All credit to Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg), excellent finish.
The game has come to an end for Raul Bobadilla. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Tim Matavz (Augsburg).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Roberto Hilbert showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header down into the middle of the net. It's 1:0.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) produces a decent strike goalwards from the resulting set piece. His effort rattles the left post and the ball stays out of the net. The goalkeeper was quite lucky!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Ibrahima Traore is replaced by Raffael (B. Monchengladbach).
Half-time substitution. Andre Schubert decided to make a change. Tony Jantschke is replaced by Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach).
Half-time substitution. Roberto Hilbert will not participate anymore and Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) strikes the ball from the free kick and his effort rattles the left post!
Goal! Stefan Kiessling plays a pass to the feet of Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), and he shoots into the bottom left corner from inside the box. It's 2:0.
A well-taken corner kick finds Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) who heads home. His precise effort nestles in the roof of the net.

Stefan Kiessling passes to Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes inside the right post. Fabulous goal! The score is 4:0.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi passes the ball to the feet of Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 5:0.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Chicharito.
We are about to witness a substitution. Marvin Schulz (B. Monchengladbach) is replacing Mahmoud Dahoud.
Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Substitution. Marlon Frey (Bayer Leverkusen) in, Kevin Kampl out.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender. The linesman points to the corner flag, Ingolstadt are going to take it.

Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Manuel Neuer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Ramazan Ozcan is alert and denies him.
Substitution. Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) in, Arturo Vidal out.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Almog Cohen and he is replaced by Stefan Wannenwetsch (Ingolstadt).
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich). Michael Weiner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Ingolstadt have a free kick.
Michael Weiner shows a yellow card to Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

What a sweet touch by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Manuel Neuer to hold. The ball goes out of play. Ingolstadt are awarded a corner kick.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Ramazan Ozcan is alert and denies him.

Goal! Jerome Boateng displays great vision and sends a pass to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:0.
Here is a change. Stefan Lex is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt).
That's the end of the game for Jerome Boateng, who is replaced by Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich).
Fantastic team goal! Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) was set free in the area by Thomas Muller and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 2:0.
Lukas Hinterseer comes off the pitch to be replaced by Maurice Multhaup (Ingolstadt).
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Thomas Muller is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) sees a yellow card from Michael Weiner after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. A free kick has been awarded to Ingolstadt.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Goal! Mitchell Weiser displays great vision and sends a pass to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) takes a brilliant free kick and curls the ball inside the right post to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) receives a yellow card.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Rune Jarstein dived superbly to block a header by Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the roof of the net, but Rune Jarstein pulled off a remarkable save! The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Darmstadt.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Gunter Perl blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Dirk Schuster makes a switch. Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) is coming on in place of Tobias Kempe at the start of the second period.
GOAL - 0:3! The corner comes over and John Brooks flicks on with his head to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.
The booking goes to Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt).
It will be a substitution. Marco Sailer (Darmstadt) is ready to enter the pitch as Jan Rosenthal walks off.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) is coming onto the pitch as Jerome Gondorf cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Mitchell Weiser is replaced by Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin).
Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) is booked.
Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:4. He was ably assisted there by Vedad Ibisevic.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.
The game has come to an end for Per Skjelbred. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.

It's in the back of the net! Kevin Volland sends a superb cross into the box. Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the left post, leaving Ron-Robert Zieler beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
A goal, which was scored by Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim), was disallowed due to offside.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Ceyhun Gulselam makes his way off the pitch and Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) comes on as his replacement.
That will be all from Kevin Volland who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim).
Michael Frontzeck has decided to substitute Edgar Prib and he is replaced by Charlison Benschop (Hannover).
Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Mike-Steven Bahre (Hannover) on for Allan Saint-Maximin.
This is a yellow card! Leon Andreasen (Hannover) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) replaces Nadiem Amiri.
Pirmin Schwegler doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
That's it for today, Jochen Drees has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Clemens Fritz showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:0.
Dominique Heintz (Koln) is penalised for holding. Guido Winkmann signals a set piece. A penalty is given to Werder Bremen!
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.

Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot into the bottom right corner. Timo Horn anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.
Kevin Vogt (Koln) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Peter Stoger probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Anthony Modeste. He is replaced by Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln).
Peter Stoger makes a half-time substitution. Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln) comes on in place of Kevin Vogt.
Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Here comes a substitution. Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Florian Grillitsch.
We are about to witness a substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is replacing Anthony Ujah.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) is yellow-carded.
Booking. Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) receives a caution from the referee.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Yuya Osako (Koln) shows good awareness inside the box, but his attempt is stopped by the goalkeeper.
Goal! Dusan Svento (1. FC Koln) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Fin Bartels walks off.
It is time for a substitution. Frederik Sorensen (Koln) is on for Dusan Svento.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) tries his luck with a long-range effort after receiving a precise pass. It goes to the left side of the goal, but Diego Benaglio has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save. Hamburger SV get a corner.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.
The goalkeeper pulls off a great save to deny Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger), whose good effort would probably have ended inside the right post.
Goal! Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the left post. It's 0:1.

Pierre-Michel Lasogga nearly gets in a one-on-one with the goalkeeper after a defence-splitting pass from Nicolai Muller (Hamburger), but one of the defenders makes a clearance to snuff out the chance.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Rene Adler is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender. The referee signals a corner kick to Wolfsburg.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Dieter Hecking probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Christian Trasch. He is replaced by Bas Dost (Wolfsburg).
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar.
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Here comes a substitution. Andre Schurrle is given a rest as he is replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).

Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 25 metres out. Rene Adler stops the effort which is headed to the roof of the net. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Wolfsburg.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the left post is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) is shown the yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. It could have been worse!
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Rene Adler to dive and make a save.
Goal! Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:1. He was ably assisted there by Vieirinha.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) replaces Ivo Ilicevic.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger).
It is time for a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) is on for Pierre-Michel Lasogga.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Julian Draxler can be given a rest.
Bruno Labbadia decides to make a substitution. Nicolai Muller will be replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A neat pass is well received by Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
A goal, which was scored by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart), was disallowed due to offside.
The game is interrupted. Niko Bungert (Mainz) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the right post. A few inches to the left and it could have been a sweet goal!
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Felix Zwayer blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Jurgen Kramny decided to make a change. Serey Die is replaced by Robbie Kruse (VfB Stuttgart).

Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Przemyslaw Tyton to get hold of the ball.

Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the left side of the goal, but Przemyslaw Tyton keeps it out with an amazing save. Good work from Mainz as they win a corner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Filip Kostic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart).
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Yoshinori Muto and he is replaced by Jhon Cordoba (Mainz).
Here comes a substitution. Jairo Samperio is given a rest as he is replaced by Christian Clemens (Mainz).
A yellow card is awarded to Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart).
Jurgen Kramny decides to make a substitution. Alexandru Maxim will be replaced by Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds the head of Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt), who rises and produces an amazing header inside the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming onto the pitch as David Abraham cannot continue after picking up an injury.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Mijat Gacinovic is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A yellow card for a tackle by Fabian Holland (Darmstadt). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the right side of the goal. His effort is blocked by Christian Mathenia with a brilliant diving save! The ball goes behind for a corner. Eintracht Frankfurt will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) attempts to discuss the decision with Felix Brych, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Junior Diaz (Darmstadt) for Fabian Holland.
Substitution. Marco Sailer (Darmstadt) in, Jan Rosenthal out.
Substitution. Slobodan Medojevic walks off the pitch and Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.

Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort. The ball goes out of play and Darmstadt have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee shows the yellow card to Christian Mathenia (Darmstadt).
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card.
Substitution. Tobias Kempe makes way for Slobodan Rajkovic (Darmstadt).

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the middle of the target, but Christian Mathenia pulled off a nice save to stop the attempt.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a sweet cross into the box and misses with a header way wide of the left post.
The foul by Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Florian Meyer.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.
It's a goal! Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) scores with a brilliant shot into the roof of the net after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Filip Kostic. The score is now 1:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Florian Meyer has ended it.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Zlatko Junuzovic is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen).
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) replaces Fin Bartels.
Goal! Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:1.
The substitution is prepared. Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Daniel Didavi.
Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) hits the crossbar with a rebound from near the penalty spot.

What an opportunity! Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the middle of the goal, but Felix Wiedwald reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Levin Oztunali departs the field of play to be replaced by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
Here is a change. Filip Kostic is going off and Jurgen Kramny gives the last tactical orders to Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) stands over the resulting free kick from around 23 metres out, but his terrific effort smashes against the crossbar!
Sven Bender (Dortmund) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) wastes a good opportunity as his pass into the box is blocked by the defence.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Marco Reus (Dortmund), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 0:1.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) meets a cross and produces a header towards the left side of the goal, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
The foul by Marco Reus (Dortmund) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Dieter Hecking makes a switch. Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) is coming on in place of Josuha Guilavogui at the start of the second period.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Tobias Stieler after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
A substitution has been made. Ilkay Gundogan goes off and Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) comes on.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Daniel Caligiuri and he is replaced by Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg).
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) beats a few defenders in the penalty area and drives a low shot towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper reacts superbly to make a wonderful save.

Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Roman Burki, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the bottom right corner, but Roman Burki pulled off a nice save to stop the attempt. Wolfsburg force their opponents to concede a corner.

Roman Burki gets a well deserved ovation! He pulls off a remarkable save to block a long-range effort from Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) towards the right side of the target. Nice goalkeeping skills! Wolfsburg earn a corner.
Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) plants a goal-bound header towards the right post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders reacts superbly and makes a timely interception.
A yellow card for a tackle by Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a change. Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) replaces Gonzalo Castro.
Substitution. Joo-Ho Park (Dortmund) in, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang out.
Referee Tobias Stieler sees the trip by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. That's a penalty to Wolfsburg! They have a good chance to score now.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) is going to take the penalty!
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot inside the right post.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Great chance! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Yann Sommer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Yann Sommer is alert and denies him.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) misses a big chance! He got to the rebound inside the penalty box but placed the ball only against the right post!
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Felix Zwayer blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal - 0:0! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass inside the box from Raffael and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.

What a huge opportunity! Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike low towards the middle of the target. The amazing Manuel Neuer deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the post. The ball is out of play. B. Monchengladbach win a corner kick.
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Nico Elvedi and Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 2:0.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Xabi Alonso is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).

It's in the back of the net! Julian Korb slips the ball through to Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:0.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) for a tough tackle.
The game has come to an end for Robert Lewandowski. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
Goal! Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Arturo Vidal, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 3:1.
Substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud walks off the pitch and Marvin Schulz (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Rafinha (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
Here is a change. Raffael is going off and Andre Schubert gives the last tactical orders to Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Here's the change. Lars Stindl leaves the pitch and Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) hits a dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner from the promising free kick. His shot is stopped by a well prepared Marwin Hitz.

Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner. Augsburg will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Timo Horn leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Timo Horn pulls off a fantastic save! Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header low towards the right post, but the effort is kept out.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Peter Stoger probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Simon Zoller. He is replaced by Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln).
Timo Horn (1. FC Koln) pulls off a great save to deny , who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Having seen unsporting behavior, Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to one of the players sitting on the bench. And Markus Feulner (Augsburg) is the recipient.
Augsburg concede a free kick following a bad challenge. A penalty is given to FC Koln!
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Daniel Baier (Augsburg).
Anthony Modeste (Koln) is going to take the penalty!

Anthony Modeste (Koln) misses the penalty! He fired the ball towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulled off a tremendous diving save to deny him. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. FC Koln will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) takes the free kick from a promising position. He has already proven that he can handle such situations and once again, he sends the ball goalwards and it bounces in off the left post.
That will be all from Kevin Vogt who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Milos Jojic (Koln).
The substitution has been made. Yuya Osako (Koln) has replaced Anthony Modeste.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Jonas Hector (Koln) for his blatant foul.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Daniel Baier can be given a rest.
The referee shows the yellow card to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Dominic Maroh (Koln) receives a yellow card!
Today's match ends for Raul Bobadilla who will be replaced by Tim Matavz (Augsburg).
Tim Matavz (Augsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Alexander Esswein will be replaced by Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
Philipp Hosiner (Koln) won himself just enough space to meet the corner and shoots. His shot heads towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper gets the ball under control with an easy save.
Yuya Osako (Koln) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a chance that is! Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Goal! Jairo Samperio (Mainz) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
Good team movement sets up Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
What a chance that is! Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
