Jaroslav Drobny pulls off a great save to deny Pierre Bengtsson (Mainz) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Now Mainz have a corner.
Today's referee Benjamin Brand rightly decides to book Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) for his harsh tackle.
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Yunus Malli passes the ball into the penalty area. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) collects it and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!
Ivica Olic (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sven Schipplock.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Gideon Jung is replaced by Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger).
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
Here is a change. Ivo Ilicevic is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Aaron Hunt (Hamburger).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Pablo De Blasis will be replaced by Christian Clemens (Mainz).
Goal! Jairo Samperio provides Christian Clemens (Mainz) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 0:3.
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) replaces Yoshinori Muto.
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is yellow-carded.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Maximilian Beister (Mainz) comes onto the pitch so that Jairo Samperio can be given a rest.

Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) wastes an opportunity! He unleashed a strong shot from distance after the rebound fell at his feet. It went in the direction of the left post, but the goalkeeper pulled off a nice save to deny him. Hamburger SV have a corner.

The ball hits the back of the net! Lewis Holtby showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Johan Djourou (Hamburger) gets onto the scoresheets by sweetly heading it inside the left post  1:3.
Benjamin Brand is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) finds his way to a cross and strikes towards the goal, but one of the defending players deflects the ball away. Hertha Berlin will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise pass inside the box from Vedad Ibisevic and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the right side of the net. 1:0.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Hertha Berlin get a corner.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) misses a rebound from the penalty spot. The ball flies just a few inches over the bar.
Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) takes out his opponent with an awful tackle and is shown a red card by the referee!
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change due to the red card. Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Julian Brandt.
Goal! Admir Mehmedi produces a great pass that finds Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the right side of the goal. 1:0.
Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) finds his way to the ball inside the box from the free kick, but his header only hits the crossbar.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Robert Hartmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
CHANCE! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Karim Bellarabi.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) weaves his way through opponents and strikes the ball from the edge of the area, but it's blocked by a defender. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Hertha Berlin.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Robert Hartmann starts the second half.

John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Marvin Plattenhardt. His header was precise and ended up inside the right post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 2:1.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) is given a yellow card.
Wow, what an escape. Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Neat link-up play between Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) and Salomon Kalou, but Bernd Leno reads the game well and the move breaks down.
Substitution. Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) on for Admir Mehmedi.
Here is a change. Giulio Donati is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen).
It will be a substitution. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Salomon Kalou walks off.
Good defending. Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) tries to find Chicharito inside the box, but the pass is cut out.

Bernd Leno can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from John Brooks (Hertha Berlin). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) is given a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) comes on in place of Vladimir Darida.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Genki Haraguchi cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed narrowly wide of the left post!
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Ramazan Ozcan doesn't have to worry about this one. Tarik Elyounoussi plays a pass into the feet of Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes well wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Ingolstadt.

OFF THE POST! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
A substitution has been made. Tarik Elyounoussi goes off and Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Ralph Hasenhuttl is forced to make a change. Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Romain Bregerie.
Roger (Ingolstadt) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the right post.
The substitution is prepared. Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Eugen Polanski.
Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Manuel Grafe and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) will replace Kevin Volland.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) for his blatant foul.
Ralph Hasenhuttl decides to make a substitution. Alfredo Morales will be replaced by Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt).
Ralph Hasenhuttl is forced to make a change. Lukas Hinterseer is unable to continue due to injury, Tomas Pekhart (Ingolstadt) comes on.

Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Ramazan Ozcan is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 1:1.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Sascha Riether (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Wolfgang Stark after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Hannover have a free kick.
Artur Sobiech has picked up an injury and is replaced by Charlison Benschop (Hannover).
CHANCE! Leroy Sane finds Max Meyer (Schalke) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the left post!
What a chance that is! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Marcelo (Hannover) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle for a foul. It's a penalty to Schalke! Let's see who's going to take it.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Marcelo (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
Johannes Geis (Schalke) is going to take the penalty!
Johannes Geis (Schalke) coolly converts the penalty. His precise shot goes inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Manuel Schmiedebach.
Goal! Max Meyer puts a cross into the box and finds Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 2:0.
Substitution. Leon Andreasen makes his way off the pitch and Edgar Prib (Hannover) comes on as his replacement.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Franco Di Santo (Schalke) replacing Klaas-Jan Huntelaar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) comes onto the pitch for Max Meyer.

OFF THE POST! Kenan Karaman (Hannover) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the right post.
Franco Di Santo (Schalke) is quickest to the rebound inside the penalty area, and he plants a header directly into the middle of the net.
Johannes Geis will be replaced by Sead Kolasinac (Schalke).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

What a save from Marwin Hitz! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the left post, but the goalkeeper has pulled off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
What was Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Wolfsburg.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.

What a chance! Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) squanders a promising opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes just wide of the right post! The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.
The game has come to an end for Bas Dost. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Dante (Wolfsburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Here's the change.  leaves the pitch and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for Marwin Hitz to dive and make a save. Now Wolfsburg have a corner.

That was close by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
RED CARD! Dante (Wolfsburg) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Christian Dingert. He can have an early bath.
The referee signals a substitution. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Dominik Kohr.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Timm Klose (Wolfsburg) replacing Max Kruse.
It's time for a substitution. Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Vieirinha.
Substitution. Piotr Trochowski (Augsburg) replaces Alexander Esswein.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
This is a yellow card! Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the crossbar. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card. Bayer Leverkusen have a free kick.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Roger Schmidt gives a chance to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) and Hakan Calhanoglu is off.
Goal - 0:1! Leon Goretzka laid the ball off to Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke), who unleashed a strong shot from close range into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
It is time for a substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is on for Admir Mehmedi.
Problems for Roger Schmidt as Sebastian Boenisch is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces him.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) replaces Leon Goretzka.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Roman Neustadter (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Half-chance! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) plays a pass into the box, but Ralf Fahrmann reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Sascha Riether (Schalke) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him, it's into his own goal!
The game has come to an end for Max Meyer. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) is quickest to the rebound inside the penalty area, and he plants a header directly into the top of the net.
GOAL! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Przemyslaw Tyton, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 2:0.

Roman Burki was forced into action to thwart Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. Stuttgart have a corner.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) shoots from inside the box after his amazing individual effort. He beats the goalkeeper, but hits one of the defending players and it bounces away.
It's in the back of the net! Filip Kostic sprays a pass out to Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Sokratis (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Shinji Kagawa will be replaced by Julian Weigl (Dortmund).
What a sweet touch by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Przemyslaw Tyton to hold.
Own goal! Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 2:1.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his low effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Przemyslaw Tyton.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Here's the change. Alexandru Maxim leaves the pitch and Robbie Kruse (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Mats Hummels (Dortmund) replaces Marco Reus.
Jurgen Kramny has decided to substitute Timo Werner and he is replaced by Borys Tashchy (VfB Stuttgart).

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) receives a lofted pass from the flank and shoots from close range, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Marvin Wanitzek (VfB Stuttgart) for Lukas Rupp.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) replacing Ilkay Gundogan.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match will be delayed.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Pablo De Blasis plays a pass to the feet of Yoshinori Muto (Mainz), and he shoots into the back of the net from inside the box. It's 1:0.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with an accurate shot from the free kick, which is placed dangerously close to the penalty area. However, Loris Karius pulls off a great save to stop his attempt towards the top left corner. The ball is out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt win a corner kick.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a second yellow card from the referee and already knows what will come next. It's a red and the match is over for Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Yunus Malli (Mainz) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:0.
The match has reached half-time.
Bastian Dankert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.

Yunus Malli (Mainz) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top left corner is blocked by Lukas Hradecky, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Mainz have a goal ruled out for offside!
Goal! Stefan Aigner plays a pass to the feet of Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), and he shoots inside the left post from inside the box. It's 2:1.
Danny Latza (Mainz) picks up a yellow card.
Alexander Hack (Mainz) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
The referee signals a substitution. Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Yoshinori Muto.
Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) is given a yellow card.
Armin Veh has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Makoto Hasebe.
Substitution. Christian Clemens (Mainz) has come on for Pablo De Blasis.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The substitution is prepared. Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Yunus Malli.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jochen Drees ignores the protests.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the right post. His effort, however, is blocked by Rune Jarstein, who pulls off a stunning save!
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
GOAL! The corner comes over and Mehdi Benatia wins a simple header before Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) nods the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.

Rune Jarstein pulls off a great save to deny Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich will have a chance to score from a corner.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the right post. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save!

Goal! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the middle of the net. Javi Martinez assisted in the goal. 2:0.
Jochen Drees has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Jochen Drees blows his whistle to start the second half.
A yellow card for a tackle by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin). Jochen Drees doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Vedad Ibisevic will be replaced by Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).
The substitution is prepared. Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Per Skjelbred.
We are about to witness a substitution. Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) is replacing Jerome Boateng.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) replacing Vladimir Darida.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires from the edge of the box to the middle of the goal, but Manuel Neuer is equal to it.
Substitution. Arturo Vidal walks off the pitch and Holger Badstuber (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Goal! Miiko Albornoz launched the corner kick and superbly found the head of Marcelo (Hannover), whose accurate effort from near the penalty spot went into the bottom right corner off the post. It's 1:0.

A perfect lofted pass from Kenan Karaman finds Leon Andreasen (Hannover), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Ramazan Ozcan had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Today's referee Tobias Stieler rightly decides to book Leon Andreasen (Hannover) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Uffe Bech tees up Kenan Karaman (Hannover) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the top of the net. 3:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Tobias Stieler blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has made a change at the break. Danny da Costa (Ingolstadt) has come on in place of Robert Bauer.
Half-time substitution. Tomas Pekhart is replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
The main referee, Tobias Stieler, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Christian Schulz (Hannover) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt) receives a yellow card for chasing the referee and shouting at him.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Danny da Costa (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.

Artur Sobiech (Hannover) attempts to score as he rises near the penalty spot and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Ramazan Ozcan pulls off a comfortable save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) misses a sitter from inside the six-yard box after striking the ball towards goal and it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) comes onto the pitch so that Leon Andreasen can be given a rest.
Here comes a substitution. Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Mathew Leckie.
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) for a heavy challenge.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) latches on to a pass on the edge of the box, but he can't get any power into the shot and fails to trouble Ron-Robert Zieler.
Here is a change. Artur Sobiech is going off and Michael Frontzeck gives the last tactical orders to Charlison Benschop (Hannover).
Charlison Benschop (Hannover) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the left post!
Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Uffe Bech (Hannover) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 4:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Martins Felipe (Hannover) will replace Salif Sane.

This was a piece of cake for Ron-Robert Zieler. Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself in a great position after receiving a precise pass inside the box and sends the ball beyond the goalkeeper! His effort went into the bottom left corner, off the post.
Michael Weiner shows the yellow card to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the left side of the goal. The score is 1:1.
Raffael picks out Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach), who drives a shot just wide of the right post from the edge of the box. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.

Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Weiner ignores the protests. Hoffenheim are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Goal! Nadiem Amiri plays it to Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Yann Sommer. 2:1.

Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Oliver Baumann makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal. B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.
Michael Weiner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Michael Weiner starts the second half.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 3:1.
The manager makes a subsitution with Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) coming on for Mahmoud Dahoud.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.

Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Yann Sommer with a fabulous save.

It's a goal! Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) makes it 2:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Lars Stindl and planted his close-range header into the bottom right corner. Oliver Baumann was helpless.
The whistle blows and Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) is booked for an infringement.

What a chance that is! Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and B. Monchengladbach will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Kevin Volland did his best and is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Here is a change. Julian Korb is going off and Andre Schubert gives the last tactical orders to Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach).
Josip Drmic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
It is time for a substitution. Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) is on for Steven Zuber.

An amazing individual effort from Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the roof of the net and makes it 3:3. Oliver Baumann was helpless.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger). Pierre-Michel Lasogga plays a fantastic through ball and finds Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the roof of the net. It's now 0:1.

Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the right post. Felix Wiedwald has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. The referee blows his whistle, Hamburger SV are awarded a corner kick.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga is being substituted because of an injury. Bruno Labbadia sends Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) on the pitch.
Goal! Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) stands over the free kick and fires the ball goalwards. It's deflected and goes past the stranded goalkeeper, who couldn't do much. 0:2.
Today's referee Knut Kircher rightly decides to book Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
The end of the first half.
Knut Kircher blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the top right corner, but Rene Adler made a crucial save! Werder Bremen get a corner.
Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

A superb goal from great team play! Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Goal! Ivo Ilicevic slips it to Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) on the edge of the box and he finds the right side of the net with a great effort. The score is 1:3.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) will replace Claudio Pizarro.
The referee signals a substitution. Ivica Olic (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Nicolai Muller.
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Fin Bartels is replaced by Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
Here is a change. Ivo Ilicevic is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Ahmet Arslan (Hamburger).
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

What a chance that is! Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Darmstadt will have a goal kick.

Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom left corner. Christian Mathenia has a clear sight of it makes a comfortable save. FC Koln have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) darts into the box and immediately fires a first-time effort. He produces a poor shot which goes well over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Peter Stoger probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Yannick Gerhardt. He is replaced by Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln).
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Yuya Osako is replaced by Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln).
Substitution. Jan Rosenthal makes way for Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt).
