Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Junior Caicara (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
Close effort! Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) takes the resulting free kick from a promising distance, but he sends it narrowly wide of the right post.

Goal! Gonzalo Castro displays great vision and sends a pass to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 3:1.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) picks up a yellow card.

Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the left post. Ralf Fahrmann has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to deny Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Max Meyer and he is replaced by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Franco Di Santo (Schalke) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Sokratis (Dortmund) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the left post, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop the effort.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Sead Kolasinac cannot continue after picking up an injury.
GOAL! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Roman Burki, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 3:2.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.

A great job from two opposing players there. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) fired a shot nicely in on goal from distance towards the bottom right corner, while Roman Burki produced a wonderful piece of goalkeeping to parry the ball onto the post. Schalke have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) unleashes a powerful shot towards goal, but it is bravely blocked by a self-sacrificing defender. The ball is out of play and Schalke manage to earn a corner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Gonzalo Castro walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sven Bender (Dortmund).
That will be all from Roman Neustadter who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Felix Platte (Schalke).
Julian Weigl (Dortmund) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
Felix Platte (Schalke) picks up a caution.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Substitution. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang will be replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) takes a mid-range free kick and his stunning strike crashes against the crossbar.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) latches onto the ball in the penalty box and takes a first-time effort that goes a couple of yards over the crossbar.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) makes a slide tackle, but referee Wolfgang Stark blows for a foul. PENALTY! One of the players from Hamburger SV is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) has a sight of goal and shoots goalwards, but the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Darmstadt.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Jerome Gondorf produces a brilliant lofted pass and Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) gets on the end of it to finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 1:1.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt) was probably a bit loose with his words to Wolfgang Stark, who decides to show him a yellow.
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
The manager makes a subsitution with Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) coming on for Sven Schipplock.
A substitution has been made. Konstantin Rausch goes off and Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) comes on.

Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the right post. Christian Mathenia has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Sailer (Darmstadt) replaces Jan Rosenthal.
It is time for a substitution. Gideon Jung (Hamburger) is on for Marcelo Diaz.
Here is a change. Nicolai Muller is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger).
That will be all from Marcel Heller who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Slobodan Rajkovic (Darmstadt).
That's it for today, Wolfgang Stark has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Yann Sommer pulls off a great save to deny Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Ramazan Ozcan anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the middle of the target.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) can count himself lucky for not being sent off after only receiving a caution from the referee.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
This is a yellow card! Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Mahmoud Dahoud goes off the pitch and Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt) is given a yellow card.
Yann Sommer was forced into action to thwart Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Pascal Gross will be replaced by Konstantin Engel (Ingolstadt).
Konstantin Engel (Ingolstadt) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) gets a yellow card. The referee Marco Fritz made the right call.
Substitution. Lukas Hinterseer is replaced by Danny da Costa (Ingolstadt).
Here is a change. Ibrahima Traore is going off and Andre Schubert gives the last tactical orders to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) sees a second yellow card from the referee and already knows what will come next. It's a red and the match is over for Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach).
Andre Schubert has decided to substitute Raffael and he is replaced by Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach).

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the right side of the goal. Ramazan Ozcan is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. B. Monchengladbach have a corner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Moritz Hartmann walks off the pitch to be replaced by Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Bernd Leno makes a comfortable save to stop his effort. FC Koln force their opponents to concede a corner.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.

Timo Horn stretches to his right side and makes a brilliant save! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the top right corner. The referee blows his whistle, Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
Dominic Maroh (1. FC Koln) takes a great first touch inside the box after the free kick, wins himself some space and beats the goalkeeper with an accurate strike into the left side of the target.

Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) meets a delivery on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards to the bottom left corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Timo Horn pulls off an easy save. Bayer Leverkusen will take a corner kick.
Admir Mehmedi produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:1.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) can count himself lucky for not being sent off after only receiving a caution from the referee.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on the pitch for Karim Bellarabi.
What a huge chance for Anthony Modeste (Koln). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) reacts stupidly and the referee shows him a deserved red card!

Philipp Hosiner (Koln) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. The ball is out of play. FC Koln will have a chance to score from a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and  comes onto the pitch for Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Dominique Heintz (Koln) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.

Dominic Maroh (Koln) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and leaps to connect with a cross from the corner kick. He produces a fine header, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Philipp Hosiner comes off the pitch to be replaced by Dusan Svento (Koln).
Marcel Risse takes over corner duties and expertly finds Dominic Maroh (Koln), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the right side of the goal. The score is now 1:1.

Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom right corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Bernd Leno.
Substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Wendell.

Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and rose high to reach a fine corner kick. He fails to direct the ball past the goalkeeper as it flies narrowly over the bar. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) replaces Leonardo Bittencourt.

That was close by Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen will have a goal kick.
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Bernd Leno makes a comfortable save to stop the effort from flying into the middle of the goal.
makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Yuya Osako leaves the pitch and is replaced by Frederik Sorensen (Koln).
That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Goal! Douglas Costa puts the ball across the area and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 1:0.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Przemyslaw Tyton guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Goal! Thomas Muller slips it to Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box and he finds the right side of the net with a great effort. The score is 2:0.

Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a great save to deny Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Bayern Munich.
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous low effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Przemyslaw Tyton, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
CHANCE! Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores after an assist by Thomas Muller that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:0.

Przemyslaw Tyton hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) shoots from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
What a chance that is! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) scores with a header from inside the box after a goalmouth scramble.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Bastian Dankert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Alexander Zorniger decided to make a change. Filip Kostic is replaced by Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart).
Half-time substitution. Jerome Boateng is replaced by Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich).
What a big chance! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Thomas Muller did his best and is replaced by Holger Badstuber (Bayern Munich).
Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a great save to deny Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Toni Sunjic makes way for Philip Heise (VfB Stuttgart).

Manuel Neuer pulls off a great save to deny Philip Heise (VfB Stuttgart) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Przemyslaw Tyton thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Substitution. Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) replaces Douglas Costa.
Arturo Vidal slides a brilliant pass into Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Substitution. Geoffroy Serey Die will be replaced by Mart Ristl (VfB Stuttgart).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Oliver Baumann makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Oliver Baumann pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Oliver Baumann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Eintracht Frankfurt have a goal ruled out for offside!
Knut Kircher has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.

Unbelievable miss! Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
Substitution. Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) in, Sebastian Rudy out.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Eduardo Vargas as he is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) picks up a yellow card.

Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds himself some space inside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Oliver Baumann pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going low into the middle of the target.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card.
Huub Stevens has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) replacing Kevin Kuranyi.
That will be all from Haris Seferovic who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A yellow-coloured card is received by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) will be replaced by David Kinsombi.
Knut Kircher is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) takes out his opponent with an awful tackle and is shown a red card by the referee!
Goal! The rebound fell to Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:0.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Daniel Siebert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Danny Latza (Mainz) unleashes a mid-range direct free kick, but sees his strike well saved by the goalkeeper.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Dieter Hecking probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Luiz Gustavo. He is replaced by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Danny Latza (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) sends a chip pass into the box, but Diego Benaglio is quickest to intercept the ball.
Substitution. Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) in, Nicklas Bendtner out.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) comes onto the pitch for Jairo Samperio.
Goal! Yoshinori Muto displays great vision and sends a pass to Yunus Malli (Mainz), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the left post. The score is 2:0.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.
Substitution. Suat Serdar (Mainz) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Danny Latza walks off.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dante (Wolfsburg). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
The referee signals a substitution. Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Pablo De Blasis.
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) dribbles into the box, but Diego Benaglio is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Artur Sobiech (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) gets a yellow card. The referee Christian Dingert made the right call.
Goal Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin)! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) was put through by Genki Haraguchi and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) stands over the resultant free kick from mid-range, but his shot goes just over the crossbar. It could have been a fantastic goal!

Artur Sobiech sprays a wonderful pass out to Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Rune Jarstein problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just wide of the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Michael Frontzeck probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Felix Klaus. He is replaced by Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover).
Chance! Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Hiroki Sakai, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.
Leon Andreasen (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
Goal - 0:2! Vladimir Darida tees up Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Ron-Robert Zieler.
Artur Sobiech (Hannover) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Artur Sobiech (Hannover) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Salomon Kalou picks out Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin), who drives a shot just over the crossbar from the edge of the box.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) gives away a foul for a clumsy challenge. Referee Christian Dingert saw the whole situation. It's a penalty for Hannover!
A yellow card for a tackle by Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin). Christian Dingert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Leon Andreasen as he is replaced by Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover).
Fabian Lustenberger comes off the pitch to be replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
Today's referee Christian Dingert rightly decides to book Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.

Christian Dingert interrupts the game. One of the players from Hannover won the ball, but his effort is adjudged unfair. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Hertha Berlin.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is going to take the penalty!
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) keeps his cool from the penalty spot and fires the ball into the top left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Substitution. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) replaces Mitchell Weiser.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just over the bar.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
It's in the back of the net! Nicolai Muller sprays a pass out to Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) unleashed a brilliant free kick from the edge of the box and hits the left post of the goal.

Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a great save to deny Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal. Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Michael Frontzeck has made a change at the break. Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) has come on in place of Manuel Schmiedebach.
Half-time substitution. Felix Klaus is replaced by Uffe Bech (Hannover).

Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) jumps into a tackle and Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle for a foul. Hamburger SV are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.
Hiroshi Kiyotake produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box where Salif Sane (Hannover) rises high to head the ball off the woodwork into the bottom left corner. The score is now - 1:2.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) replaces Michael Gregoritsch.
Substitution. Sven Schipplock makes way for Ivica Olic (Hamburger).
Here is a change. Hiroshi Kiyotake is going off and Michael Frontzeck gives the last tactical orders to Martins Felipe (Hannover).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Lewis Holtby as he is replaced by Cleber (Hamburger).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in. Stuttgart win a corner.

Geoffroy Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) holds his head in his hands after wasting a promising chance. He latches onto a rebound, creates some space for himself and fires the ball from the edge of the box into the stands.
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post.
Martin Harnik is substituted due to injury. Alexander Zorniger gives a chance to Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).

Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) meets a pass on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards right side of the goal. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off an easy save. Darmstadt force their opponents to concede a corner.
Przemyslaw Tyton (VfB Stuttgart) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Geoffroy Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a great save to deny Marcel Heller (Darmstadt), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Geoffroy Serey Die departs the field of play to be replaced by Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart).
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
It's an own goal! An unlucky moment for Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but heads the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 0:0.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Konstantin Rausch walks off the pitch to be replaced by Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt).
Substitution. Peter Niemeyer did his best and is replaced by Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt).

Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Przemyslaw Tyton leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Substitution. Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jan Rosenthal walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Didavi leaves the pitch and Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Junior Diaz (Darmstadt) can count himself lucky for not being sent off after only receiving a caution from the referee.
What an outstanding solo effort by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The foul by Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
Goal! Vieirinha provides Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort under the bar. 1:0.
Goal! A great cross from Christoph Kramer finds Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 1:1.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Diego Benaglio is alert and denies him with a nice save. Bayer Leverkusen earn a corner.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Substitution. Vieirinha did his best and is replaced by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) squandered a big chance from inside the box, firing his volley narrowly over the bar. What a waste.
Substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) on for Hakan Calhanoglu.
We are about to witness a substitution. Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) is replacing Maximilian Arnold.
Substitution. Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Nicklas Bendtner walks off.
Substitution. Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) in, Kyriakos Papadopoulos out.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) picks up a pass, lines up a shot and strikes from 25 metres out, but Bernd Leno thwarts the effort which is headed to the bottom right corner.
Goal! Bas Dost feeds Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 2:1.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Here comes a substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Chicharito.

Close effort! Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) takes the resulting free kick from a promising distance, but he sends it narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) dribbles deep into the box and releases a strike towards the bottom right corner, but Diego Benaglio makes a sensational reflex save and punches the ball onto the post. Superb goalkeeping! The referee blows his whistle, Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Markus Feulner (Augsburg) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity!

Goal! Pablo De Blasis displays great vision and sends a pass to Yoshinori Muto (Mainz), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) wins himself just enough space to meet the resulting corner and shoots towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a great save and gets the ball under control.
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Jairo Samperio, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:2.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) handles the ball inside the penalty area. Augsburg are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Caution goes to Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is going to take the penalty!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) takes the penalty and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom the right corner!
Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) latches on to a lofted pass from the free kick and pulls the trigger from the edge of the box. His effort towards the top left corner is saved by the excellent Loris Karius.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Tim Matavz (Augsburg) gets on the end of a cross from Markus Feulner, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Danny Latza (Mainz) for his blatant foul.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) fires in a promising strike from the free kick just outside the penalty area. His nice effort flies towards the right post but is denied by Loris Karius, who pulls off a glorious save! Augsburg will take a corner kick.

Francisco Caiuby sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 2:2.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Leon Balogun.
Yellow card. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
Substitution. Daniel Baier did his best and is replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
A substitution has been made. Dong-Won Ji goes off and Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) comes on.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) rises highest from the corner and heads at goal, but his effort towards the bottom right corner is saved by Marwin Hitz.
Substitution. Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) on for Jeong-Ho Hong.
What a goal! Francisco Caiuby plays it to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Loris Karius into the bottom right corner. 3:2.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Jairo Samperio and he is replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).
Gonzalo Jara goes off the pitch and Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) comes on.
It's a goal! Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) scores with a brilliant shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Stefan Bell. The score is now 2:2.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

Philipp Hosiner (1. FC Koln) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Oliver Baumann inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the right side of the target, but was denied by a great save.

Timo Horn makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
The foul by Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Gunter Perl.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Kazuki Nagasawa is replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln).
That was close by Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.

What a save from Oliver Baumann! Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out. Good work from FC Koln as they win a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Frederik Sorensen departs the field of play to be replaced by Dominic Maroh (Koln).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) will replace Pavel Kaderabek.

Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and drills a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Timo Horn has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Yuya Osako (Koln) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Dominic Maroh (Koln) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
That's the end of the game for Mark Uth, who is replaced by Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim).
Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim) is quickest inside the box and jumps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it flies just wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Eduardo Vargas as he is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top right corner. He makes it 0:0.

Goal! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the right post. Rune Jarstein had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:2.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Salomon Kalou has picked up an injury and is replaced by Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).
The referee blows his whistle as Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) was too aggressive in his challenge. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to B. Monchengladbach.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) picks up a yellow card.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) sends Rune Jarstein the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Yann Sommer.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tolga Cigerci trots off the pitch and is replaced by Ronny (Hertha Berlin).
We are about to witness a substitution. Marvin Schulz (B. Monchengladbach) is replacing Mahmoud Dahoud.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch so that Raffael can be given a rest.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Substitution. Yanni Regasel (Hertha Berlin) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Valentin Stocker walks off.
Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) is going to take the penalty!
Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) unleashes a strong shot and sends the goalkeeper the wrong way. An easy goal.
The substitution has been made. Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) has replaced Lars Stindl.
Goal! Marvin Schulz provides Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 1:4.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Max Meyer (Schalke) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Ramazan Ozcan makes a great save to stop his effort.

Leroy Sane (Schalke) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the bottom right corner, but Ramazan Ozcan was alert and made an astonishing save! The ball is out of play and Schalke manage to earn a corner.
A sweet pass is collected by Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt) inside the penalty box and he unleashes a brilliant shot which goes into the roof of the net and behind the goalkeeper.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Sead Kolasinac will not participate anymore and Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) is coming on.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) wriggles into space inside the box with excellent ball control, but his effort on goal is well blocked. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Schalke will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) for Elias Kachunga.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. This is a yellow card! Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle for a foul after Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) hacks down one of his opponents. Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Leon Goretzka comes off the pitch to be replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke).
What an opportunity! Junior Caicara (Schalke) smashed a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but the ball only crashed against the left post!

Ramazan Ozcan pulls off a decent save! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the middle of the net, but the effort is kept out. Schalke force a corner. They send men into the box.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
It is time for a substitution. Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) is on for Moritz Hartmann.

It's in the back of the net! Maxim Choupo-Moting sends a superb cross into the box. Leroy Sane (Schalke) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header low inside the left post, leaving Ramazan Ozcan beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
Substitution. Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) on for Mathew Leckie.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot, but is thwarted by a decent save from Ralf Fahrmann.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.

Felix Wiedwald was forced into action to thwart Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. The linesman makes the right call and Dortmund will have a corner.

Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Goal! The rebound fell to Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:1.
Janek Sternberg sends a terrific cross into the box. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just wide of the right post.

A perfect lofted pass from Mats Hummels finds Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Felix Wiedwald had no chance of stopping that. 1:2.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Felix Wiedwald.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) receives the caution after an awful tackle.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
Goal! Henrikh Mkhitaryan provides Marco Reus (Dortmund) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 1:3.
Substitution. Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) in, Joo-Ho Park out.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Reus trots off the pitch and is replaced by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Florian Grillitsch as he is replaced by Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen).
A substitution has been made. Clemens Fritz goes off and Lukas Frode (Werder Bremen) comes on.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Fin Bartels.
Matthias Ginter will be replaced by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.

Lukas Hradecky makes a difficult save to deny Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich), who attempted to head into the roof of the net from inside the box. The referee points to the corner flag and Bayern Munich will take a corner.

Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away. Now Bayern Munich have a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom right corner, but Lukas Hradecky pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. Bayern Munich earn a corner.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wins himself enough space to meet the resulting corner and fires the ball at goal, but the keeper does well to stop his effort.
Substitution. Rafinha will be replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) latched on to a good cross from the corner kick and attempts to finish, but his shot flew just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.

That didn't go as planned! Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort towards the right side of the goal was too weak to get past Manuel Neuer, who easily kept it out.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.
A substitution has been made. Kingsley Coman is replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker.
Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Philipp Lahm goes off the pitch and David Alaba (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Slobodan Medojevic has picked up an injury and is replaced by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Arjen Robben sends a good ball to the edge of the box and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets in a shot which goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Yellow card. David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) holds his head in his hands after wasting a promising chance. He latches onto a rebound, creates some space for himself and fires the ball from the edge of the box into the stands.
Here's the change. Stefan Aigner leaves the pitch and Stefan Reinartz (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Substitution. Marc Stendera makes his way off the pitch and Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as his replacement.
Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Junior Caicara (Schalke) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Dennis Aogo (Schalke) trips an opposition player and Wolfgang Stark signals a foul. PENALTY to B. Monchengladbach!
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) is going to take the penalty!
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the right side of the target, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a superb save.
An unlucky rebound falls to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) and he scores with a bullet header.
Andreas Christensen (B. Monchengladbach) collects the ball from the free kick and immediately sends his close-range effort narrowly wide of the right post!

Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Ralf Fahrmann makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the top left corner.
Andreas Christensen (B. Monchengladbach) suffered a good deal of misfortune as he struck the ball behind his own goalkeeper when trying to clear a dangerous pass to safety.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a caution.

Yann Sommer pulls off a great save to deny Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner. Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.
Here comes a substitution. Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Mahmoud Dahoud.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) plants a goal-bound header towards the left post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away.

Franco Di Santo (Schalke) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. His dangerous effort is blocked by Yann Sommer, who makes a glorious save! The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.

Franco Di Santo (Schalke) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the bottom left corner, but he can't get the power to direct it past Yann Sommer, who gets down to save.

Free kick from the edge of the penalty box. Ideal position for a player with brilliant shooting technique . And that is no one else than Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who perfectly curls the ball into the back of the net. Beautiful football moment.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Junior Caicara will be replaced by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke).
Here is a change. Ibrahima Traore is going off and Andre Schubert gives the last tactical orders to Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).

That was a nice football moment. Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Ralf Fahrmann guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! B. Monchengladbach force a corner. They send men into the box.
Substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg walks off.
Joel Matip (Schalke) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Johannes Geis (Schalke) must think that he is playing a different sport because his behaviour has nothing to do with football and the referee has no choice but to show him a straight red card!
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch after Andre Hahn signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

Goal! Raffael plays in Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom left corner 3:1.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Franco Di Santo is replaced by Roman Neustadter (Schalke).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

It's a goal! Ilkay Gundogan plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa displays great vision and sends a pass to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top of the net. The score is 2:0.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 18 metres out. Marwin Hitz stops the effort which is headed to the left post. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.
GOAL! Superb work from Shinji Kagawa, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who beats Marwin Hitz with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 3:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Piotr Trochowski will not participate anymore and Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is coming on.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Alexander Esswein is replaced by Tobias Werner (Augsburg).

It's in the back of the net! Tobias Werner floated in the free kick and the ball found the head of Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg), whose powerful header from near the penalty spot went straight into the roof of the net. The score is 3:1.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) is in acres of space inside the box and lets fly with a shot which goes well wide of the left post. What a poor effort.
Markus Feulner (Augsburg) has received a yellow card for his foul. Augsburg are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
Dominik Kohr goes off the pitch and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes on.
Substitution. Sven Bender did his best and is replaced by Julian Weigl (Dortmund).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Gonzalo Castro will be replaced by Adnan Januzaj (Dortmund).

Great solo effort by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the left side of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Marco Reus makes his way off the pitch and Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) comes on as his replacement.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 4:1. He was ably assisted there by Adrian Ramos.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) finds himself in a good shooting position after his nice solo run and pulls the trigger to direct the ball inside the right side of the goal.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) sends a pass into the box, but the opposition's defence is alert to the danger and makes a clearance.
Goal! Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 0:1.
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision. Hertha Berlin win a free kick.

What an opportunity! Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross into the box from the free kick, and he plants a header from near the penalty spot which goes a whisker wide of the left post.

What a chance that is! Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) has received a yellow card for his foul. A free kick to Ingolstadt.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision. Ingolstadt are awarded a free kick.
Substitution. Lukas Hinterseer makes way for Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt).
Here's the change. Alexander Baumjohann leaves the pitch and Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) misses a sitter from inside the six-yard box after striking the ball towards goal and it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tomas Pekhart (Ingolstadt) replaces Alfredo Morales.
Tomas Pekhart (Ingolstadt) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Valentin Stocker will be replaced by Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin).
CLOSE! Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Elias Kachunga (Ingolstadt) replaces Max Christiansen.

Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Rune Jarstein, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball is out of play. Ingolstadt win a corner kick.
It will be a substitution. Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Salomon Kalou walks off.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Tomas Pekhart (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
Half-chance! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) plays a pass into the box, but Bernd Leno reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) takes the resulting free kick from 25 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the left side of the goal, but Bernd Leno is alert and keeps the ball out.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
The foul by Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Brych.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Felix Brych blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Half-time substitution. Carlos Gruezo will not participate anymore and Arianit Ferati (VfB Stuttgart) is coming on.
Goal 0:1! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a precise pass on the edge of the box and fires a low shot towards the bottom right corner that goes in off the post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Brandt leaves the pitch and Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Goal! Timo Werner puts the ball on a plate for Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:3.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a sitter from inside the six-yard box after striking the ball towards goal and it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
That will be all from Omer Toprak who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal - 2:3! Karim Bellarabi laid the ball off to Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Goal! The rebound fell to Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) and he fired home from close range. The score is 3:3.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mart Ristl (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Arianit Ferati.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Alexander Zorniger prepares a substitution. Timo Werner is replaced by Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart).
Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The substitution is prepared. Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Stefan Kiessling.

It's a goal! Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) scores with a brilliant shot into the right side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Hakan Calhanoglu. The score is 3:3.
Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card.
Mart Ristl (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Brych ignores the protests.
Felix Brych shows the yellow card to Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the left side of the goal, but Timo Horn was alert and made an amazing save! Now Bayern Munich have a corner.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Timo Horn is alert and denies him.
Goal! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Goal! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) gets a shot away from inside the box and the effort is deflected past the goalkeeper. 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee signals a substitution. Yuya Osako (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Anthony Modeste.

Timo Horn makes a brilliant save! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the left side of the goal but is saved by the keeper!
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Jerome Boateng comes off the pitch to be replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds the head of Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who rises and produces an amazing header inside the right post.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Arjen Robben is replaced by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich).
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Timo Horn is alert and denies him with a nice save.

What a great touch by Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dusan Svento (Koln) will replace Yannick Gerhardt.

Dominique Heintz (Koln) was too forceful with his tackle and Florian Meyer interrupted the game to signal a free kick. The referee points to the penalty spot. Bayern Munich are awarded a penalty kick!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
Pep Guardiola has decided to substitute Thomas Muller and he is replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
That's it for today, Florian Meyer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) finds enough space to climb high and plants a header way over the bar. What a poor effort.
What a huge chance for Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Wolfsburg.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Gunter Perl didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
It is time for a substitution. Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is on for Josuha Guilavogui.
Substitution. Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Gyorgy Garics walks off.
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Julian Draxler is replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Dante (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Gunter Perl ignores the protests.
Substitution. Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) in, Konstantin Rausch out.

Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) replacing Vieirinha.
Here's the change. Peter Niemeyer leaves the pitch and Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) comes on as a substitute.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.

Stefan Reinartz (Eintracht Frankfurt) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Felix Zwayer starts the second half.
Goal - 1:0! Hiroshi Kiyotake laid the ball off to Felix Klaus (Hannover), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Salif Sane (Hannover) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
A substitution has been made. Stefan Reinartz is replaced by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Goal! Alexander Meier displays great vision and sends a pass to Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the right post. The score is 1:1.
GOAL! Stefan Aigner meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 1:2.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) will replace Artur Sobiech.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card.

The first half of this match is about to start.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

What a hit! Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot low into the middle of the net. 0:2.
Goal - 0:3! Florian Grillitsch laid the ball off to Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The match has reached half-time.

Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) has a sight of goal and shoots from long range but his ambitious effort flies just wide of the right post.

The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.

Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went low towards the middle of the target, but Rene Adler was alert and the score remained the same.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Oliver Baumann is alert and denies him.

Great ball in from Dennis Diekmeier. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Ivo Ilicevic, but he can't get on the end of the pass.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) produces a good strike that sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows great reflexes and dives to keep the effort from hitting the net.

Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) must be feeling really frustrated right now. He managed to meet the rebound and sent in a nice header from close range. However, Oliver Baumann pulled off an amazing save out of the blue to deny his promising effort towards the top left corner.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) can bury his head in the sand! He misses the rebound from inside the penalty box as he plants a header well wide of the left post! A typical school boy error!
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked. Hamburger SV will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) did his best to latch onto a through ball, but it was too strong.
Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) will take his place on the pitch.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Ivo Ilicevic is replaced by Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger).
Here is a change. Jonathan Schmid is going off and Markus Gisdol gives the last tactical orders to Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
Half-chance! Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) plays a pass into the box, but Rene Adler reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) obviously did not learn his lesson after the first yellow card because he has been shown a second one by the referee!
Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) stands over the resultant free kick from mid-range, but his shot goes just wide of the left post.
The manager has decided to make a tactical substitution following the red card and Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) enters the field of play to replace Pirmin Schwegler.
Yellow card! It's like Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Daniel Siebert agrees and books him.

Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Rene Adler makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Nicolai Muller walks off the pitch to be replaced by Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger).
Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the right post is smartly dealt with by Rene Adler.
It's in the back of the net! Sven Schipplock is the provider as he slips the ball to Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:1.
What was Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Oliver Baumann.
That's it for today, Daniel Siebert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Guido Winkmann blows his whistle for an infringement.
Ingolstadt have been awarded a penalty kick!
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the middle of the target, but Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a save.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ramazan Ozcan to get hold of the ball.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Guido Winkmann blows his whistle to start the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Ralph Hasenhuttl gives a chance to Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) and Stefan Lex is off.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.

Alfredo Morales goes off the pitch and Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) comes on.
Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Martin Harnik.
Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow card in the hand of Guido Winkmann. And as it's a second one this game, a red follows and Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) is sent from the pitch.
Alexander Zorniger has decided to substitute Daniel Didavi and he is replaced by Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart).
Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
