What an opportunity! Anthony Modeste (Koln) wins the ball from the resulting set piece and unleashes a precise shot from inside the goal area which goes just over the crossbar!
Problems for Michael Frontzeck as Kenan Karaman is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Felix Klaus (Hannover) replaces him.
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Ron-Robert Zieler makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net. FC Koln have a corner.
Christian Schulz (Hannover) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header directed towards the goal is brilliantly saved by the goalkeeper.
Goal! Leon Andreasen (Hannover) puts the ball past the goalkeeper!

Salif Sane (Hannover) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Here's the change. Yuya Osako leaves the pitch and Philipp Hosiner (Koln) comes on as a substitute.

Philipp Hosiner (Koln) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to FC Koln.

It will be a substitution. Martins Felipe (Hannover) is ready to enter the pitch as Artur Sobiech walks off.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and drills a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Lukas Hradecky, who makes a glorious save!
Goal 0:1! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Raffael plays a lovely pass into Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle for a foul after Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) hacks down one of his opponents. Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a penalty!
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) for a tough tackle.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires the penalty inside the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach). Florian Meyer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

The foul by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Florian Meyer.

The referee blows his whistle as Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) was too aggressive in his challenge. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for B. Monchengladbach!
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Lukas Hradecky to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!

Goal - 1:5! Havard Nordtveit laid the ball off to Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

The corner from Konstantin Rausch goes into a dangerous area and finds Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt), who outjumps the defence and glances a header into the back of the net. 0:1.

Christian Mathenia receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Alexander Esswein (Augsburg), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the left side of the goal. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Augsburg.
Luca Caldirola (Darmstadt) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the middle of the goal, but Marwin Hitz keeps it out with an amazing save.
Goal! Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 0:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Dominik Kohr will not participate anymore and Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) is coming on.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Halil Altintop is replaced by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Piotr Trochowski (Augsburg) for Alexander Esswein.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target.
Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt) receives a yellow card.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker.
Here comes a substitution. Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Sandro Wagner.
Luca Caldirola (Darmstadt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
It's time for a substitution. Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) comes on in place of Konstantin Rausch.
Substitution. Marcel Heller will be replaced by Marco Sailer (Darmstadt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself some space around the penalty spot and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the middle of the goal, but Rene Adler keeps it out. Bayer Leverkusen win a corner.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.

What a wonderful moment! Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the crossbar. His effort fails to surprise Rene Adler, who makes a nice save. Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) connects with a cross on the edge of the box, controls the ball and pulls the trigger. Rene Adler makes a beautiful save to deny his effort which would have ended in the roof of the net. Bayer Leverkusen will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Substitution. Omer Toprak is replaced by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen).
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Julian Brandt.
Substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) on for Nicolai Muller.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Tobias Welz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Welz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
It is time for a substitution. Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) is on for Giulio Donati.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hamburger).
Problems for Bruno Labbadia as Aaron Hunt is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) replaces him.
Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Emir Spahic (Hamburger) has received a yellow card for his foul.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
The foul by Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz. Schalke have an opportunity from a mid-range free kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Franco Di Santo (Schalke). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) makes a horrible challenge on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee! Schalke are awarded a free kick near the side line and the players make their way into the box for the inevitable cross.
Johannes Geis takes over corner duties and expertly finds Benedikt Howedes (Schalke), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the back of the net. The score is now 0:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Marco Fritz starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Pal Dardai decided to make a change. Tolga Cigerci is replaced by Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).

Leon Goretzka (Schalke) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the right side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. The referee signals a corner kick to Schalke.

Johannes Geis sends over an inswinging corner and Leon Goretzka (Schalke) gets his head on the ball, but it goes just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Schalke are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.

Johannes Geis (Schalke) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with an accurate shot from the free kick, which is placed dangerously close to the penalty area. However, Rune Jarstein pulls off a great save to stop his attempt towards the top left corner. Schalke force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Joel Matip (Schalke) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Marco Fritz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) fails to score from inside the box as his rebound smashes against the left post!
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.

It's a goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Mitchell Weiser and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Ralf Fahrmann was helpless.
Johannes Geis (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
The manager makes a subsitution with Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) coming on for Leon Goretzka.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Genki Haraguchi walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).

Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Marco Fritz shows the yellow card to Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.

Max Meyer (Schalke) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.
It's a goal! Leroy Sane plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Max Meyer (Schalke). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:1.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Thomas Muller swings the cross over. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the left post.
Goal - 0:1! Thiago Alcantara laid the ball off to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Rafinha (Bayern Munich) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision. Werder Bremen win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of a cross from Juan Bernat, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Melvyn Lorenzen will be replaced by Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen).
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.

Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Manuel Neuer, who pulls off a decent save! Werder Bremen win a corner.
Substitution. Rafinha leaves the pitch and is replaced by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich).
Here is a change. Clemens Fritz is going off and Viktor Skripnik gives the last tactical orders to Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen). Christian Dingert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.
That's the end of the game for Arturo Vidal, who is replaced by Milos Pantovic (Bayern Munich).
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
It's a goal! Julian Draxler plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Max Kruse (Wolfsburg). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.

A perfect lofted pass from Julian Draxler finds Bas Dost (Wolfsburg), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the roof of the net. His effort was both strong and precise, and Oliver Baumann had no chance of stopping that. 2:0.

Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) collects the ball on the edge of the box and produces a precise shot which would have ended inside the right post, if Oliver Baumann hadn't pulled off a wonderful save. Wolfsburg have been awarded a corner kick.

Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Wolfsburg win a corner.
What a big chance! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) coming on for Pavel Kaderabek.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
A great individual effort by Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim)! Showcasing his skills, he found his way deep inside the box and produced a shot which ended inside the right post. A quite a remarkable goal!

Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Oliver Baumann makes a great save to deny his effort directed to the top left corner. The ball goes out of play. Wolfsburg are awarded a corner kick.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches over the bar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.

Diego Benaglio was forced into action to thwart Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Goal! Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:2.

Naldo (Wolfsburg) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and flies inches wide of the left-hand post.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The yellow card is received by Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg).
Goal Max Kruse (Wolfsburg)! Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) was put through by Luiz Gustavo and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the left side of the net. 3:2.
It's time for a substitution. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Julian Draxler.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.

Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) talks out of turn to the referee and subsequently receives a yellow card. His behaviour towards the referee was not friendly. He should be thankful, it could have been much worse!
It is time for a substitution. Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) is on for Bas Dost.
Good team movement sets up Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
It's a goal! Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) scores with a brilliant shot into the left side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Andre Schurrle. The score is now 3:2.
Markus Gisdol has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) replacing Sebastian Rudy.
Substitution. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Eduardo Vargas walks off.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
It will be a substitution. Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Luiz Gustavo walks off.

Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) connects with a cross on the edge of the box, controls the ball and pulls the trigger. Oliver Baumann makes a beautiful save to deny his effort which would have ended in the top right corner.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Pierre Bengtsson (Mainz), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance! The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.

Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang displays great vision and sends a pass to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Marco Reus (Dortmund) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Niko Bungert (Mainz) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Dortmund!
Marco Reus (Dortmund) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot inside the left post. Loris Karius anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.

This would have been a magnificent goal from Joo-Ho Park (Dortmund), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Roman Burki pulls off a great save to deny Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Yellow card. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
A substitution has been made. Jairo Samperio is replaced by Phillipp Klement (Mainz).

Henrikh Mkhitaryan sprays a pass out to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
The referee signals a substitution. Sven Bender (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Marco Reus.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
Goal! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang. The score is 0:2.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Yoshinori Muto is replaced by Florian Niederlechner (Mainz).
The game has come to an end for Shinji Kagawa. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Danny Latza as he is replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).
Loris Karius was forced into action to thwart Joo-Ho Park (Dortmund). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Substitution. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang did his best and is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Bernd Leno (Bayer Leverkusen) poked the ball past his own goalkeeper!
Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
OFF THE POST! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a shot from outside the box and hits the right post!
A rebound finds its way to Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) and he scores with a powerful strike, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the bottom left corner, but Marwin Hitz keeps the ball out.

A neat pass is well received by Christoph Kramer (Bayer Leverkusen), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the middle of the target. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
Karim Bellarabi slides a brilliant pass into Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a pin-point pass on the edge of the box and fires the ball towards the left post, but the goalkeeper performs an amazing acrobatic dive to deny him. The strike bounces off his gloves and hits the post.
Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
The referee signals a substitution. Tim Matavz (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Raul Bobadilla.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Baier (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Daniel Baier leaves the pitch to be replaced by Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg).
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) changes the direction of the ball using his hand, but he is angry when the referee gives a foul against him. PENALTY AWARDED to Bayer Leverkusen!
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) can't convert the spot kick. It goes narrowly over the crossbar.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chicharito leaves the pitch and Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Roger Schmidt prepares a substitution. Hakan Calhanoglu is replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Karim Bellarabi has picked up an injury and is replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here is a change. Alexander Esswein is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Markus Feulner (Augsburg).
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) gets booked.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.

Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender. Bayer Leverkusen force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the right side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) wastes an opportunity to score with a header from deep inside the box. His effort flies well wide of the left post!
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Marco Fritz shows the yellow card to David Alaba (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the left post is smartly dealt with by Roman Burki.
Jerome Boateng plays a terrific cross over to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Marco Fritz blows his whistle for an infringement. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Bayern Munich.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) slots home the penalty after firing the ball in the opposite direction to which the goalkeeper dives!
It's in the back of the net! Gonzalo Castro is the provider as he slips the ball to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:1.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Marco Fritz starts the second half.

GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 3:1.
Gonzalo Castro will be replaced by Adnan Januzaj (Dortmund).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marco Reus (Dortmund) replacing Shinji Kagawa.
Thomas Muller sprays a pass out to Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) darts into the box and immediately fires a first-time effort that ends well wide of the right post.
What a hit! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom right corner. 4:1.

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the left side of the goal, but Roman Burki made an astonishing save!
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but his shot missed the target close to the right post.
Goal! Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 5:1.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Thiago Alcantara is replaced by Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich).
We are about to witness a substitution. Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) is replacing Xabi Alonso.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) earns the yellow card.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets booked.
It will be a substitution. Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) is ready to enter the pitch as Thomas Muller walks off.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

Leroy Sane (Schalke) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Timo Horn, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Excellent touch by Anthony Modeste (Koln)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a terrific save.
What a chance that is! Anthony Modeste (Koln) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) picks up the rebound and shoots. The goalkeeper was ready and denies his effort with a fine save.
A precise cross aimed towards the penalty spot was met by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke). He outjumped the defence and produced a decent header which went a whisker wide of the right post.
Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) collects a pass and has an effort from 20 metres out, but it flies just over the crossbar.

Leroy Sane (Schalke) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails towards the right post. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save.

It's in the back of the net! Leonardo Bittencourt slips the ball through to Anthony Modeste (Koln), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent low shot into the back of the net. He makes it 0:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Knut Kircher ignores the protests. Schalke will take a free kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leonardo Bittencourt departs the field of play to be replaced by Kevin Vogt (Koln).
Leon Goretzka goes off the pitch and Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) comes on.
Today's referee Knut Kircher rightly decides to book Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) for his harsh tackle. A free kick to Schalke.
A substitution has been made. Yuya Osako goes off and Dominic Maroh (Koln) comes on.

Timo Horn pulls off a stunning save to block the free kick from Johannes Geis (Schalke). The ball was heading towards the right side of the goal. The ball is out of play. Schalke will have a chance to score from a corner.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Roman Neustadter and he is replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke).
Knut Kircher shows the yellow card to Johannes Geis (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away.
Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball into the bottom left corner of the target, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
Here comes a substitution. Simon Zoller (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Marcel Risse.
Fantastic team goal! Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) was set free in the area by Kevin Vogt and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 0:3.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) replacing Leroy Sane.
Max Meyer (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Knut Kircher after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) blows a great chance. He unleashes a shot from inside the box, but the effort rattles the left post. The goalkeeper can remain calm.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his low effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Tobias Sippel.
Ricardo Rodriguez plays a pass to Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg), but he fails to get a decent shot away from inside the box and the ball flies well wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 20 metres out, but he missed the right post by a whisker.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Marcel Schafer can be given a rest.
Here is a change. Mahmoud Dahoud is going off and Andre Schubert gives the last tactical orders to Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach).
Fabian Johnson comes off the pitch to be replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).

Max Kruse sprays a wonderful pass out to Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Tobias Sippel problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just over the crossbar.
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) fires in a first-time projectile from about 20 metres. Diego Benaglio stretches but the ball is out of his reach and ends up inside the left post.
Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) was probably a bit loose with his words to Felix Zwayer, who decides to show him a yellow.

An amazing individual effort from Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the left side of the goal and makes it 2:0. Diego Benaglio was helpless.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch for Maximilian Arnold.

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) starts an individual run, not looking to pass to a teammate, and easily weaves through the defence to get deep inside the box. He shoots low, but misses the goal by a whisker!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Raffael cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
The foul by Salif Sane (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Peter Sippel.

Leon Andreasen (Hannover) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the right side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Felix Wiedwald, who keeps it out. The referee blows his whistle, Hannover are awarded a corner kick.
Today's referee Peter Sippel rightly decides to book Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the bar.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Peter Sippel has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Christian Schulz (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Peter Sippel ignores the protests.

Salif Sane (Hannover) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Hiroshi Kiyotake. His header was precise and ended up inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:0.
Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a great save to deny Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to make a change. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) replaces Ulisses Garcia.
Wow, what an escape. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. Hannover have a corner.
Substitution. Florian Grillitsch leaves the pitch and is replaced by Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen).

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it low towards the middle of the target, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulled off a nice save and to stop the attempt.

Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Ron-Robert Zieler, who pulls off a stunning save! Werder Bremen win a corner.
It's time for a substitution. Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) comes on in place of Artur Sobiech.

Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) shows great individual ability and unleashes a beautiful strike from about 20 metres. His effort heads inside the right post but is saved by Felix Wiedwald. The score remains the same. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Hannover.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 22 metres out. Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the bottom left corner.

Ron-Robert Zieler makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Martins Felipe (Hannover) replaces Hiroshi Kiyotake.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alejandro Galvez departs the field of play to be replaced by Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen).

Kenan Karaman (Hannover) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Hannover.
We are about to witness a substitution. Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) is replacing Manuel Schmiedebach.
Peter Sippel shows a yellow card to Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Peter Sippel has issued a yellow card to Ron-Robert Zieler (Hannover).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

Brilliant finish! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Mitchell Weiser, then produced a nice strike into the left side of the goal. The score is 1:0.
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper.
Niklas Stark is substituted due to injury. Pal Dardai gives a chance to Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
Wow, what an escape. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The referee points to the corner flag and Hamburger SV will take a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) comes on the pitch for Matthias Ostrzolek.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Rune Jarstein can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Lewis Holtby (Hamburger). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick.
Here comes a substitution. Marcelo Diaz is given a rest as he is replaced by Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger).
A yellow card for a tackle by Nicolai Muller (Hamburger). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Salomon Kalou walks off.

A brilliant individual effort! Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to substitute Nicolai Muller and he is replaced by Ivica Olic (Hamburger).

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes narrowly wide of the right post! What a huge opportunity! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Goal! Tolga Cigerci passes the ball to the feet of Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 2:0.

Superb finishing from Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin). Alexander Baumjohann plays a fantastic through ball and finds Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 1:0.
Substitution. Tolga Cigerci is replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The corner kick falls to Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim), who does his best to finish. The snap shot, however, only marks the left post!

Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the top of the net. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.
What a big chance! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and signals a foul after Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) brought his opponent down. Hoffenheim are awarded a penalty kick!
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.

Great solo effort by Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the left side of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies just over the bar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Oliver Baumann. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Stuttgart.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Toni Sunjic makes way for Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart).
Alexander Zorniger has decided to substitute Lukas Rupp and he is replaced by Arianit Ferati (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexandru Maxim leaves the pitch and Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.

Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Daniel Didavi. His header was precise and ended up inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:1.
It's time for a substitution. Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Sebastian Rudy.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) replaces Eugen Polanski.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
What a goal that is! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) goes on a mazy run and from inside the box he beats Przemyslaw Tyton with a delightful chip. He makes it 2:1.
Deniz Aytekin rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Eduardo Vargas did his best and is replaced by Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim).

It's a goal! Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Arianit Ferati and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Oliver Baumann was helpless.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Deniz Aytekin is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has made a change at the break. Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) has come on in place of Roger.

Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it's not accurate and goes narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Lukas Hradecky is alert and denies him.
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
It will be a substitution. Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) is ready to enter the pitch as Makoto Hasebe walks off.
A yellow card for a tackle by Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
We are about to witness a substitution. Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) is replacing Moritz Hartmann.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) receives a pass and doesn't hesitate to shoot from around 20 metres. And it was an excellent choice. His superb effort goes in off the right post.
The substitution has been made. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt) has replaced Luc Castaignos.
Here is a change. Max Christiansen is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt).
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 2:0.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

It's in the back of the net! Danny Latza sends a cross in from the set piece and Stefan Bell (Mainz) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes inside the left post and the score changes to 0:1.
Danny Latza (Mainz) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Brilliant finish! Yunus Malli (Mainz) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Yoshinori Muto, then produced a nice strike into the left side of the goal. The score is 0:2.
Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) blasts the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box and it flies straight into the top right corner of the net!
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Dirk Schuster has made a change at the break. Marco Sailer (Darmstadt) has come on in place of Jan Rosenthal.
Marco Sailer (Darmstadt) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post!
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Luca Caldirola (Darmstadt).
It's in the back of the net! Konstantin Rausch plays it into the box, and Marco Sailer (Darmstadt) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:2.
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the middle of the goal, but Christian Mathenia pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Goal! Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) gets to the ball inside the box, sees the goalkeeper off his line and lifts the ball over him and into the back of the net. 2:3.
Loris Karius (Mainz) is cautioned by the referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) comes onto the pitch for Peter Niemeyer.
The manager makes a subsitution with Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt) coming on for Konstantin Rausch.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Yoshinori Muto and he is replaced by Leon Balogun (Mainz).

Jairo Samperio (Mainz) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Christian Mathenia guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Substitution. Pablo De Blasis makes way for Florian Niederlechner (Mainz).
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Christoph Moritz (Mainz) replaces Yunus Malli.
Florian Meyer interrupts the game for a tactical foul by Gonzalo Jara (Mainz). PENALTY! One of the players from Darmstadt is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) misses the penalty! His poor effort goes well over the crossbar.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly over the bar. The goalkeeper was lucky!

It's a goal! Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the left side of the target. The assist goes to Jerome Gondorf and the score changes to 0:1.

Ambitious effort from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the left post.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The foul by Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Peter Niemeyer trots off the pitch and is replaced by Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt).
Here is a change. Marco Reus is going off and Thomas Tuchel gives the last tactical orders to Adnan Januzaj (Dortmund).

Goal! Matthias Ginter plays in Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom right corner 1:1.
We are about to witness a substitution. Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) is replacing Konstantin Rausch.

Goal! Adnan Januzaj displays great vision and sends a pass to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:1.
Here comes a substitution. Jerome Gondorf is given a rest as he is replaced by Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt).
What a hit! Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 2:2.
Substitution. Shinji Kagawa leaves the pitch and is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) was in a good shooting position inside the six-yard box and produced a first-time shot towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper made an astonishing save to thwart him. The linesman makes the right call and Hertha Berlin will have a corner.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) sees his header crash off the crossbar after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Today's referee Benjamin Brand rightly decides to book Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
Benjamin Brand shows the yellow card to Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
GOAL - 1:0! The corner comes over and Marco Russ flicks on with his head to Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.

Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a cross from Bastian Oczipka, but he cannot keep his header on target. It goes high over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss! The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
OFF THE WOODWORK! Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) surges forward and manages to get a powerful shot away from 25 metres out. However, the effort crashes against the bar!
Benjamin Brand has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Benjamin Brand starts the second half.
Substitution. Vaclav Kadlec leaves the pitch and is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Tolga Cigerci goes off the pitch and Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Armin Veh has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Stefan Aigner.

Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) wasted a golden chance to score after he found some space inside the box and unluckily volleyed the ball narrowly over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch so that Salomon Kalou can be given a rest.

Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Lukas Hradecky is just a bystander as the ball flies into bottom right corner. The score is 1:1.
Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Benjamin Brand ignores the protests.
That's the end of the game for Genki Haraguchi, who is replaced by Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming onto the pitch as Gian-Luca Waldschmidt cannot continue after picking up an injury.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Franco Di Santo (Schalke) latches on to a perfectly taken corner kick deep into the box and attempts to head home. His bullet header heads straight towards the roof of the net, but it's deflected onto the crossbar by the goalkeeper. A wonderful effort.
Marco Hoger is substituted due to injury. Andre Breitenreiter gives a chance to Leroy Sane (Schalke).
Johannes Geis (Schalke) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) was waiting for the ball on the penalty spot and produced a powerful volley towards the crossbar, but the goalkeeper made an amazing save to deny him. Schalke force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

Leroy Sane (Schalke) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom right corner, but Jaroslav Drobny made a crucial save! The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) latches on to a precise cross on the edge of the box and strikes the ball goalwards. However, it goes just over the crossbar.
Goal! Leon Goretzka puts the ball on a plate for Leroy Sane (Schalke), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.
Substitution. Michael Gregoritsch makes way for Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger).

Max Meyer (Schalke) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Jaroslav Drobny guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) for Lewis Holtby.
Here is a change. Max Meyer is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke).
What a chance that is! Leon Goretzka (Schalke) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch for Albin Ekdal.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar.
This is a yellow card! Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to deny Aaron Hunt (Hamburger), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Ralf Fahrmann (Schalke) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Substitution. Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) replaces Leroy Sane.

Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Hamburger SV will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) tries to threaten the goalkeeper as he takes the ball and fires from long range. The shot flies just over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) fires the ball towards the left side of the goal from close-range, but his shot is blocked by one of the defenders. Augsburg force their opponents to concede a corner.

Brilliant finish! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Eduardo Vargas, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.

Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the right side of the goal, but Marwin Hitz was alert and made an astonishing save! The referee blows his whistle, Hoffenheim are awarded a corner kick.

Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the right side of the goal. His effort is blocked by Oliver Baumann with a brilliant diving save! The linesman makes the right call and Augsburg will have a corner.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) latches on to a superb cross inside the box but only hits the crossbar with a fine header. What a chance!
An unlucky rebound falls to Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) and he scores with a bullet header.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Markus Gisdol gives a chance to Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) and Sebastian Rudy is off.
The foul by Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
What a save from Oliver Baumann! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the top of the net, but the Oliver Baumann pulled off a nice save. Augsburg will take a corner kick.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision. Augsburg are awarded a free kick near the side line and the players make their way into the box for the inevitable cross.
Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Manuel Grafe signals. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Hoffenheim.
The referee Manuel Grafe awards Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) a yellow card.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the right post.
Substitution. Halil Altintop walks off the pitch and Tim Matavz (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.

Superb finishing from Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim). Kevin Volland plays a fantastic through ball and finds Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a close-range shot past the goalkeeper. It's 1:1.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the crossbar. Aim better, sir.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) for Raul Bobadilla.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim). Augsburg have a free kick.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Piotr Trochowski (Augsburg) replacing Dominik Kohr.
Piotr Trochowski (Augsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Oliver Baumann to dive and make a save.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Eduardo Vargas will be replaced by Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim).
Total attempts  26:11.
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Jonathan Schmid is replaced by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) gets a shot from inside the penalty area and it flies just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Bastian Dankert blows his whistle after Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. It's a penalty to Bayern Munich! Let's see who's going to take it.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. He skies the ball way over the bar and into the stands.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.

Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Yoshinori Muto (Mainz). This could have been a legendary goal.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the roof of the net, but is thwarted by a great save from Loris Karius. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Bayern Munich.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

It's in the back of the net! Kingsley Coman sends a superb cross into the box. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the left post, leaving Loris Karius beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Thomas Muller.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Substitution. Yunus Malli did his best and is replaced by Jairo Samperio (Mainz).
Here is a change. Javi Martinez is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich).
It's in the back of the net! Douglas Costa sprays a pass out to Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:3.
A substitution has been made. Douglas Costa goes off and Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) comes on.

Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) latches onto a cross into the box from the wing and gets in a header. It went well towards the goal, but it was blocked by one of the defenders. Mainz force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Danny Latza is replaced by Christoph Moritz (Mainz).
Christian Clemens (Mainz) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the crossbar. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leon Balogun (Mainz) comes onto the pitch so that Christian Clemens can be given a rest.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Bayern Munich will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The foul by Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Gunter Perl. B. Monchengladbach are awarded a free kick.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach), who rises and produces an amazing header inside the left post.
OWN GOAL! Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 0:2.
Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Przemyslaw Tyton is alert and denies him.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the middle of the goal. However, he couldn't beat Yann Sommer, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) has a great chance to score from deep inside the box! He finds some space for the shot, but sends it errantly way past the left post. Very poor attempt.
B. Monchengladbach concede a free kick following a bad challenge. The referee points to the penalty spot. Stuttgart are awarded a penalty kick!
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) is going to take the penalty!
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) sends Yann Sommer the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) meets a cross and produces a header towards the middle of the net, but one of the defending players blocks the effort. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Stuttgart.
Gunter Perl has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) dribbles into the box, but Przemyslaw Tyton is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a pass inside the box, but his low effort towards the right post is well blocked.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) strikes the ball towards the right side of the goal despite being in a difficult position, but his shot is intercepted by one of the defenders.

Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision. A mid-range free kick is awarded to B. Monchengladbach out wide and from this angle a cross into the box is likely.

Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) shoots at goal from the free kick from some 20 metres out. His attempt was quite precise and another few inches and it would have ended up inside the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Here's the change. Daniel Didavi leaves the pitch and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card!
Andre Schubert has decided to substitute Mahmoud Dahoud and he is replaced by Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Korb trots off the pitch and is replaced by Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).
Close! Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot narrowly over the bar.
Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Patrick Herrmann leaves the pitch and Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.

A big rebound falls at the feet of Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart). He doesn't hesitate and unleashes a shot towards goal, but it fails to get through a wall of players and ricochets away off one of his own teammates.

Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the top right corner. However, he couldn't beat Yann Sommer, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save. Stuttgart get a corner.
Alexander Zorniger prepares a substitution. Christian Gentner is replaced by Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart).
The game has come to an end for Timo Baumgartl. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart).
Booking. Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) receives a caution from the referee.

Yann Sommer makes a brilliant save! Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the middle of the goal but is saved by the keeper!
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Przemyslaw Tyton with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:3.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.

Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was! The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen will have a goal kick.

GOAL 0:1! Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) brilliantly slaloms his way forward past a few defenders and unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which is deflected and goes into the back of the net.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card.
Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) fires a rebound from mid-range onto the right post!
Caution goes to Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Marcel Hilssner (Werder Bremen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Levin Oztunali walks off.
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Claudio Pizarro is replaced by Luca-Milan Zander (Werder Bremen).
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) scores from the free kick just outside the box with a great shot, bouncing in off the crossbar. The goalkeeper couldn't do anything about it.
Roger Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Karim Bellarabi.

Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) rounds off a sensational solo effort with a shot from about 23 metres out. The ball slams into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper beaten. The score sheet now reads 0:3.
The manager makes a subsitution with Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) coming on for Julian Brandt.

Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him. Bayer Leverkusen force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) wasted a clear opportunity. He fired a first-time shot from point-blank range, but it rattled the right post.
Substitution. Admir Mehmedi is replaced by Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen).

Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Wolfgang Stark and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Free kick. Werder Bremen will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
Substitution. Santiago Garcia walks off the pitch and Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) comes on as a substitute.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) unleashes a beautiful mid-range volley to the bottom left corner, but his effort is thwarted by the keeper, and the score remains the same.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

It's a goal! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Daniel Caligiuri and planted his close-range header into the right side of the goal. Ron-Robert Zieler was helpless.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

It's a goal! Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) darts into the box to collect a fantastic lofted pass from Manuel Schmiedebach and unleashes a powerful shot directed into the roof of the net. The ball bounces in off the crossbar, increasing the score of today's match. It's now 1:0.
The substitution is prepared. Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Julian Draxler.
Substitution. Felix Klaus (Hannover) has come on for Leon Andreasen.

Ron-Robert Zieler was forced into action to thwart Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot towards the roof of the net but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball is out of play and Wolfsburg manage to earn a corner.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Artur Sobiech will be replaced by Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover).
Here is a change. Andre Schurrle is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg).

Ron-Robert Zieler was forced into action to thwart Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The referee points to the corner flag and Wolfsburg will take a corner.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Christian Trasch and he is replaced by Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg).
A substitution has been made. Hiroshi Kiyotake goes off and Martins Felipe (Hannover) comes on.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Martins Felipe (Hannover).
Golden chance! Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Marcelo (Hannover) for his blatant foul.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Yuya Osako (Koln) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.

It's in the back of the net! Marcel Risse sends a superb cross into the box. Anthony Modeste (Koln) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header into the roof of the net, leaving Ramazan Ozcan beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.

Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) jumps highest to meet the ball from the corner kick and finishes behind the helpless keeper with a fine header inside the left post. The defence stare motionlessly at each other. What a peach of a goal that is. Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) has every right to celebrate!
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Christian Dingert starts the second half.
The manager makes a subsitution with Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) coming on for Stefan Lex.
