Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln) has received a yellow card for his foul. Ingolstadt win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Lukas Hinterseer will be replaced by Tomas Pekhart (Ingolstadt).
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt is replaced by Dusan Svento (1. FC Koln).
A yellow card for a tackle by Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt). Christian Dingert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and directs a sweet strike towards the left post. The goalkeeper, however, denies him with a stunning save. FC Koln have a corner.
Booking. Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) receives a caution from the referee.
Substitution. Danny da Costa (Ingolstadt) on for Mathew Leckie.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The ball is out of play. B. Monchengladbach will have a chance to score from a corner.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) has a shot blocked from inside the box.
Goal! Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge. B. Monchengladbach are awarded the free kick.

It's in the back of the net! Raffael flights the free kick into the box, where Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) peels off his marker and heads straight into the left side of the net from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:0.
Goal! Raffael slips it to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he finds the top right corner with a great effort. The score is 3:0.
Goal! Raffael tees up Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 4:0.
Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.

Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) strikes the ball towards the right side of the goal despite being in a difficult position, but his shot is intercepted by one of the defenders. B. Monchengladbach get a corner.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Markus Weinzierl probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Konstantinos Stafylidis. He is replaced by Markus Feulner (Augsburg).
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) for a tough tackle.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Daniel Siebert has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle. A penalty is awarded to Augsburg!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is going to take the penalty!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) attempts to discuss the decision with Daniel Siebert, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Patrick Herrmann will be replaced by Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).
Andre Schubert prepares a substitution. Fabian Johnson is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
What a save from Marwin Hitz! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.

A neat pass is well received by Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible diving save to block his shot.

Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Marwin Hitz is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
That will be all from Alexander Esswein who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Philipp Max (Augsburg).

Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) commits a rough foul. Daniel Siebert stops the game and makes a call. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Augsburg.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
Andre Schubert has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Granit Xhaka.
Substitution. Dominik Kohr will be replaced by Sascha Molders (Augsburg).
Daniel Siebert has issued a yellow card to Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg). There is a free kick near the sideline to B. Monchengladbach.
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) fires a brilliant shot in from 25 metres out, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.
A rebound lands at the feet of Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), whose promising strike from long range crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!
Daniel Siebert rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Daniel Baier (Augsburg).
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise cross and hammers the ball goalwards, but it flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.

What a chance! The ball rebounds out to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) and his strike from the edge of the box goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Loris Karius makes a great save to stop the effort going into the right side of the goal. Bayer Leverkusen force their opponents to concede a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

This would have been a magnificent goal from Christian Clemens (Mainz), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.

That was a nice football moment. Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Loris Karius guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Danny Latza (Mainz) comes onto the pitch so that Christoph Moritz can be given a rest.

Yunus Malli (Mainz) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Bernd Leno is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball goes out of play. Mainz are awarded a corner kick.

Goal! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Loris Karius had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:0.
A substitution has been made. Chicharito goes off and Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) replaces Pablo De Blasis.
Post! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
The game is interrupted. Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Mainz.

Christian Clemens (Mainz) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Bernd Leno to dive and make a save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Mainz.

Great ball in from Karim Bellarabi. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
It will be a substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) is ready to enter the pitch as Karim Bellarabi walks off.
Here is a change. Yoshinori Muto is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Jhon Cordoba (Mainz).
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to  for his blatant foul.

What a great touch by Christoph Kramer (Bayer Leverkusen) after latching on to a precise pass on the edge of the box! He finds some space and rips a shot close to the right post. The goalkeeper makes an astonishing save, knocking the ball onto the post.
The referee signals a substitution. Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Lars Bender.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Leon Andreasen (Hannover) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
It's in the back of the net! Hiroshi Kiyotake plays it into the box, and Kenan Karaman (Hannover) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the left post. 1:0.

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Ron-Robert Zieler is just a bystander as the ball flies into bottom right corner. The score is 1:1.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a rebound in the box and unleashes a brilliant effort, leaving the goalkeeper no chance.

Przemyslaw Tyton can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Hiroki Sakai (Hannover). The ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
The game has begun to heat up. Geoffroy Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Marcelo (Hannover) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the right post! What a shot that was!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Michael Frontzeck has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) comes on the pitch for Oliver Sorg.
Great touch by Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Christian Schulz (Hannover) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Today's match ends for Daniel Didavi who will be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Klaus (Hannover) comes onto the pitch for Kenan Karaman.
The substitution is prepared. Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Leon Andreasen.
Alexander Zorniger has decided to substitute Timo Werner and he is replaced by Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart).
Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
It's time for a substitution. Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Christian Gentner.
Artur Sobiech (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Sascha Stegemann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
GOAL! Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 1:3.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent. There is a free kick near the sideline to Dortmund.

Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Roman Burki, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball is out of play. Hoffenheim will have a chance to score from a corner.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) latches on to a sweet pass and scores with aplomb. His low drive goes in off the left post. Fabulous goal!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Jonas Hofmann will not participate anymore and Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) is coming on.
Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) squanders a golden opportunity after striking the ball onto the post of the goal!
The manager makes a subsitution with Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) coming on for Marco Reus.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eugen Polanski leaves the pitch and Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Welz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal. Now Dortmund have a corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Gonzalo Castro as he is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Sebastian Rudy is replaced by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) dribbles into the box, but Oliver Baumann is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Welz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch so that Eduardo Vargas can be given a rest.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Chance! Joel Matip (Schalke) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Sead Kolasinac, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) attempts to score from 28 metres out, but his decent effort flies to the left side of the target and is thwarted by Lukas Hradecky. Fantastic goalkeeping!

Johannes Geis (Schalke) takes the resulting free kick from 20 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the roof of the net, but Lukas Hradecky is alert and keeps the ball out. Schalke will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Marco Hoger (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
Armin Veh is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Haris Seferovic suffers an injury and Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.

Lukas Hradecky makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Leon Goretzka (Schalke) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the bottom left corner.
Lovely skill from Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) as he gets away from defenders and unleashes a shot from 26 metres out, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
Marco Hoger (Schalke) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Felix Zwayer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Here comes a substitution. David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Carlos Zambrano.

Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a fine cross from the resulting corner and attempts to finish from the edge of the box. His shot, however, misses the target narrowly wide of the left post.

Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) passes the ball from the edge of the box in order to find his teammate, who is in a good scoring position, but the defender blocks the pass and spanks the ball to safety. Good work from Eintracht Frankfurt as they win a corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to deny Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Substitution. Marco Hoger makes his way off the pitch and Leroy Sane (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.

Joel Matip (Schalke) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt into the bottom right corner fails to beat Lukas Hradecky, who makes a sensational save.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Franco Di Santo (Schalke) replacing Maxim Choupo-Moting.
Johannes Geis takes over corner duties and expertly finds Joel Matip (Schalke), who scores with a header that bounces up off the ground and goes into the bottom left corner. The score is now 1:0.
Substitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Luc Castaignos.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

What a save from Ralf Fahrmann! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the left post, but the goalkeeper has pulled off a brilliant stop to keep it out. The ball goes out for a corner. Eintracht Frankfurt can continue in their attacking effort.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

Ralf Fahrmann makes a brilliant save! Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the top right corner but is saved by the keeper! The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Eintracht Frankfurt will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Today's match ends for Max Meyer who will be replaced by Benedikt Howedes (Schalke).
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.

An amazing individual effort from Leroy Sane (Schalke) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball low into the middle of the goal and makes it 2:0. Lukas Hradecky was helpless.
Felix Zwayer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.

Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) meets a perfect cross from Julian Draxler deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the right post. The score is 0:1.

Chance! Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the top of the net, but Diego Benaglio is alert and makes a great save to deny him. The ball goes out of play. Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) fires a brilliant shot in from 50 metres out, but the effort rattles the left post! It could have been a superb goal.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Thiago Alcantara will not participate anymore and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is coming on.
Half-time substitution. Juan Bernat is replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) and Thomas Muller attempt to exchange short two-yard passes, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 22 metres out which goes into the bottom left corner.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the middle of the goal, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Diego Benaglio. What a save!
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:1.

It's a goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the roof of the net. The assist goes to Douglas Costa and the score changes to 4:1.
A substitution has been made. Luiz Gustavo is replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the left post. He couldn't have done it any better. 5:1.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range low towards the middle of the net, but Diego Benaglio was alert and made an amazing save!
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Xabi Alonso will be replaced by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich).
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) replaces Bas Dost.
Substitution. Max Kruse will be replaced by Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg).
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
What a chance for Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball goes inches over the crossbar.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Felix Wiedwald.
It's in the back of the net! Theodor Gebre Selassie puts the ball on a plate for Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 0:1.
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked. Werder Bremen force their opponents to concede a corner.
Fabian Holland (Darmstadt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

Felix Wiedwald (Werder Bremen) manages to dispossess his opponent of the ball, but he commits a foul in the process and the referee blows his whistle. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Darmstadt.
Felix Wiedwald (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Goal! Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) slams home the penalty with a precise shot which goes inside the right post.
Substitution. Junior Diaz (Darmstadt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Fabian Holland walks off.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes a whisker over the bar! What a huge opportunity!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Konstantin Rausch comes off the pitch to be replaced by Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt).
Substitution. Alejandro Galvez leaves the pitch and is replaced by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aron Johannsson departs the field of play to be replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Goal! Marcel Heller picks out Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) with a perfect cross, and he has no problem to nod the ball into an empty net. It's 2:1.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) sees a second yellow card from the referee and already knows what will come next. It's a red and the match is over for Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen).
The yellow card is received by Junior Diaz (Darmstadt).
Substitution. Janek Sternberg walks off the pitch and Lukas Frode (Werder Bremen) comes on as a substitute.
Here comes a substitution. Jan Rosenthal is given a rest as he is replaced by Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Today's referee Florian Meyer rightly decides to book Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.

Kevin Vogt (Koln) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Rune Jarstein pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) fails to score from the rebound as the goalkeeper stops his effort from hitting the net.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) won himself just enough space to connect with the corner inside the box. His header flew towards the right post, but the goalkeeper dived superbly to stop the effort. The ball is out of play. Hertha Berlin will have a chance to score from a corner.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the left post.
A precise cross towards the penalty spot was latched onto by Anthony Modeste (Koln). He outjumped the defence and produced a decent header which went a whisker wide of the left post.

The ball hits the back of the net! Marvin Plattenhardt showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it low inside the right post  1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Timo Horn pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
CHANCE! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Vladimir Darida.
CHANCE! Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
It will be a substitution. Simon Zoller (Koln) is ready to enter the pitch as Pawel Olkowski walks off.
Kevin Vogt has picked up an injury and is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Koln).

A huge opportunity wasted! Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) produces a header from a rebound around the penalty spot. His effort is denied by one of the defenders who is well positioned and clears the ball to safety.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Valentin Stocker trots off the pitch and is replaced by Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin).
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt is replaced by Philipp Hosiner (1. FC Koln).
Here comes a substitution. Salomon Kalou is given a rest as he is replaced by Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).
Philipp Hosiner (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Florian Meyer ignores the protests.
Substitution. Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) has come on for Genki Haraguchi.

Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Timo Horn guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Alexander Baumjohann is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom right corner to make the score 2:0.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) dribbles into the box, but Ramazan Ozcan is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) has received a yellow card for his foul.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) says more than he should have to the referee and is shown a yellow card.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch so that Ivo Ilicevic can be given a rest.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) will replace Nicolai Muller.
Substitution. Elias Kachunga (Ingolstadt) has come on for Lukas Hinterseer.
What a chance that is! Alfredo Morales swings the ball into the box, and Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the right post.
Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) attempts to score with a first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort towards the roof of the net is saved by Ramazan Ozcan.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) for Stefan Lex.
Goal! The free-kick is fired in by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) and the ball inadvertently flicks off a defender and spins into the net, leaving Ramazan Ozcan stranded. 0:1.
Here comes a substitution. Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Markus Suttner.
Substitution. Lewis Holtby is replaced by Cleber (Hamburger).
Roger (Ingolstadt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner in trademark fashion.
The booking goes to Marcelo (Hannover).
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card.
That will be all from Edgar Prib who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Markus Weinzierl decided to make a change. Alexander Esswein is replaced by Markus Feulner (Augsburg).
Tim Matavz (Augsburg) blows a clear opportunity! He sends a rebound from close range narrowly wide of the left post.
Tim Matavz (Augsburg) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but his shot missed the target close to the right post.
It will be a substitution. Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) is ready to enter the pitch as Hiroshi Kiyotake walks off.
Here is a change. Oliver Sorg is going off and Michael Frontzeck gives the last tactical orders to Felix Klaus (Hannover).
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) replacing Tobias Werner.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Christian Schulz (Hannover) gets booked.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Halil Altintop walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg).
Caution goes to Leon Andreasen (Hannover).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

Great solo effort by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) as he beats two defenders before firing in a drive from just outside of the box towards the top right corner. The goalkeeper is ready and makes an amazing save. The ball goes out of play. Dortmund are awarded a corner kick.
That was close by Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Fantastic team goal! Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) was set free in the area by Shinji Kagawa and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Deniz Aytekin after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Roger Schmidt has made a change at the break. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) has come on in place of Christoph Kramer.
Half-time substitution. Stefan Kiessling is replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Bernd Leno guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Goal - 2:0! Henrikh Mkhitaryan laid the ball off to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Sokratis (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. A free kick has been awarded to Bayer Leverkusen.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) was close to scoring from the resulting free kick. He unleashed a decent strike from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper made a great save to keep him out.
It is time for a substitution. Adnan Januzaj (Dortmund) is on for Jonas Hofmann.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
The foul by Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Deniz Aytekin. Dortmund earn a free kick.
Dortmund are given a penalty!
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
That will be all from Karim Bellarabi who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Henrikh Mkhitaryan and he is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Bernd Leno is alert and denies him with a nice save.
That's the end of the game for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, who is replaced by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).

OFF THE POST! Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the right post! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the top left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann made an astonishing save! The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Stuttgart.
Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post!

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Joel Matip (Schalke) inside the box and he manages to steer it under the bar. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Przemyslaw Tyton makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score. Schalke win a corner.
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Manuel Grafe ignores the protests.

What a chance that is! Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the bottom left corner is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper.
Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) executes a long-range free kick. His well-taken effort flies only inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.

Leroy Sane (Schalke) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Przemyslaw Tyton makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner. The ball is out of play and Schalke manage to earn a corner.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
The foul by Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
The end of the first half.
Referee Manuel Grafe blows his whistle to start the second half.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Franco Di Santo (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Leroy Sane (Schalke) is cautioned by the referee.

Leroy Sane (Schalke) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Przemyslaw Tyton is just a bystander as the ball flies into the left side of the goal. The score is 0:1.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Dennis Aogo (Schalke) for a tough tackle. Stuttgart earn a free kick.
Substitution. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Schalke) has come on for Leroy Sane.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch so that Alexandru Maxim can be given a rest.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Ralf Fahrmann.
The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save as he denies the first-time effort by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) from the edge of the box.
Substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Klaas-Jan Huntelaar walks off.
Substitution. Timo Werner is replaced by Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart).
Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to deny Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
What a big chance! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
It will be a substitution. Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) is ready to enter the pitch as Emiliano Insua walks off.
Here is a change. Max Meyer is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Benedikt Howedes (Schalke).
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Chance! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Kingsley Coman, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) receives a pass and doesn't hesitate to shoot from around 22 metres. And it was an excellent choice. His superb effort goes in off the right post.

A cross to the edge of the box finds Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt) who takes a nice first touch and tries to beat the keeper with a quick shot towards the bottom right corner. Manuel Neuer pulls off a good save and the score remains the same. The referee points to the corner flag and Darmstadt will take a corner.
Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
A substitution has been made. Dominik Stroh-Engel goes off and Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) comes on.
Goal! Sebastian Rode tees up Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) squanders a great opportunity after striking the ball onto the post!
Goal! The rebound fell to Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:3.
Here comes a substitution. Arturo Vidal is given a rest as he is replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).
Here is a change. Douglas Costa is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) replaces Peter Niemeyer.
Here comes a substitution. Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Jerome Boateng.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Dirk Schuster has decided to make a change. Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) replaces Konstantin Rausch.
Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make. Bayern Munich are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. A free kick to Darmstadt.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The game is over for Kevin Vogt. Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) comes on for the second half.

It's in the back of the net! Leonardo Bittencourt sends a superb cross into the box. Anthony Modeste (Koln) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header low inside the right post, leaving Yann Sommer beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) is punished with the yellow card.
The substitution is prepared. Nico Schulz (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ibrahima Traore.
Lucien Favre has decided to make a change. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Thorgan Hazard.
Substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud leaves the pitch and is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Leonardo Bittencourt and he is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Koln).
A yellow card for a tackle by Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The manager makes a subsitution with Simon Zoller (Koln) coming on for Yuya Osako.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.

Johan Djourou (Hamburger) wasted a golden opportunity after expertly receiving a cross from the free kick and shooting from close range. Unfortunately for him, his aim was off and he hit the crossbar!

Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) meets a pass on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the bottom right corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Lukas Hradecky pulls off an easy save. Hamburger SV force their opponents to concede a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box after picking up a pass, but produces a poor effort that sails high over the bar.

Stefan Reinartz (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom left corner. Jaroslav Drobny has a clear sight of it makes a comfortable save. Eintracht Frankfurt will take a corner kick.

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save. The linesman makes the right call and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a corner.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card. The referee Wolfgang Stark made the right call.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nicolai Muller trots off the pitch and is replaced by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger).
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card.
Substitution. Ivo Ilicevic makes way for Ivica Olic (Hamburger).
Today's match ends for Luc Castaignos who will be replaced by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The substitution is prepared. Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Pierre-Michel Lasogga.
Armin Veh prepares a substitution. Marc Stendera is replaced by Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
It's time for a substitution. Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Makoto Hasebe.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Ramazan Ozcan earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the six-yard box. Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Felix Wiedwald is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Ulisses Garcia will be replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The foul by Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
The manager makes a subsitution with Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) coming on for Lukas Hinterseer.

Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) tries his luck from a long-range free kick and the ball is aimed to the bottom right corner, but Felix Wiedwald is alert and thwarts the effort. The ball is out of play. Ingolstadt win a corner kick.

What a chance that is! Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
A substitution has been made. Clemens Fritz goes off and Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) comes on.

Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) gets a shot away from about 25 metres out after his amazing solo run. It goes to the bottom left corner, but Felix Wiedwald refuses to beaten easily and he pulls off an exquisite save to keep the ball out.
Substitution. Aron Johannsson is replaced by Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen).
Today's referee Bastian Dankert rightly decides to book Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) for his harsh tackle.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) gets a yellow card.
Substitution. Mathew Leckie walks off the pitch and Elias Kachunga (Ingolstadt) comes on as a substitute.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header narrowly over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Ingolstadt will have a goal kick.
Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) is penalised for holding. Bastian Dankert signals a set piece. Ingolstadt have been awarded a penalty kick!
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
Substitution. Stefan Lex will be replaced by Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt).
We have witnessed a sending-off! Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) is given a red card for his dangerous challenge. Bastian Dankert's decision is final.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Problems for Pal Dardai as Sebastian Langkamp is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) replaces him.

Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Diego Benaglio pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Gunter Perl starts the second half.
Thomas Kraft is being substituted because of an injury. Pal Dardai sends Rune Jarstein (Hertha Berlin) on the pitch.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg).
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) replaces Andre Schurrle.

Well-positioned Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the middle, but Thomas Kraft reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!
Here is a change. Nicklas Bendtner is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Bas Dost (Wolfsburg).
Goal! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) scores after an assist by Daniel Caligiuri that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
Substitution. Tolga Cigerci makes his way off the pitch and Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) comes on as his replacement.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Max Kruse walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg).
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. PENALTY to Wolfsburg! Let's see who will take responsibility.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card!
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) sends Thomas Kraft the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal - 0:1! Eugen Polanski tees up Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Loris Karius.

Yunus Malli (Mainz) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Oliver Baumann is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:1.

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Loris Karius made a crucial save! Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Markus Gisdol makes a half-time substitution. Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Fabian Schar.
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
CHANCE! Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Yunus Malli (Mainz) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the top left corner of the net.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) has a shot blocked from inside the box.
Goal! Yunus Malli (Mainz) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:1.
Here's the change. Jin-Su Kim leaves the pitch and Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim) replaces Pirmin Schwegler.
Substitution. Yoshinori Muto did his best and is replaced by Florian Niederlechner (Mainz).
Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Loris Karius.
Substitution. Yunus Malli walks off the pitch and Suat Serdar (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Booking. Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) receives a caution from the referee.
Substitution. Pablo De Blasis makes his way off the pitch and Devante Parker (Mainz) comes on as his replacement.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. The referee points to the penalty spot. Schalke are awarded a penalty kick!
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the right post, but Loris Karius leaps out to thwart his attempt.

Max Meyer (Schalke) takes a brilliant touch after he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and strikes the ball to the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper dives low and saves his attempt. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Schalke.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) plants a goal-bound header towards the right post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders reacts superbly and makes a timely interception.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Pierre Bengtsson (Mainz).
Johannes Geis takes the corner and Joel Matip (Schalke) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the left side of the goal. The score is 1:0.
Danny Latza (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann had an easy-decision to make.
Christian Clemens (Mainz) received a precise low pass and attempted to surprise the keeper with a quick execution. A superb strike only denied by the right post.
Goal! Yunus Malli (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect strike that goes inside the left post.
It will be a substitution. Leroy Sane (Schalke) is ready to enter the pitch as Maxim Choupo-Moting walks off.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Christian Clemens is replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Stefan Bell (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Robert Hartmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Danny Latza and he is replaced by Phillipp Klement (Mainz).
Joel Matip (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Robert Hartmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Pierre Bengtsson makes way for Florian Niederlechner (Mainz).

What an opportunity! Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the right side of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann reacts superbly to keep the ball out. Corner kick. Mainz will have an opportunity.
It is time for a substitution. Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) is on for Max Meyer.
Substitution. Johannes Geis will be replaced by Kaan Ayhan (Schalke).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jochen Drees had an easy-decision to make.
Goal - 1:2! Anthony Ujah laid the ball off to Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen), who shot from close range into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Markus Gisdol probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Steven Zuber. He is replaced by Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim).
Half-time substitution. Kevin Kuranyi will not participate anymore and Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) is coming on.
Goal! Mark Uth slips it to Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box and he lashes the ball low into the middle of the net. The score is 1:2.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Jochen Drees didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Felix Wiedwald makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal. Corner kick. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity.
A yellow card for a tackle by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim). Jochen Drees doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) on for Aron Johannsson.
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Ulisses Garcia. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Felix Kroos did his best and is replaced by Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen).
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) picks up a yellow card.
Goal Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen)! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) was put through by Fin Bartels and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the left side of the net. 1:2.
Jochen Drees is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header inside the right post. Excellent finish.

Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Timo Horn, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) collects a sweet pass and fires a low shot into the bottom left corner. What a goal!
Spectacular goal! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) brilliantly darts into the box to latch on to a cross and fires the ball in off the bottom of the right post, leaving the goalkeeper stunned!

A perfect lofted pass from Simon Zoller finds Anthony Modeste (Koln), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Lukas Hradecky had no chance of stopping that. 3:1.
Goal! Makoto Hasebe plays a pass to the feet of Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 4:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Simon Zoller will be replaced by Philipp Hosiner (Koln).
It is time for a substitution. Yuya Osako (Koln) is on for Leonardo Bittencourt.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Stefan Reinartz (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card!
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. If it wasn't for Lukas Hradecky's superb save the ball would have probably ended up in the bottom right corner.
Goal! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Luc Castaignos, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 5:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dusan Svento (Koln) comes onto the pitch for Anthony Modeste.

It's in the back of the net! Dominique Heintz (Koln) gets on the scoresheet after converting a chance from the resulting corner kick. He finds himself some space inside the box and plants a perfect header into the top of the net. 4:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luc Castaignos trots off the pitch and is replaced by Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. The ball would have probably ended inside the right post, if Timo Horn hadn't made a superb save. The ball is out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt win a corner kick.

Johannes Flum sends a superb cross into the box. Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the roof of the net, leaving Timo Horn beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 6:2.
The referee signals a substitution. Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Alexander Meier.
Jonas Hector (Koln) receives a yellow card.
Here is a change. Marc Stendera is going off and Armin Veh gives the last tactical orders to Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

Perfectly taken free kick!Konstantin Rausch sends a cross in and Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the top of the net and the score changes to 0:1.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Peter Sippel shows a yellow card to Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly over the bar. The goalkeeper was lucky!
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Peter Sippel after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box to the right side of the goal, but Christian Mathenia shows his agility and makes a save.
The game has come to an end for Christoph Kramer. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here is a change. Hakan Calhanoglu is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen).
Dirk Schuster has decided to substitute Dominik Stroh-Engel and he is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt).
Christian Mathenia (Darmstadt) receives a yellow card.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Substitution. Julian Brandt did his best and is replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Dirk Schuster has decided to make a change. Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) replaces Konstantin Rausch.

What a save from Christian Mathenia! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jan Rosenthal as he is replaced by Marco Sailer (Darmstadt).
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a chance to score! He produces a header from inside the box, but it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked for saying more than Peter Sippel was willing to tolerate.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a save from Marwin Hitz! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.

An absolutely sensational volley by Alexander Esswein (Augsburg). He took a shot from inside the penalty area and the ball went in just under the crossbar. All credit to Alexander Esswein (Augsburg), excellent finish.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Knut Kircher blows his whistle to start the second half.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Marwin Hitz.
Here's the change. Arturo Vidal leaves the pitch and Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) unleashes a mid-range direct free kick, but sees his strike well saved by the goalkeeper.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Halil Altintop (Augsburg) replaces Alexander Esswein.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) will replace Raul Bobadilla.
Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:1.
Knut Kircher blows his whistle. Markus Feulner (Augsburg) commits a foul after dangerous play. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Bayern Munich.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) receives a yellow card for chasing the referee and shouting at him.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
The substitution has been made. Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) has replaced Thomas Muller.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Dominik Kohr is replaced by Tim Matavz (Augsburg).
Substitution. Philipp Lahm leaves the pitch and is replaced by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal - 1:0! Leon Andreasen laid the ball off to Artur Sobiech (Hannover), who unleashed a strong shot from close range into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Martins Felipe (Hannover) commits a minor foul to interrupt the attacking move of his opponent and is warned by the referee that he will get a yellow card if he does it again. The referee blows his whistle and awards Dortmund a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
Goal! Matthias Ginter displays great vision and sends a pass to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the left post. The score is 1:2.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Daniel Siebert starts the second half.
The free kick into the box finds Salif Sane (Hannover), who heads the ball towards the right post, but the keeper pulls off a fantastic reflex save. Great goalkeeping skills.

Edgar Prib produces a sweet pass and picks out Artur Sobiech (Hannover) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:2!
Mats Hummels (Dortmund) sees a yellow card from Daniel Siebert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The substitution is prepared. Adnan Januzaj (Dortmund) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jonas Hofmann.
Substitution. Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) replaces Julian Weigl.
This is definitely not what Martins Felipe (Hannover) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 2:3.
Here comes a substitution. Charlison Benschop (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Oliver Sorg.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover) for Hiroshi Kiyotake.
Michael Frontzeck has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) replacing Edgar Prib.
PENALTY to Dortmund! Great chance to score. Martins Felipe (Hannover) changes the direction of the ball using his hand, but he is angry when the referee gives a foul against him.
Martins Felipe (Hannover) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Ron-Robert Zieler (Hannover) is cautioned by the referee after being shown a yellow card for dissent.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is going to take the penalty!
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) sends Ron-Robert Zieler the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Shinji Kagawa will be replaced by Sven Bender (Dortmund).
Salif Sane (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal - 1:0! Mitchell Weiser laid the ball off to Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) receives a good pass just outside the box, unleashes a strike from a promising position, but the shot is blocked by the defender.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) misses a good chance to score. A perfect cross into the box finds Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) who rises for a header, but he sends the ball well over the bar.

Perfectly taken free kick! Daniel Didavi sends the ball in, Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a bullet of a header into the roof of the net. It's 1:0.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a cross on the edge of the box and fires a shot at goal, but his effort was blocked by one of the defenders. The ball goes out of play. Stuttgart are awarded a corner kick.
Pal Dardai is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Roy Beerens suffers an injury and Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the top right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Odisseas Vlachodimos, so the score changes to 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Tobias Stieler blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the bottom right corner is thwarted by Odisseas Vlachodimos. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Hertha Berlin will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That's the end of the game for Martin Harnik, who is replaced by Robbie Kruse (VfB Stuttgart).
Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches over the bar.
The whistle blows and Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) is booked for an infringement.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch for Filip Kostic.
Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
That will be all from Salomon Kalou who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Daniel Didavi walks off the pitch and Arianit Ferati (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Toni Sunjic (VfB Stuttgart) is quickest inside the box and jumps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it flies just wide of the right post.
Substitution. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) replaces Per Skjelbred.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) holds his head in his hands after wasting a promising chance. He latches onto a rebound, creates some space for himself and fires the ball from the edge of the box well wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Ingolstadt.
A yellow card for a tackle by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg). Sascha Stegemann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.

Ambitious effort from Bas Dost (Wolfsburg). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Ingolstadt.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) will replace Moritz Hartmann.

Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the top left corner. Ramazan Ozcan has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. The linesman makes the right call and Wolfsburg will have a corner.
It is time for a substitution. Max Kruse (Wolfsburg) is on for Andre Schurrle.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) replaces Lukas Hinterseer.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bas Dost departs the field of play to be replaced by Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg).
The foul by Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.
Here comes a substitution. Luiz Gustavo is given a rest as he is replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
