Here is a change. Mathew Leckie is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Elias Kachunga (Ingolstadt).
Naldo (Wolfsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Ramazan Ozcan.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) whips a volley from long range towards the goal. His beautiful effort whistles wide of the right post. It was close and it could have been a top class goal!
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 0:1.
Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
The score has changed  0:2. Ivo Ilicevic sends a fantastic cross into the box from the corner. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) jumps highest and plants a header into the middle of the net.
Tobias Welz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Jaroslav Drobny finds Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) on the edge of the area, he times his run to perfection and beautifully chips the ball over the goalkeeper. 0:3.
That will be all from Roel Brouwers who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Lars Stindl is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Welz had an easy-decision to make.
Problems for Lucien Favre as Martin Stranzl is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) replaces him.
Substitution. Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) in, Aaron Hunt out.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to substitute Nicolai Muller and he is replaced by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger).
A yellow card is awarded to Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Cleber (Hamburger) replaces Johan Djourou.
Tobias Welz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Felix Wiedwald, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.

Yann Sommer pulls off a stunning save to block the free kick from Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen). The ball was heading towards the left side of the goal. The referee blows his whistle, Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests. A free kick to Werder Bremen.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Marvin Schulz (B. Monchengladbach) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Felix Zwayer blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. It's a penalty! Werder Bremen have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) is going to take the penalty!
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) steps up and confidently powers his spot-kick into the bottom right corner.
Goal! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Thorgan Hazard, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Felix Zwayer blows his whistle to start the second half.
Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.
The corner from Zlatko Junuzovic goes into a dangerous area and finds Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen), who outjumps the defence and glances a header into the back of the net. 1:1.
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.

Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms over the bar.
CLOSE! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the left post!
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle. B. Monchengladbach have a free kick.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Werder Bremen earn a free kick.
It's time for a substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) comes on in place of Havard Nordtveit.

Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. The ball goes behind for a corner. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Here is a change. Aron Johannsson is going off and Viktor Skripnik gives the last tactical orders to Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann walks off the pitch and Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.

Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) doesn't hesitate and begins a run towards the opponent's goal. Defenders try to tackle him, but he manages to keep the ball at his feet and pulls the trigger in front of the goal. The strike, though, was not as successful as the solo run and the ball is easily stopped by the keeper. B. Monchengladbach force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Substitution. Ulisses Garcia leaves the pitch and is replaced by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Raffael is replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) gets inside the penalty area and sends a powerful shot that almost ends inside the net. The keeper is alert and makes a good save.
The game has come to an end for Zlatko Junuzovic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen).

Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of a pass and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by one of the defending players. Werder Bremen force their opponents to concede a corner.
Werder Bremen are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card in the hand of Felix Zwayer. And as it's a second one this game, a red follows and Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is sent from the pitch.
Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) can't convert the spot kick. It goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Felix Wiedwald (Werder Bremen) gets booked.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) picks up the rebound on the edge of the box and shoots. His effort, however, only finds the gloves of the opponent's goalkeeper.
It's in the back of the net! Shinji Kagawa puts the ball on a plate for Mats Hummels (Dortmund), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 1:0.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires from the edge of the box to the middle of the goal, but Thomas Kraft is equal to it. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Dortmund.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge. Dortmund are awarded a free kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Pal Dardai probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Valentin Stocker. He is replaced by Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin).
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Goal! Matthias Ginter feeds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 2:0.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) received a pass and didn't think long what to do with it. He fired a powerful long-range shot which went painfully close to the bar.
Substitution. Per Skjelbred makes way for Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).

Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) outjumped the defenders to meet the ball from the free kick and plants a precise header from deep inside the box towards the net! The goalkeeper shows his reflexes and superbly keeps the ball out!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) replaces Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) replaces Johannes van den Bergh.
CLOSE! Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the left post!
What a big chance! Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:1.
Substitution. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) in, Ilkay Gundogan out.
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Marco Reus is replaced by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund).
CHANCE! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.
It's a goal! Henrikh Mkhitaryan plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Adrian Ramos (Dortmund). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 3:1.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Florian Meyer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Bayer Leverkusen have a free kick.
Christoph Kramer (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Florian Meyer ignores the protests. Bayern Munich will take a free kick.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Goal! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:0. He was ably assisted there by Douglas Costa.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) takes the resulting free kick from long range. His powerful shot heads towards the roof of the net, but Manuel Neuer dives and saves the effort, punching it onto the bar. The ball goes behind for a corner. Bayer Leverkusen will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Roger Schmidt makes a half-time substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Admir Mehmedi.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Manuel Neuer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Bayer Leverkusen.
A player from Bayer Leverkusen pulled an opponent down, forcing the referee to blow his whistle. The referee blows his whistle and awards Bayern Munich a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Bernd Leno to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Today's match ends for Hakan Calhanoglu who will be replaced by Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen).

Handball by Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen). PENALTY to Bayern Munich! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) is going to take the penalty!
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
Goal, no wait. Florian Meyer blows his whistle for handball and Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.
Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) is cautioned by the referee.
Substitution. Juan Bernat walks off the pitch and Dante (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his low strike to the middle of the target as Bernd Leno produces a good save.
Roger Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Wendell.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Arjen Robben departs the field of play to be replaced by Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich).

Close! Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) replaces Thiago Alcantara.

Close! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) picks up a pass and produces a ferocious strike towards the right post, but the goalkeeper gets his fingertips to the ball to keep it out. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Jochen Drees didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Today's referee Jochen Drees rightly decides to book Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.

Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Marwin Hitz. The referee points to the corner flag and Ingolstadt will take a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Francisco Caiuby is replaced by Tim Matavz (Augsburg).
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jochen Drees ignores the protests.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) for Halil Altintop.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Moritz Hartmann and he is replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 25 metres out which goes into the top right corner.
Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jochen Drees had an easy-decision to make.

Tobias Werner (Augsburg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from near the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the left post!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) replaces Markus Suttner.
Here's the change. Lukas Hinterseer leaves the pitch and Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) comes on as a substitute.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Dominik Kohr is replaced by Sascha Molders (Augsburg).
The foul by Tim Matavz (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jochen Drees.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) has an effort on goal, but he misses to the right of the goal.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) is booked.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) gets a yellow card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
The referee gives a yellow card to Gyorgy Garics (Darmstadt).
Substitution. Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) has come on for Steven Zuber.
Here is a change. Pirmin Schwegler is going off and Markus Gisdol gives the last tactical orders to Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim).

Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom right corner. His promising effort is kept out by Christian Mathenia, who pulls off a stunning save! The referee signals a corner kick to Hoffenheim.
Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and sends a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Christian Mathenia.
Substitution. Marco Sailer is replaced by Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt).
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) replaces Mark Uth.

Sebastian Rudy slides a brilliant pass into Kevin Kuranyi (Hoffenheim), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Darmstadt will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Peter Niemeyer makes his way off the pitch and Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) comes on as his replacement.
Dirk Schuster has decided to substitute Dominik Stroh-Engel and he is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt).

Excellent touch by Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and produces a low drive towards the right post. The goalkeeper pulls off a beautiful save to deny him. Hoffenheim will take a corner kick.
Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) has a sight of goal and shoots towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes a superb save. Darmstadt force their opponents to concede a corner.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Rene Adler is substituted due to injury. Bruno Labbadia gives a chance to Andreas Hirzel (Hamburger).
Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) picked up a yellow card from referee. There is a free kick near the sideline to Hamburger SV.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Bruno Labbadia gives a chance to Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) and Gideon Jung is off.
Goal! Sven Schipplock produces a great pass that finds Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 0:0.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) receives a yellow card.
Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Milos Jojic (Koln) on for Matthias Lehmann.

Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) strikes the ball towards the top right corner of the goal and raises his hands to celebrate, but the goalkeeper somehow manages to deny his attempt. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Hamburger SV will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

OFF THE BAR! Anthony Modeste (Koln) unleashes a thunderous effort from the edge of the box and the ball crashes off the woodwork. What a strike that was! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Substitution. Pawel Olkowski walks off the pitch and Philipp Hosiner (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Kevin Vogt (Koln) is booked by the referee.
Goal! Jonas Hector puts a cross into the box and finds Philipp Hosiner (Koln), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the top left corner. He makes it 1:1.
Deniz Aytekin has a clear sight and sees a foul from Emir Spahic (Hamburger). The referee points to the penalty spot. FC Koln are awarded a penalty kick!
The referee interrupts the game and gives Emir Spahic (Hamburger) a red card. No amount of arguing will help him escape the punishment.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) fires the penalty inside the left post.
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Simon Zoller is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln).
Marcel Risse (Koln) receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Lewis Holtby walks off.
Cleber (Hamburger) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his shot flies just wide of the right post.
Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) passes the ball onto Anthony Modeste, but one of the defenders dispossesses him. FC Koln force their opponents to concede a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Fabian Frei is substituted due to injury. Martin Schmidt gives a chance to Danny Latza (Mainz).
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) scores an easy goal. He receives a precise pass inside the box and sends the ball past the goalkeeper, glancing in off the right post.
Goal! Stefan Bell gets up really well from the corner and heads the ball into the six-yard box where Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) glances a header into the net. 2:0.
Salif Sane (Hannover) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Peter Sippel has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Michael Frontzeck probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Uffe Bech. He is replaced by Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover).
The game is over for Felix Klaus. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) comes on for the second half.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Yunus Malli (Mainz), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 3:0.

Yunus Malli (Mainz) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the top left corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler was alert and the score remains the same. The ball goes out of play. Mainz are awarded a corner kick.
Charlison Benschop (Hannover) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
Edgar Prib (Hannover) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Martin Schmidt is forced to make a change. Leon Balogun is unable to continue due to injury, Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) comes on.
Substitution. Charlison Benschop leaves the pitch and is replaced by Artur Sobiech (Hannover).

What a chance that is! Christian Clemens (Mainz) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the crossbar!
Peter Sippel shows a yellow card to Oliver Sorg (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
Here's the change. Yoshinori Muto leaves the pitch and Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Off the post! Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the left post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
It's an own goal! A pitiful moment for Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but instead sends the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 0:0.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! Serey Die passes the ball to the feet of Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:1.
Chance! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Filip Kostic, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.
Goal! Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Haris Seferovic. The score is 1:2.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Armin Veh has made a change at the break. Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on in place of Timothy Chandler.
The game is over for Marco Russ. David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on for the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Martin Harnik is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A yellow card for a tackle by David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Lukas Hradecky makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal. Stuttgart get a corner.
Bastian Dankert blows the whistle, Przemyslaw Tyton (VfB Stuttgart) is penalised for a foul. Penalty awarded! Eintracht Frankfurt will take a penalty kick.
Przemyslaw Tyton (VfB Stuttgart) expresses his disappointment as he receives a straight red card.
Alexander Zorniger has decided to make a change due to the red card. Odisseas Vlachodimos (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Daniel Didavi.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) steps up and confidently powers his spot-kick into the bottom right corner.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
It's time for a substitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Marc Stendera.
Here's the change. Geoffroy Serey Die leaves the pitch and Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.

Goal Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt)! Luc Castaignos (Eintracht Frankfurt) was put through by Stefan Reinartz and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 1:4.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would probably have ended up in the bottom left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a decent save to thwart him.
What a hit! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the middle of the net. 1:0.
Leroy Sane (Schalke) blows a good chance to score. He collects a pass inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the goal is brilliantly blocked. Great defending!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Sascha Riether (Schalke) for his blatant foul. A free kick to Wolfsburg.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post.
Felix Brych blows the whistle, Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) is penalised for a foul. PENALTY! Wonderful opportunity to score for Wolfsburg.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Goal! Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom right corner.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting will be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).

Ricardo Rodriguez produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Timm Klose (Wolfsburg) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball low into the middle of the net. What a brilliant finish. 3:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leon Goretzka (Schalke) comes onto the pitch so that Leroy Sane can be given a rest.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dennis Aogo (Schalke). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Wolfsburg are awarded a free kick.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Julian Draxler is replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
CHANCE! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he sends his shot well wide of the left post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) coming on for Daniel Caligiuri.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Bas Dost and he is replaced by Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg).
Max Kruse will be replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a chance that is! Yunus Malli (Mainz) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the left post!
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

What a great touch by Fabian Frei (Mainz)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
Goal Jairo Samperio (Mainz)! Jairo Samperio (Mainz) was put through by Christian Clemens and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Fabian Frei (Mainz) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Deniz Aytekin starts the second half.
Goal - 1:1! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Lars Stindl provided an assist for the goal.
Close! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Substitution. Yunus Malli is replaced by Danny Latza (Mainz).
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Christian Clemens (Mainz) was like a fox in the box, burying the ball into the bottom right corner of the goal. Excellent finish!
Patrick Herrmann will be replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Lars Stindl is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Christian Clemens did his best and is replaced by Leon Balogun (Mainz).
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Thorgan Hazard walks off the pitch to be replaced by Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach).
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) for a heavy challenge.
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) replaces Yoshinori Muto.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Chance! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Shinji Kagawa, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Ingolstadt will have a goal kick.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) for a heavy challenge.
A yellow card for a tackle by Roger (Ingolstadt). Christian Dingert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Today's referee Christian Dingert rightly decides to book Neven Subotic (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Christian Dingert starts the second half.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Benjamini Hubner and he is replaced by Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt).
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Roman Burki gets down to his right to keep it out.
Goal - 0:1! Henrikh Mkhitaryan laid the ball off to Matthias Ginter (Dortmund), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
Substitution. Moritz Hartmann will be replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
Substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan walks off the pitch and Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Konstantin Engel makes way for Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt).
Here comes a substitution. Marco Reus is given a rest as he is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Goal! Jonas Hofmann tees up Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 0:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Shinji Kagawa.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) meets a perfect cross from Jonas Hofmann deep inside the box, and he produces an accurate strike which goes into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:4.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) jumps inside the box to meet the corner and aims a header towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him.
Goal! Daniel Didavi slips it to Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) on the edge of the box and he finds the left side of the net with a great effort. The score is 0:1.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Gunter Perl ignores the protests.
Lukas Rupp (VfB Stuttgart) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a precise shot inside the right post. What a lovely finish!
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players. Stuttgart will take a corner kick.
It's in the back of the net! Christian Gentner is the provider as he slips the ball to Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:2.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Today's referee Gunter Perl rightly decides to book Johan Djourou (Hamburger) for his harsh tackle. That's a free kick to Stuttgart.

The free kick from long distance is taken by Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a yellow card.
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) is sent off! He justly receives a yellow card and it is his second one, a red card must be given. The match ends for him.
Alexander Zorniger has decided to make a change. Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Lukas Rupp.
Substitution. Lewis Holtby makes way for Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ivica Olic (Hamburger) replaces Sven Schipplock.
The foul by Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Gunter Perl.
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Filip Kostic.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) replacing Michael Gregoritsch.
Goal! Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 2:2.
A substitution has been made. Daniel Didavi goes off and Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) breaks past challenges inside the box, but puts too much pace on his pass to Ivica Olic.
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Pierre-Michel Lasogga and Johan Djourou (Hamburger) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 3:2.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) latches on to a pass inside the box and strikes the ball to the middle of the goal, but one of the defending players makes a goal-line clearance. The linesman makes the right call and Augsburg will have a corner.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make. Augsburg earn a free kick.

Halil Altintop passes to Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top of the net. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:1.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the left side of the goal, but Marwin Hitz was alert and made an amazing save! The ball is out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt will have a chance to score from a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Armin Veh makes a switch. Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming on in place of Joel Gerezgiher at the start of the second period.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Florian Meyer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Eintracht Frankfurt win a free kick.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
A substitution has been made. Makoto Hasebe is replaced by Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Halil Altintop is replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Substitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt) on for Luc Castaignos.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Markus Feulner (Augsburg) replaces Alexander Esswein.
Lukas Hradecky pulls off a great save to deny Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.

Lukas Hradecky can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Tobias Werner (Augsburg). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.

Goal! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt displays great vision and sends a pass to Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:1.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked.
Florian Meyer shows the yellow card to Markus Feulner (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Tobias Werner makes way for Sascha Molders (Augsburg).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
GOAL! Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Koen Casteels, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Knut Kircher blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Excellent touch by Simon Zoller (Koln)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) connects with a cross on the edge of the box, controls the ball and pulls the trigger. Koen Casteels makes a beautiful save to deny his effort which would have ended inside the left post.

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The referee signals a corner kick to Wolfsburg.
Here is a change. Aaron Hunt is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
A substitution has been made. Leonardo Bittencourt is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Koln).
Knut Kircher shows the yellow card to Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.
Here's the change. Ivan Perisic leaves the pitch and Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Kevin Vogt (1. FC Koln) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Knut Kircher didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Milos Jojic (Koln) for Simon Zoller.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) replacing Max Kruse.

What a wasted opportunity by Bas Dost (Wolfsburg)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom left corner, but Timo Horn makes an astonishing save to thwart him.
Goal! Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
Timm Klose (Wolfsburg) picks up a caution.

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Timo Horn inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the bottom left corner, but was denied by a great save.

Naldo (Wolfsburg) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross from the resulting free kick and attempts to score with a header from near the penalty spot. His effort lacks accuracy and bounces away off the bar.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

Bernd Leno hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Charlison Benschop (Hannover) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a missile into the roof of the net via the free kick. Wonderful goal!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Wolfgang Stark has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a mid-range free kick and his stunning strike crashes against the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mevlut Erdinc trots off the pitch and is replaced by Allan Saint-Maximin (Hannover).
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change. Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Julian Brandt.
A substitution has been made. Charlison Benschop goes off and Artur Sobiech (Hannover) comes on.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Leon Andreasen (Hannover) for Manuel Schmiedebach.
Roger Schmidt prepares a substitution. Admir Mehmedi is replaced by Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen).

Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) releases a powerful first-time effort from the edge of the box which goes low in the direction of the middle of the target, but the keeper reacts quickly enough to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping!

Bernd Leno makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Christian Schulz (Hannover) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of inside the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming onto the pitch as Hakan Calhanoglu cannot continue after picking up an injury.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 1:0.

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball towards the roof of the net. Oliver Baumann shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net. Bayern Munich get a corner.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) fires a brilliant shot from the edge of the box, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Mehdi Benatia is substituted due to injury. Pep Guardiola gives a chance to Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.
Goal! The rebound fell to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:1.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Arjen Robben.
Today's referee Tobias Stieler rightly decides to book Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
That's the end of the game for Jonathan Schmid, who is replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim).

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Philipp Lahm can be given a rest.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) replaces Kevin Kuranyi.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Handball by Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich). PENALTY to Hoffenheim! Great chance to score.
It's too late to protest, Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) has to leave the pitch after receiving a second yellow card.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) fails to score from the penalty as his shot only hits the right post. The ball is out of play. Hoffenheim win a corner kick.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Yellow card. Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Rafinha (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. If it wasn't for Oliver Baumann's superb save the ball would have probably ended up in the bottom right corner. Bayern Munich earn a corner.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) escapes his marker to meet a cross and heads to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent reflex save to deny him.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header only flies onto the right post and away off it!
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Mario Gotze, then sends the ball low into the middle of the net. 1:2.
Fabian Schar will be replaced by Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Konstantin Rausch (Darmstadt) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the right post.
What a great effort! Julian Draxler (Schalke) decides to unleash a long-range shot. Despite hitting it very well, it scorches inches wide of the left post. We could have witnessed a magnificent goal.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. If it wasn't for Christian Mathenia's superb save the ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
Ralf Fahrmann was forced into action to thwart Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.

Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but Ralf Fahrmann makes a brilliant save!
What a chance! Julian Draxler (Schalke) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

GOAL! Superb work from Franco Di Santo, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Julian Draxler (Schalke), who beats Christian Mathenia with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 1:1.

Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the right post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it. Darmstadt win a corner.
Substitution. Mario Vrancic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Marco Sailer (Darmstadt).
A yellow card for a tackle by Marco Sailer (Darmstadt). Benjamin Brand doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Christian Mathenia makes a comfortable save.
That's a clear yellow card. Julian Draxler (Schalke) goes into the book.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Max Meyer (Schalke) replaces Franco Di Santo.
Johannes Geis (Schalke) tries to beat the goalkeeper from a set piece from some 22 metres out. He's very close, but his effort only bounces off the crossbar!
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Substitution. Marco Hoger makes way for Leroy Sane (Schalke).

Roman Neustadter (Schalke) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His header would probably have ended up inside the bottom right corner, but Christian Mathenia pulls off a decent save to thwart him.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) reacts well to get to the rebound and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but he fails to get the ball through the players standing between him and the goal.
Here is a change. Dominik Stroh-Engel is going off and Dirk Schuster gives the last tactical orders to Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt).
It is time for a substitution. Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) is on for Konstantin Rausch.
The referee shows the yellow card to Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt).
Max Meyer (Schalke) unleashes a decent strike, but it goes painfully wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Darmstadt will have a goal kick.
That's it for today, Benjamin Brand has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top of the net. He makes it 1:0.
The resulting corner comes to nothing as Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) sends it out of play.
Nothing comes of the resulting corner from Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin). The defence is alert and manages to cut it out.

Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) meets a perfect cross from Ulisses Garcia deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces a low shot into the middle of the goal. The score has changed to 1:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sascha Stegemann has ended it.
Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) wastes a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box after firing the ball a few inches over the crossbar.

Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Felix Wiedwald anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going low into the middle of the target.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) picks up a caution.
Maximilian Eggestein goes off the pitch and Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) will replace Jens Hegeler.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) replacing Aron Johannsson.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) receives a cross from the resulting free kick and shoots! However, his effort from just outside the box crashes against the crossbar. What an opportunity!
Salomon Kalou will be replaced by Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Valentin Stocker will be replaced by John Brooks (Hertha Berlin).
Viktor Skripnik has decided to make a change. Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) replaces Zlatko Junuzovic.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was!
Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Yannick Gerhardt is replaced by Kevin Vogt (Koln).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yuya Osako (Koln) will replace Milos Jojic.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) for a tough tackle.
Kevin Vogt (1. FC Koln) is booked for saying more than Wolfgang Stark was willing to tolerate.
Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
The foul by Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Wolfgang Stark.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Pawel Olkowski and he is replaced by Simon Zoller (Koln).
A yellow card for a tackle by Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart). Wolfgang Stark doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the rebound and shoots. The goalkeeper was ready and denies his effort with a fine save.
Przemyslaw Tyton (VfB Stuttgart) makes a slide tackle, but referee Wolfgang Stark blows for a foul. PENALTY! One of the players from FC Koln is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Przemyslaw Tyton to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
A substitution has been made. Lukas Rupp goes off and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Simon Zoller (Koln) receives a brilliant pass inside the box from Kevin Vogt, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:2.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
Alexander Zorniger has decided to make a change. Jan Kliment (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Martin Harnik.
Emiliano Insua will be replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Goal! Anthony Modeste puts the ball on a plate for Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:3.
Wolfgang Stark is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Max Kruse produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) rises high to head the ball into the bottom left corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.
Goal! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top left corner. It's 2:0.

It's a goal! Stefan Reinartz (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes it 2:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Haris Seferovic and planted his close-range header into the top of the net. Koen Casteels was helpless.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) argues with the referee and is booked for dissent.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Armin Veh makes a switch. Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming on in place of Takashi Inui at the start of the second period.
It's time for a substitution. Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Kevin De Bruyne.
Armin Veh has decided to substitute Marco Russ and he is replaced by Joel Gerezgiher (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That will be all from Maximilian Arnold who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg).
Armin Veh prepares a substitution. Luc Castaignos is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt).

What a save from Koen Casteels! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Bas Dost.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Goal! Shinji Kagawa displays great vision and sends a pass to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the left post. The score is 1:0.

Marcel Schmelzer sends a superb cross into the box. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the right post, leaving Yann Sommer beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:0.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang passes the ball to the feet of Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 3:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Marco Reus feeds Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 4:0.
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Ibrahima Traore is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) for Josip Drmic.
What a huge chance for Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang leaves the pitch and Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) comes on.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Marco Reus and he is replaced by Kevin Kampl (Dortmund).
The manager makes a subsitution with Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) coming on for Granit Xhaka.
It's time for a substitution. Sven Bender (Dortmund) comes on in place of Shinji Kagawa.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the left post.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.

Tobias Werner (Augsburg) attempts to curl the ball over the wall from the free kick, but one of the defenders deflects it away from danger. Augsburg have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) picks up a pass and fires a powerful long-range shot which goes painfully close to the left post.
Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the underside of the crossbar is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.

Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the bottom left corner, but it wasn't dangerous and Marwin Hitz made a comfortable save. The ball goes out of play. Hertha Berlin are awarded a corner kick.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Tobias Welz blows his whistle for a foul. Hertha Berlin are awarded a penalty kick!
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Marwin Hitz to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision. A free kick to Augsburg.
Markus Feulner (Augsburg) takes the free kick from the edge of the box, but Thomas Kraft reacts well to deny him. His low shot went towards the middle of the goal.
Valentin Stocker comes off the pitch to be replaced by Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin).
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Halil Altintop is replaced by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
Tobias Welz blows his whistle and Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Markus Feulner trots off the pitch and is replaced by Philipp Max (Augsburg).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) for Salomon Kalou.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) gets a yellow card. Augsburg are awarded a free kick on the edge of the box.

Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) takes the free kick from just outside the box and attempts to convert it into a goal. He hits it magnificently and the keeper must be relieved to see the ball hit the right post and ricochet away.

Great solo effort by Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) as he tricks his way through the defence before firing a low drive from just outside of the box towards the middle of the goal. Marwin Hitz is alert and denies him.
Today's referee Tobias Welz rightly decides to book Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) for his harsh tackle. Hertha Berlin are awarded the free kick.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked. Now Augsburg have a corner.
Here comes a substitution. Dominik Kohr is given a rest as he is replaced by Sascha Molders (Augsburg).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) replaces Jens Hegeler.
Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) decides to keep the ball to himself and weaves through the defence into the box. From there he takes a shot which goes narrowly wide of the target.
Close! Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) picks up a pass and produces a ferocious strike towards the right post, but the goalkeeper gets his fingertips to the ball to keep it out.

Thomas Kraft pulls off a great save to deny Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Sascha Molders (Augsburg) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Thomas Kraft, who pulls off a stunning save!
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Goal - 0:1! Eugen Polanski tees up Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Bernd Leno.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann had an easy-decision to make.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Bayer Leverkusen.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) drills a first-timer from the edge of the box that flew towards the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper stops the shot from going into his goal with a quick save.
Goal! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Hartmann has ended it.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) is coming onto the pitch as Kevin Kuranyi cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee signals a substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Lars Bender.

Ambitious effort from Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Heung-Min Son walks off the pitch to be replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. What a clinical finish!
The substitution is prepared. Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jonathan Schmid.

What a save from Oliver Baumann! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender. Now Bayer Leverkusen have a corner.
Eugen Polanski goes off the pitch and Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim) comes on.

Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Oliver Baumann thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and  replaces Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Kenan Karaman (Hannover) sees his header crash off the crossbar after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Ron-Robert Zieler with a precise strike which ricochets in off the crossbar. He makes it 1:0.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Marcelo (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
The end of the first half.
Felix Brych blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Felix Klaus is replaced by Charlison Benschop (Hannover).
Goal! Mevlut Erdinc produces a great pass that finds Charlison Benschop (Hannover) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a low shot into the back of the net. 1:0.

Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Ron-Robert Zieler with a precise strike which bounces off the bottom of the right post and into the back of the net. He makes it 2:1.
Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Felix Brych blows his whistle for an infringement. Hannover are awarded a penalty kick!
Caution goes to Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt).
Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) misses the penalty! Christian Mathenia shows good anticipation and saves the shot which goes low into the middle.
Mevlut Erdinc (Hannover) is going to take the penalty!
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him, it's into his own goal!
Dirk Schuster has decided to make a change. Tobias Kempe (Darmstadt) replaces Konstantin Rausch.
Substitution. Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) in, Marco Sailer out.
Michael Frontzeck has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Artur Sobiech (Hannover) replacing Mevlut Erdinc.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Artur Sobiech (Hannover), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt) latches on to a perfectly taken corner kick deep into the box and attempts to head home. His bullet header heads straight towards the roof of the net, but it's deflected onto the crossbar by the goalkeeper. A wonderful effort.
Today's match ends for Manuel Schmiedebach who will be replaced by Leon Andreasen (Hannover).
Substitution. Sandro Wagner (Darmstadt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Dominik Stroh-Engel walks off.
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Ramazan Ozcan pulls off a great save to deny Jairo Samperio (Mainz) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
The yellow card is received by Benjamini Hubner (Ingolstadt).
A goal, which was scored by Christian Clemens (Mainz), was disallowed due to offside.

Florian Niederlechner (Mainz) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ramazan Ozcan to get hold of the ball. Now Mainz have a corner.
Elias Kachunga (Ingolstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Moritz Hartmann.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Fantastic team goal! Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) was set free in the area by Alfredo Morales and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the right side of the net. 0:1.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) for Jairo Samperio.
Substitution. Florian Niederlechner is replaced by Yoshinori Muto (Mainz).
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robert Bauer (Ingolstadt) replacing Pascal Gross.
Substitution. Pierre Bengtsson will be replaced by Leon Balogun (Mainz).
Substitution. Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) replaces Lukas Hinterseer.
Konstantin Engel (Ingolstadt) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Matija Nastasic is substituted due to injury. Andre Breitenreiter gives a chance to Roman Neustadter (Schalke).
A beautiful low pass from the side is received by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), who was waiting for his chance. However, the defence is alert and spanks the ball away. Schalke have a corner.

Leon Goretzka (Schalke) wins the ball near the penalty spot and unleashes a header towards the left post, but Felix Wiedwald is alert and denies him. The linesman makes the right call and Schalke will have a corner.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the middle of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann was alert and made an astonishing save!
This is definitely not what Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 0:1.

Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 30 metres out, but it missed the left post by a whisker.
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Daniel Siebert starts the second half.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Felix Wiedwald, who makes a comfortable save.
Substitution. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) replaces Levin Oztunali.
Zlatko Junuzovic slides a brilliant pass into Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Franco Di Santo is replaced by Marco Hoger (Schalke).

Marco Hoger (Schalke) attempted to send a defence-splitting pass into space where Julian Draxler was lurking. It could have put him one-on-one with the goalkeeper, but one of the defending players somehow manages to avert the threat.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke). Joel Matip plays a fantastic through ball and finds Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
Substitution. Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) in, Clemens Fritz out.

The resulting free kick from 25 metres out taken by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) was blocked by the defensive wall, which was perfectly positioned by the goalkeeper. Now Werder Bremen have a corner.
Dennis Aogo (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card.

Ralf Fahrmann makes a brilliant save! Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the bottom left corner but is saved by the keeper!
Marco Hoger (Schalke) is given a yellow card.
Substitution. Leon Goretzka is replaced by Leroy Sane (Schalke).
Viktor Skripnik has decided to substitute Fin Bartels and he is replaced by Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen).

Goal! Leroy Sane displays great vision and sends a pass to Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:3.
Anthony Ujah (Werder Bremen) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender. The ball is out of play. Werder Bremen will have a chance to score from a corner.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Today's referee Bastian Dankert rightly decides to book Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
The game is interrupted. Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Philipp Lahm sends a terrific cross into the box. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

It's in the back of the net! Xabi Alonso flights the free kick into the box, where Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) peels off his marker and heads straight inside the upright from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 1:0.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
The whistle blows and Emir Spahic (Hamburger) is booked for an infringement.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a great shot into the bottom right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Rene Adler, so the score changes to 1:0.
Xabi Alonso comes off the pitch to be replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Albin Ekdal is replaced by Ivica Olic (Hamburger).
Rene Adler pulls off a great save to deny Rafinha (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
A substitution has been made. Arjen Robben goes off and Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) comes on.

A perfect lofted pass from Douglas Costa finds Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header in the countermovement of the goalkeeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Rene Adler had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) replacing Ivo Ilicevic.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Sven Schipplock will be replaced by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) blows a clear opportunity! He sends a rebound from close range narrowly wide of the left post.
Substitution. Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) replaces Philipp Lahm.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) collects a killer pass and fires a low shot into the middle of the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes inside the left post and past the goalkeeper.
That's it for today, Bastian Dankert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
